Giratina: Giratina uses its huge bulk and resistance to common attacking types to safely switch into most Mega Mewtwo X and threaten them with Prankster + Will-O-Wisp. Trick + Choice Scarf can cripple most Giratina variants, but it is ineffective if Giratina runs Griseous Orb.

Faster Offensive Pokemon: Offensive Pokemon that outspeed or Speed tie Mega Mewtwo X or Mega Mewtwo Y, such as opposing Mega Mewtwo X, opposing Mega Mewtwo Y, and powerful Choice Scarf threats, can force them out. However, most are unable to switch in safely.

Pursuit Trappers: Pursuit trappers, like -ate users and Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Regigigas threaten Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y with Sucker Punch and Pursuit.

Revenge Killers: Revenge killers like -ate Speed users and Huge Power Mega Gyarados force out Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y—unless they have King's Shield—with their priority attacks. Variants without Shadow Tag or Shed Shell may also be trapped and KOed by Shadow Tag users such as Regigigas, Choice Scarf Primal Groudon, and Choice Scarf Mega Mewtwo Y.

Mega Beedrill: Mega Beedrill is a good offensive check to both Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, as it outpaces both and can use U-turn to escape from Shadow Tag variants not holding a Choice Scarf, chipping Mega Mewtwo X and threatening to OHKO Mega Mewtwo Y.

King's Shield: Some King's Shield users, such as Primal Groudon and Wonder Guard Mega Audino, can use King's Shield to both scout Mega Mewtwo X's moves and lower its Attack.

Huge Power (Mewtwo-Mega-X).description:
Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X is one of the most well-known figures and strongest wallbreakers in the metagame. Its Huge Power-boosted attacks can tear through almost any team, and very few Pokemon can take a hit from it. However, Mega Mewtwo X still requires careful optimization with its moves. The first move is Fairy- or Dark-type to force out or cripple its best tank, Giratina. Dark-type moves also target Psychic-type Wonder Guard users such as Cresselia, Meloetta, and Mega Mewtwo Y. while Play Rough targets Mega Sableye, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Rayquaza. Gunk Shot, Poison Jab, and Gear Grind hit Fairy-types in Xerneas, Mega Audino, and Mega Gardevoir. Gunk Shot has the ability to OHKO Mega Audino, whereas Poison Jab is more accurate, and it still OHKOes Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir. Gear Grind also OHKOes all three and can break Substitute. However, there is no poison chance, and it can still miss. Drain Punch is for OHKOing Normal-types such as Arceus, Blissey, and Slaking while gaining recovery back. Sacred Fire targets Mega Beedrill, Mega Scizor, and Genesect, as well as spreading burns on the opposing team. Thousand Arrows is for all the Ground-weak Pokemon such as pure Electric-types, Primal Groudon, Drapion, and Skuntank. Unlike other Ground-type moves, it targets non-grounded Pokemon such as Mega Rayquaza and Mega Manectric holding Air Balloon. Fusion Bolt and Petal Blizzard are for Water- and Flying-types such as Primal Kyogre, Gyarados, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Swampert. Mega Mewtwo X can make use of Water Shuriken to target Ho-Oh, Volcarona, and Primal Groudon. It can also break Substitute, as well as revenge killing a boosted Primal Groudon or Mega Tyranitar. Gastro Acid removes opposing Wonder Guard, ensuring its users are vulnerable regardless of your coverage while disrupting some key switch-ins such as Prankster Giratina. However, Gastro Acid makes Mega Mewtwo X a bit harder to always Imposter-proof, so it's rarely the first choice.136 Speed EVs are used to outspeed neutral-nature Mega Rayquaza. The remaining EVs in HP help survive some attacks, such as Choice Band Primal Groudon's Thousand Arrows, Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch, and Extreme Speed from unboosted Regigigas. 220 Speed EVs may also be run to outpace maximum Speed, positive-nature Mega Latios or Mega Diancie. Lum Berry is nearly always run, as Will-O-Wisp, Glare, or Spore would otherwise completely dismantle Mega Mewtwo X.

Mega Mewtwo X can run so many coverage options well, but it still only has four moveslots, so it generally wants partners that can fill in the gaps in its coverage. Usually, the best choice is another Mega Mewtwo X, running either Huge Power or Shadow Tag, with another set of four coverage moves. It is best because each Mega Mewtwo X can bluff being the other; unless the opponent can tell them apart through factors such as HP or status, they're unable to respond properly. Other Shadow Tag, Protean, or Huge Power users can also fill in Mega Mewtwo X's coverage gaps, such as Shadow Tag Lugia with Perish Song, Protean Mega Latios or Mega Mewtwo Y, and Huge Power Mega Tyranitar. Most Mega Mewtwo X teams also want at least one priority move user, like an -ate ability user such as Mega Rayquaza, Mega Diancie, Abomasnow, Kyurem-B, Shadow Tag Regigigas, or Huge Power Mega Gyarados. Typically, slower bulky Wonder Guard users such as Mega Audino, Mega Scizor, Ferrothorn, Skuntank, Blissey, and Mega Swampert are chosen to slowly pivot into Mega Mewtwo X via Parting Shot or Baton Pass usually being the main form of utility and field control for Mega Mewtwo X teams. Wonder Guard users also are the main way to Imposter-proof Mega Mewtwo X, specifically ones not weak to its coverage. Giratina with Prankster can use Spore, Curse, Destiny Bond, and/or Encore to stop sweepers, while Magic Bounce Giratina can keep entry hazards and status away, helping Mega Mewtwo X stay healthy. This support also makes two Mega Mewtwo X harder for opponents to tell apart.

Shadow Tag (Mewtwo-Mega-X).description:
Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X is an extremely potent trapper thanks to its amazing Attack, useful Fighting-type STAB, good Speed tier, and decent bulk. Drain Punch is an incredible STAB move that OHKOes Mega Gyarados and increases Mega Mewtwo X's longevity. Alternatively, Low Kick allows Mega Mewtwo X to hit even harder, OHKOing Wonder Guard Slaking, physically defensive Arceus, and Mega Steelix after minimal chip. Precipice Blades allows Mega Mewtwo X to OHKO standard Primal Groudon after Stealth Rock and target Wonder Guard users weak to it, like Primal Groudon, Skuntank, and Mega Manectric; Thousand Arrows is a more accurate option that also targets niche Air Balloon Wonder Guard users. Sacred Fire is an alternative coverage option that targets Wonder Guard Mega Scizor, Genesect, and Escavalier and spreads burns against checks like Giratina. Bolt Strike and Power Whip OHKO all Primal Kyogre variants; additionally, the former targets Wonder Guard Gyarados, Yveltal, and Ho-Oh, while the latter threatens Mega Swampert. Gear Grind OHKOes standard Wonder Guard Xerneas and forces Shed Shell Mega Audino out; it can also threaten a heavily damaged Xerneas behind a Substitute. Knock Off and Play Rough both threaten Mega Latios and, to an extent, Magic Bounce Giratina. Knock Off also threatens Wonder Guard Cresselia and Dusclops, while Play Rough can threaten Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza as well as most Yveltal variants. Trick is an option that disrupts most Wonder Guard users, namely Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas and defensive Wonder Guard users like Primal Kyogre, Slaking, and Mega Audino; however, Mega Mewtwo X dislikes staying in on Xerneas if it lacks Gear Grind. The given EV spread allows Mega Mewtwo X to outspeed neutral natured Mold Breaker Rayquaza, Mega Latios, and Mega Diancie while allowing Mega Mewtwo X to more easily take hits from Pokemon it traps, like Lum Berry Mega Gyarados, Choice Band Primal Groudon, and Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas. An Adamant nature with either 160 HP / 252 Atk / 96 Spe or 36 HP / 252 Atk / 220 Spe outspeeds Modest Mega Latios and Mega Diancie, and Timid Mega Latios, though the former fails to outspeed neutral natured Mega Rayquaza and the latter is OHKOed much more often by Lum Berry Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch and Lum Berry Huge Power Slaking and Regigigas's Extreme Speed. Alternatively, a Jolly nature could be used to outspeed positive natured Mega Rayquaza, Mega Latios, and Mega Diancie, though not running an Adamant nature leaves Mega Mewtwo X more vulnerable to healthy Primal Groudon.

Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X fits best on teams that appreciate its ability to trap and eliminate slower offensive foes, like most support Wonder Guard users lacking a Shed Shell. Giratina and Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas appreciate Mega Mewtwo X's ability to revenge kill powerful attackers that would pose a threat to them, such as Protean Mega Latios and Choice Band Beat Up Primal Groudon. In return, Giratina can check Shell Smash Mold Breaker Primal Groudon while also providing paralysis support with Glare. Xerneas can pass Substitutes to Mega Mewtwo X, provide entry hazard support, and lure in its own offensive checks for Mega Mewtwo X to remove. Huge Power Dark-types, notably Mega Gyarados, can provide support against foes that Mega Mewtwo X cannot trap and KO, such as Mega Gengar, and threaten Prankster Giratina, which is Mega Mewtwo X's most prominent check.Offensive Mold Breaker users that threaten Giratina, such as Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Gengar, and Dialga, also work well with Mega Mewtwo X. Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo Y, in particular, can make use of Volt Switch to bring Mega Mewtwo X in against switch-ins vulnerable to Shadow Tag; the latter can also potentially lure Mega Gyarados in for Mega Mewtwo X to trap and remove. Offensive Wonder Guard users, like Xerneas, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Lucario, and No Guard users forgoing a Choice Scarf, like Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Aerodactyl, and Mega Manectric, appreciate Mega Mewtwo X's ability to trap and remove an opposing Wonder Guard user in a wide variety of matchups. Other Shadow Tag users, such as Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Latios, and even a second Mega Mewtwo X, are also valuable teammates, as together they can trap a wide array of opposing Wonder Guard users, paving the way for a Huge Power or No Guard teammate to sweep. Additionally, teammates that can remove foes' Shed Shells, like Trick users and Mold Breaker Knock Off users, are appreciated, as most Wonder Guard users are vulnerable to Mega Mewtwo X once their Shed Shell is removed. A priority revenge killer—such as -ate Speed Kyurem-B, Mega Abomasnow, and Mega Rayquaza—or Imposter user alongside Mega Mewtwo X forms a potent revenge killing core that threatens the vast majority of sweepers; however, teams running Mega Mewtwo X and Imposter Chansey struggle to check Mold Breaker Mega Gengar, so they appreciate defensive Pokemon like Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, Blissey, and Mega Audino and non-Wonder Guard users like Ho-Oh and Yveltal. Defensive Wonder Guard users in general, such as Mega Scizor, Mega Beedrill, and Cresselia, also Imposter-proof Mega Mewtwo X (if it isn't running coverage that hits them) and provide Defog, Aromatherapy, and Wish support.

Mewtwo-Mega-Y.comments:
Other Options

No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y can also run a variety of coverage options to target specific Wonder Guard users. Wonder Guard Mega Mewtwo Y can run other entry hazards over Stealth Rock.

King's Shield: Some King's Shield users, such as Primal Groudon and Wonder Guard Mega Audino, can use King's Shield to both scout Mega Mewtwo X's moves and lower its Attack.

Protean (Mewtwo-Mega-Y).description:
Protean Mega Mewtwo Y uses its phenomenal Special Attack stat, high Speed, and coverage moves to target and decimate opposing Wonder Guard cores while holding its own against opposing offensive threats. With Expert Belt, Sludge Wave and Flash Cannon OHKOes Fairy-type Pokemon like Xerneas and Mega Audino, Secret Sword OHKOes Blissey and Arceus, and Searing Shot OHKOes Mega Beedrill and Mega Scizor. Grass Knot and Freeze-Dry both OHKO Mega Swampert, but the former OHKOes Primal Kyogre after Stealth Rock and the latter OHKOes Gyarados and 2HKOes Giratina. Moonblast OHKOes Mega Sableye and Mega Mewtwo X, and sometimes OHKOes Giratina with a Modest nature. Bug Buzz 2HKOes Cresselia and OHKOes opposing Mega Mewtwo Y and Deoxys-A, and Earth Power OHKOes Mega Gengar and Primal Groudon. Gastro Acid can be used against Wonder Guard users Mega Mewtwo Y might not be running the coverage for, allowing it to threaten Mega Scizor if it doesn't run Searing Shot, for example. Shed Shell is used to escape opposing Shadow Tag users such as Regigigas and Mega Mewtwo X, but the lack in power from Expert Belt is noticeable.

Since all teams run at least two Wonder Guard users, Mega Mewtwo Y will inevitably run into teams with a core of Wonder Guard users that can wall it. As a result, it benefits from being on offense or bulky offense teams that can break these cores with strong Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Gengar. Shadow Tag users such as Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Mewtwo X also work well since they help eliminate Wonder Guard users that Protean Mega Mewtwo Y does not prepare for. The latter is notable for its favorable matchup against Mega Gyarados, which is otherwise a problem for Mega Mewtwo Y. It also appreciates Substitute-passing teammates such as Xerneas to help its matchup against Mega Gyarados.

Choice Scarf No Guard (Mewtwo-Mega-Y).description:
Mega Mewtwo Y is one of the most effective users of No Guard OHKO moves thanks to its high Speed, high Special Attack, and ability to catch opponents off-guard thanks to its wide array of other viable sets. Choice Scarf allows Mega Mewtwo Y to outspeed every unboosted threat as well as some boosted ones, such as +2 maximum Speed Primal Groudon. Sheer Cold is the preferred OHKO move, as no Pokemon is immune to it without Wonder Guard or Sturdy. Fissure is an alternative that misses out on Mega Rayquaza, Yveltal, and Ho-Oh but hits the somewhat uncommon, though still relevant, group of Wonder Guard users weak to Ground—namely Primal Groudon, Mega Lucario, and Mega Manectric. Trick allows Mega Mewtwo Y to both hinder a Wonder Guard switch-in and have the flexibility of switching moves for the remainder of the game. Choice Scarf No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y's remaining two moveslots are extremely flexible, and almost any combination of the listed moves is viable. Sing, Gastro Acid, and Stealth Rock take advantage of Mega Mewtwo Y's ability to force in Wonder Guard users with Sheer Cold or Fissure, either hindering them with sleep, forcing them to switch out again, or taking advantage of the forced switch by setting Stealth Rock. Sing and Gastro Acid together allow Mega Mewtwo Y to spread sleep and generate an abundance of free turns for its teammates. Gastro Acid also pairs nicely with Stealth Rock, allowing Mega Mewtwo Y to continually force chip damage against Wonder Guard foes. Alternatively, thanks to Mega Mewtwo Y's extremely high Special Attack stat, it can effectively run coverage moves to damage or outright KO common Wonder Guard switch-ins. Zap Cannon and Inferno hit Water- and Bug / Steel type Wonder Guard users, respectively, in addition to being broadly useful against a wide-array of non-Wonder Guard threats thanks to their respective 100% chances to paralyze and burn. Additionally, Zap Cannon 2HKOes Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, non-Assault Vest Yveltal, and Ho-Oh after minimal chip—making it particularly useful on Fissure variants of Mega Mewtwo Y. Freeze-Dry hits Water-type Wonder Guard users, Giratina, and OHKOes the most relevant Flying-type, Mega Rayquaza, making it another useful option on Fissure variants of Mega Mewtwo Y. Sludge Wave hits common Fairy-type Wonder Guard users like Xerneas, Mega Audino, and Mega Gardevoir, while Focus Blast threatens Normal-type Wonder Guard users not named Blissey or Chansey. The leftover 4 EVs should be placed in Defense to allow Mega Mewtwo Y to always survive Mega Diancie's Pursuit. Note that if Mega Mewtwo Y opts to forgo coverage attacks completely, an EV spread of 248 HP / 8 Def / 252 Spe and a Timid nature should be used.

Most teams benefit from the revenge killing potential Choice Scarf No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y provides, in addition to forcing in passive Wonder Guard users that teammates can take advantage of. Due to Mega Mewtwo Y's frailty, slow Wonder Guard pivots, such as Xerneas and Mega Scizor, make good teammates. In particular, Substitute + Baton Pass teammates like Wonder Guard Xerneas can grant Mega Mewtwo Y security against revenge killers and Imposter users. In return, Mega Mewtwo Y provides them with free turns to create and pass Substitutes to other teammates as well. Powerful offensive Pokemon such as Choice Band Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza appreciate No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y's ability to force in Wonder Guard users. Additionally, both Wonder Guard and Mold Breaker setup sweepers appreciate the free turns Mega Mewtwo Y generates, as well as its ability to threaten Prankster Giratina; however, Giratina can force a trade with Destiny Bond. Trick-immune Wonder Guard teammates such as Blue Orb Primal Kyogre, Plate Arceus, and Mail Cresselia are valuable teammates to Imposter-proof No Guard + Trick Mega Mewtwo Y. Shadow Tag teammates such as Mega Mewtwo X and Perish Song Lugia appreciate Mega Mewtwo Y's ability to force in Wonder Guard users and remove their Shed Shell with Trick. Wonder Guard users with Stealth Rock, Defog, and Aromatherapy are also notable teammates for Gastro Acid variants of Mega Mewtwo Y, as they help it continually force switches—and entry hazard chip damage—versus opposing Wonder Guard and Mold Breaker users alike, while also allowing Mega Mewtwo Y to switch freely without fear of entry hazard chip damage itself. Finally, -ate Speed users make excellent teammates for Choice Scarf No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y, as they can revenge kill nearly every boosted threat that Mega Mewtwo Y itself doesn’t outpace and revenge kill.

No Guard Wallbreaker (Mewtwo-Mega-Y).description:
With a Focus Sash or Lum Berry equipped, No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y is a potent and flexible wallbreaker. Focus Sash provides security against Imposter users, Pursuit trappers, and opposing No Guard users and allows it to safely enter the battlefield at least once without Substitute + Baton Pass or slow pivoting support. Alternatively, Lum Berry can improve Mega Mewtwo Y's ability to switch into status spreaders, such as Glare Giratina and Spore or Dark Void Mold Breaker users. Sing allows Mega Mewtwo Y to generate free turns against basically every possible switch-in. Gastro Acid forces out the Wonder Guard users that switch in and, on Fissure variants, allows Mega Mewtwo Y to more effectively force mind games against teams using one or more Ground-weak Wonder Guard users. Stealth Rock gives Mega Mewtwo Y an efficient way to make progress in nearly every game and synergizes exceptionally well with its inherent ability to force switches. Zap Cannon and Inferno are great coverage options that hit Water- and Bug / Steel type Wonder Guard users, respectively, and are also useful against a broad range of non-Wonder Guard switch-ins thanks to their secondary effects. Freeze-Dry is another option to hit Water-type Wonder Guard users and also OHKOes the most prominent Flying-type in the format, Mega Rayquaza, making it particularly useful on Fissure variants. Sludge Wave hits Fairy-type Wonder Guard users; Focus Blast hits Normal-type Wonder Guard users. The choice between these options is flexible and many variations on the options presented in Mega Mewtwo Y’s latter three moveslots are viable and should be chosen based on individual team-building needs. Note that if Mega Mewtwo Y is not running any coverage attacks, an EV spread of 248 HP / 8 Def / 252 Spe and a Timid nature should be used.

Most teams benefit from the free turns No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y generates. In particular, powerful Mold Breaker users like Choice Band Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza appreciate Mega Mewtwo Y's ability to force in Wonder Guard users. Substitute + Baton Pass users, like Wonder Guard Xerneas, also make excellent teammates, as they're able to utilize the free turns Mega Mewtwo Y generates to pass Substitutes. Offensive Shell Smash Wonder Guard users such as Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario also appreciate the opportunities to set up that Mega Mewtwo Y can create. Additionally, they're also very resistant to the revenge killers, like -ate Speed users and Huge Power Mega Gyarados, that force Mega Mewtwo Y out. They can also efficiently Imposter-proof Mega Mewtwo Y on offensive teams that require the role compression. Focus Sash + No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y also appreciates paralysis support from teammates such as Glare + Prankster Giratina, Glare + Wonder Guard Xerneas, and Glare Support Wonder Guard users, to outpace and OHKO as many foes as possible. Shadow Tag users make excellent teammates for Mega Mewtwo Y, as they can trap and remove Wonder Guard users that frequently forgo Shed Shell—such as Xerneas and Mega Lucario—making it much easier for Mega Mewtwo Y to clean teams with Sheer Cold or Fissure. Defensive Wonder Guard users are valuable teammates, as they can clear the field of entry hazards, cure Mega Mewtwo Y of status, and provide it with slow pivoting and Imposter-proofing support. Defog support, as well as Magic Bounce support from Pokemon like Giratina, is particularly critical for Focus Sash variants of Mega Mewtwo to preserve the utility of its item. Finally, Fake Out + Extreme Speed users such as Aerilate Mega Rayquaza and Huge Power Regigigas can form a potent revenge killing core alongside Mega Mewtwo Y.

Blissey.comments:
Other Options

Thanks to its titanic HP stat, Blissey is a powerful Imposter user; however, Chansey's ability to bluff Eviolite nearly always make it superior. It's worth noting, though, that Blissey's viability as an Imposter user does force opponents to play with that possibility in mind if they see Blissey in team preview, regardless of whether it is an Imposter set or not. An alternate EV spread of 4 HP / 252 Def / 252 SpD with either a Bold or a Calm nature gives Blissey better mixed bulk and is a decent option on King's Shield sets. Additionally, physically defensive EV spreads improve Blissey's matchup versus the rare Mold Breaker Pursuit. Transform is a niche scouting tool that, like Imposter, takes advantage of Blissey's very high HP. Glare, Nuzzle, Will-O-Wisp, Chatter, Perish Song, and Magic Coat are all alternative viable utility options. However, Blissey usually prefers Knock Off or Whirlwind to help it check and Imposter-proof special Mold Breaker users. Foul Play is an option that OHKOes Mega Gengar and Mega Latios after a Shell Smash and 2HKOes Mega Diancie and Mega Sceptile after a Shell Smash and Knock Off. However, its utility is limited outside of those targets, as Blissey can seldom take a hit from a boosted physical attacker. Trick is an option that allows Blissey to disrupt opposing Wonder Guard users, as well as Imposter-proof Trick + Choice Specs Mold Breaker teammates without the use of Mail. Parting Shot is an alternative to Baton Pass that inflicts a useful debuff while pivoting, but also cedes momentum to Magic Bounce users. Sticky Web, Spikes, and Toxic Spikes are alternatives to Stealth Rock if their individual advantages are desired. Finally, Blissey's extremely high HP makes it one of the most viable users of niche options Metal Burst, Mirror Coat, and Counter.

Safety Goggles is an option to improve Blissey’s ability to check Spore Mold Breaker users. Mail is an option make Blissey immune to Trick, which can be useful for Imposter-proofing Choice Specs + Trick Mold Breaker teammates. Leftovers is an option that allows Blissey to use Recover less frequently versus special Mold Breaker users, potentially maintaining momentum. However, all of these options come at the cost of increased vulnerability to Shadow Tag users—which is one of the main advantages that Blissey has over Wonder Guard Eviolite Chansey.

Checks and Counters

Powerful Physical Mold Breaker Users: Blissey’s physical fragility means even unboosted physical Mold Breaker users force it out. Additionally, Special Mold Breaker users carrying either Secret Sword or Psystrike similarly force Blissey out.

Powerful Fighting-type Coverage: Similar to moves from Mold Breaker users, Fighting coverage pierces Blissey’s Wonder Guard. And since Secret Sword hits Blissey’s weaker Defense stat, essentially every Huge Power, Protean, Parental Bond, and Wonder Guard + Shell Smash user carrying Fighting coverage will force Blissey out. A healthy Blissey can withstand hits from uncommon Aura Sphere foes, however.

Trick: Trick users can hinder all but rare Mail variants of Blissey for the entirety of the game, either with Black Sludge forcing it to Recover more frequently or Choice Scarf forcing it to relinquish momentum. Trick also removes Shed Shell, leaving Blissey vulnerable to Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo X.

Prankster Giratina: Prankster Giratina dislikes losing its item to Knock Off variants of Blissey, but is otherwise unthreatened by Blissey and can force it out with Encore, Curse, or chip it with Will-O-Wisp.

Taunt: Taunt leaves most Blissey sets lacking Knock Off unable to support or maintain momentum for their team.

Wonder Guard Support.description:
Unparalleled special bulk, an advantageously low Speed tier, and only one weakness make Blissey a highly effective support Wonder Guard Pokemon. Nearly unique among Wonder Guard users, Blissey's incredible Special Defense allows it to both Imposter-proof a variety of powerful special Mold Breaker teammates and to check opposing special Mold Breaker foes. Baton Pass takes advantage of Blissey's low Speed, notably underspeeding other common slow pivots like Xerneas, Primal Kyogre, and Mega Scizor. King's Shield is an alternative that allows Blissey to utilize Wish more effectively and scout foes; an EV Spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with a Bold nature should be used on sets with King's Shield, as otherwise Blissey is OHKOed even by many -2 physical attackers. Defog and Aromatherapy are appreciated by nearly all Pure Hackmons team structures; however, if a teammate is carrying either one, Blissey can opt for other utility moves such as Stealth Rock, Knock Off, and Whirlwind. Knock Off and Whirlwind, in particular, are useful options, as they allow Blissey to more effectively check and Imposter-proof many powerful special Mold Breaker users. Knock Off deprives Plate + Judgment users like Mega Diancie, Dialga, and Mega Gengar lacking Secret Sword of their STAB move, while Whirlwind can force out special Mold Breaker users that require multiple boosts to break through Blissey. Additionally, Knock Off can helpfully deprive non-Wonder Guard foes, as well as most Psychic- and Ghost- type Wonder Guard foes, of their Shed Shells, Safety Goggles, and other critical items. On some teams, this utility is so valuable that Blissey can forgo Baton Pass or King’s Shield to be able to make use of three utility moveslots. Finally, recovery is essential for Blissey to function effectively. Recover's immediacy and reliability is generally preferred, but Wish takes advantage of Blissey's titanic HP stat to support its teammates and synergizes well with King's Shield and Baton Pass. Shed Shell is the preferred item to improve Blissey's matchup against Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo X and Perish Song Lugia. A specially defensive EV spread is preferred on sets without King's Shield to minimize damage from powerful special Mold Breaker users, as well as uncommon Aura Sphere variants of Protean users like Mega Latios and Shell Smash + Wonder Guard sweepers like Mega Gardevoir. Additionally, a specially defensive EV spread allows Blissey to survive Mega Lucario’s +2 Fist Plate Judgment after Stealth Rock and force it out with Whirlwind.

Blissey fits best on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to blanket check special attackers without Secret Sword and Psystrike. Additionally, powerful special Mold Break sweeprs, such as Choice Specs Mega Mewtwo Y lacking Psystrike and Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, appreciate Blissey's ability to efficiently Imposter-proof them. Furthermore, Blissey is a particularly good teammate for special Shell Smash + Mold Breaker teammates that aren't making use of a Plate for Imposter-proofing, such as Mega Latios without Psystrike and Moonblast Mega Diancie, which are otherwise very difficult to Imposter-proof. Blissey's vulnerability to physical attackers means it appreciates teammates such as physically defensive Wonder Guard users like Mega Scizor and Cresselia, as well as Prankster Giratina. Furthermore, Blissey and Giratina have great overall synergy; Blissey can tank powerful special Fairy- and Ghost-type attacks from the likes of Mega Diancie and Mega Gengar for Giratina, while Giratina can switch into Fighting-type attacks and powerful physical Mold Breaker foes for Blissey. Notably, the combination of Wonder Guard Blissey and Prankster Giratina can make progress extremely difficult to make for teams that rely on Mold Breaker Arceus. On bulkier balance teams, Blissey can be used alongside another defensive Wonder Guard user—granting them both additional flexibility with their movesets and, in particular, allowing Blissey to more easily use utility options like Knock Off and Whirlwind. Blissey also appreciates Magic Bounce teammates for their ability reflect entry hazards, as Blissey prefers to take as little chip damage as possible to more effectively check special Mold Breaker foes. Finally, Pursuit users like Huge Power Mega Gyarados are excellent teammates for their ability to trap and threaten Giratina, one of Blissey’s most common switch-ins. Mega Gyarados, in particular, is an excellent teammate for the additional utility of being able to revenge kill Primal Groudon. Similarly, revenge killers like Refrigerate Kyurem-B and Pixilate Mega Diancie are notable teammates for their ability to force out Mega Gengar and Mega Latios, some of the most common users of Secret Sword and Psystrike, respectively.

Tyranitar.comments:
Other Options

Mold Breaker Mega Tyranitar can use alternative items like Dread Plate and Expert Belt to boost its Beat Up and Knock Off against Dark-type weak foes like Cresselia, Giratina, and Mega Metagross. Safety Goggles can be used in conjunction with Spore to let Mega Tyranitar Imposter-proof itself and surprise Spore Prankster Giratina; however, Safety Goggles is not as valuable as self Imposter-proofing if Mega Tyranitar is boosted or opts for Dark Void. Choice Band Mold Breaker sets without Shell Smash can be used for immediate power in exchange for the ability to set up, but this makes Mega Tyranitar struggle with faster sweepers more due to it being quite slow. Shed Shell can be used to escape from Shadow Tag users like Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X. King's Shield can be used in the fourth moveslot to debilitate revenge killers like Primal Groudon, and -ate users like Diancie-Mega, but it doesn't provide as many opportunities to set up and can be predicted by opposing revenge killers.

Checks and Counters

Strong Priority Moves: Pixilate users such as Xerneas and Mega Diancie can threaten to OHKO Mega Tyranitar with their super effective attacks, but Tyranitar can comfortably switch out against them due to its Pursuit resistance, and they cannot OHKO Mold Breaker Tyranitar if they are weakened by King's Shield. Additionally, Huge Power Mach Punch Mega Mewtwo X and Water Shuriken Mega Gyarados threaten Tyranitar, though they cannot switch into it more than once or twice.

Super Effective Coverage: Despite Mega Tyranitar's decent bulk, it has a lot of common weaknesses, so Pokemon that run a lot of coverage moves, like Mega Rayquaza, Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Protean Mega Latios, can threaten an unboosted Mega Tyranitar if it forgoes Sucker Punch.

Shadow Tag: Choice Scarf Shadow Tag users like Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X can trap Mega Tyranitar and 2HKO it with Thousand Arrows and OHKO it with Low Kick, respectively. However, unbosted Mega Tyranitar 3HKOes Primal Groudon and 2HKOes Mega Mewtwo X, limiting their ability to switch in, and some Mega Tyranitar variants outspeed Primal Groudon after Shell Smash.

Status: If Mega Tyranitar doesn't use Lum Berry or Safety Goggles, it is very susceptible to status, particularly from the likes of Prankster Giratina, which can force Mega Tyranitar out with priority status.

Imposter Chansey and Blissey: Mold Breaker Mega Tyranitar is very difficult to Imposter-proof, so Imposter Chansey and Blissey discourage it from trying to set up. Additionally, Huge Power Mega Tyranitar dislikes being chipped repeatedly by Pursuit from opposing Imposter users.

Non Dark-weak Wonder Guard Users: Wonder Guard users that aren't weak to Dark such as Slaking, Arceus, and Primal Kyogre can switch into Huge Power Tyranitar; however, they must fear Mold Breaker sets, Gastro Acid, and Trick-or-Treat sets.

Shell Smash Sweeper.description:
Mega Tyranitar is a very powerful Shell Smash sweeper, due to its high attack stat, resistance to Pursuit, and decent bulk, threatening Pokemon like Mega Rayquaza, unboosted Mold Breaker Mega Latios, and Giratina. It also takes resisted hits from revenge killers like Regigigas, Slaking, and Gale Wings and Aerilate Mega Rayquaza. Beat Up can be used to hit or KO foes through Substitute and Focus Sash, threatening common users like Deoxys-S and Deoxys-A while also being the strongest Dark-type STAB move available with five healthy teammates. Knock Off is an alternative, powerful STAB attack, and its item removal is useful team support as well as a way to facilitate progress, removing opposing Safety Goggles if Mega Tyranitar opts for Spore. Diamond Storm helps maintain Mega Tyranitar's defensive profile by cancelling the Defense drops from Shell Smash, making it harder for physical attackers to revenge kill it. Spore and Dark Void can be used for gaining free turns so that Mega Tyranitar can set up. Taunt is used to shut down would-be checks in Mega Audino and Prankster Giratina, gaining setup turns in a similar fashion. Leftovers provides Mega Tyranitar longevity to capitalize on its defensive utility. Lum Berry is an alternative to absorb Spore, Will-O-Wisp, or Glare from Prankster Giratina or a foe Mega Tyranitar defensively checks, like setup Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, one time. Mold Breaker lets Mega Tyranitar ignore problematic abilities like Wonder Guard and Magic Bounce, allowing it to set up in front of users of them. The first EV spread allows Mega Tyranitar to outspeed faster Pokemon like Mega Aerodactyl and Deoxys-A after using Shell Smash, with the remaining EVs put into Attack and HP. An alternative spread of 48 HP / 252 Atk / 208 Spe allows +2 Mega Tyranitar to outspeed Choice Scarf Primal Groudon, though this does come with a slight reduction in bulk.

Mega Tyranitar best fits on bulky balance archetypes, thanks to its ability to repeatedly come in on threats like Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza and non-Secret Sword Mega Gengar and its ability to threaten common defensive Pokemon like Giratina. Additionally, teams that struggle with revenge killers like Regigigas, Slaking, and Aerilate or Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza appreciate Mega Tyranitar's resistance to their attacks. Prankster Giratina comes in on all Primal Groudon variants while appreciating Mega Tyranitar's ability to soft check Mega Rayquaza, Mega Latios, and some Mega Gengar sets. Magic Bounce Giratina can soft check Choice item Shadow Tag users, soft check Wonder Guard users, and come in on No Guard or Huge Power foes. Mold Breaker Primal Groudon takes care of most Wonder Guard Xerneas while appreciating Mega Tyranitar checking Giratina, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Latios. Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo X and Primal Groudon can eliminate or severely hinder Mega Tyranitar's checks; the former deals with weakened Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Imposter users Transformed into Tyranitar, while the latter can trap opposing Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, as well as use Trick on and set entry hazards against Wonder Guard Mega Audino. Prankster Mega Metagross can pass boosts and Substitutes to Mega Tyranitar while coming in on most Mega Diancie. Although Mega Tyranitar resists attacks from most revenge killers, Shadow Tag Primal Groudon, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Diancie threaten it with their super effective moves. Therefore, Wonder Guard users not weak to their attacks, like Mega Scizor, Slaking, and Xerneas, are appreciated. Additionally, support Wonder Guard Pokemon have numerous capabilities that help Mega Tyranitar, like clearing entry hazards, curing status, and passing Shell Smash boosts and Substitutes with Baton Pass.

Tyranitar-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Safety Goggles can be used in conjunction with Spore to let Mega Tyranitar Imposter-proof itself and surprise Spore Prankster Giratina; however, Safety Goggles is not as valuable as self Imposter-proofing if Mega Tyranitar is boosted or opts for Dark Void. Slaking.comments:
Other Options

Wonder Guard Slaking has several other options; for example, Magic Coat can be used in either of the last two moveslots, reflecting status moves such as Spore, Dark Void, Glare, Encore, Taunt, and entry hazards aimed at Slaking. Stealth Rock is an alternative to Spikes, trading the possibility of multiple layers of hazards for the ability to pressure Flying-types. Lum Berry can be used over Safety Goggles to cure sleep from Dark Void, but its one-time use stipulation makes it an inferior option. U-turn is a more uncommon pivot move that is importantly ineffective into opposing Wonder Guard users but heavily chips offensive Pokemon such as Mega Gyarados and Mega Mewtwo Y and is not stopped by Taunt. Knock Off annoys Giratina for a teammate, removing its Safety Goggles and making it vulnerable to Spore, and usually allows Slaking to beat non-Sludge Wave variants of Mega Gengar if healthy. However, Giratina having its item removed means Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Knock Off will not OHKO it. A set of Fake Out + Extreme Speed can be used in tandem with the alternate spread 248 HP / 252 Atk / 8 SpD and an Adamant nature to compress the roles of Wonder Guard and revenge killer into one teamslot if it is desperately needed, but this loses out on pivot and cleric capabilities as a result.

Shadow Tag Slaking can run coverage moves to target different Wonder Guard users, like Gunk Shot for Xerneas and Mega Audino; Sacred Fire for Mega Scizor; Thousand Arrows for Mega Manectric, Skuntank, and Drapion; and Bolt Strike for Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Primal Kyogre, and Gyaradosite Gyarados. Water Shuriken is an option for revenge killing Mold Breaker Primal Groudon in particular, but it requires five hits to OHKO after Shell Smash and has very limited uses outside of this. Perish Song, Spore, and Stealth Rock can be used over Spikes if the team already has a Spikes user. One may choose to run three or more Slaking, as this greatly enhances the unpredictability factor for the opponent, with the Slaking running abilities like Wonder Guard, Huge Power, Prankster, Prankster, and Imposter.

Slaking can also run a fringe Mold Breaker + Belly Drum set with Extreme Speed, one of Ice Shard or Shadow Sneak; one of King's Shield, Taunt, or Dark Void; and one of Lum Berry, Mental Herb, or Sitrus Berry, but it is inconsistent due to getting the initial Belly Drum off being difficult and Pixilate Mega Diancie reliably revenge killing chipped Slaking.

Checks and Counters

Fighting-type Coverage: Powerful Fighting-type coverage from Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Latios, and Mega Mewtwo Y exploits Slaking's one weakness and threatens it with huge damage or an OHKO. King's Shield variants of Slaking somewhat offset this vulnerability, allowing it to relatively safely scout for an unfavorable matchup.

Shadow Tag Users: Wonder Guard Slaking is vulnerable to being trapped by Shadow Tag users and eliminated with powerful Fighting-type coverage or Perish Song if it doesn't have a Shed Shell. Shadow Tag Slaking is similarly trapped by opposing Arena Trap users, but its lack of passivity can give it a favorable matchup against these Pokemon.

Mold Breaker Users: Powerful Mold Breaker users, especially special attacking ones, take advantage of their ability to bypass Wonder Guard and Slaking's relative passivity to scare it out and potentially set up a Shell Smash, even if Whirlwind dissuades the latter. Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza can threaten Slaking with Oblivion Wing, and Mega Gengar is immune to Slaking's Fake Out and Extreme Speed and can threaten it with a boosted Secret Sword or Psystrike, though Mega Gengar has to watch out for potential coverage variants.

Taunt Users: Taunt users completely shut down Wonder Guard Slaking, forcing it to switch lest it use Struggle. Fast Taunt users, in particular Wonder Guard Mega Beedrill, can prevent Slaking from setting Spikes, hindering its function.

Trick Users: Wonder Guard Slaking is crippled if it is given a Choice item from Trick, locking it into one move—forcing it to either use a pivot move or give up momentum—and negating the benefits of Shed Shell or Safety Goggles. Shadow Tag Slaking also dislikes Trick due to losing the ability to use Fake Out into Extreme Speed when revenge killing foes and Encore into Spikes.

Dark Void: Wonder Guard Slaking typically cannot avoid being put to sleep by Dark Void, meaning its teammates won't receive its valuable support until it wakes up. This can be somewhat mitigated by Magic Coat, however.

Giratina: Giratina forces Wonder Guard Slaking to switch out by threatening to status it and pressuring it with Curse and Encore, with Magic Bounce variants also turning Parting Shot against it.

Other Ghost-types: Ghost-types are unable to be trapped and are immune to Fake Out and Extreme Speed. A Ghost-type other than Giratina may also not be necessary, due to Prankster Giratina being a great pick for most teams.

Magic Bounce: Shadow Tag Slaking is unable to use Encore or Spikes against Magic Bounce foes, and the most common Magic Bounce users are immune to Extreme Speed.

Support Wonder Guard.description:
Slaking is a premier pivot and cleric with Wonder Guard thanks to its single weakness in Fighting and impressive physical bulk that lets it check Mold Breaker Pokemon like Primal Groudon and Secret Sword Mega Gengar. Parting Shot and Baton Pass allow Slaking to generate momentum for its team; the former lowers the foe's offenses but is exploitable by Magic Bounce users, and the latter possesses greater PP but passes undesirable effects like Curse, Perish Song, and Gastro Acid to its teammates. Recover provides Slaking with instant recovery, while Wish makes use of Slaking's high HP stat to keep both itself and its teammates healthy at the cost of often sacrificing momentum when used. Defog is a valuable support option that minimizes the chip damage Slaking and its teammates take throughout the game by removing entry hazards; alternatively, Stealth Rock is a valid option if the role of Defogger is already filled. Similarly, many teams appreciate Aromatherapy's ability to cure bothersome status conditions, but King's Shield and Whirlwind can be used if a teammate is already carrying it. King's Shield safely scouts for Fighting-type coverage and lets Slaking safely heal via Wish, while Whirlwind thwarts Substitute passing and setup attempts. Slaking uses a Relaxed nature minimum Speed IVs to increase the chances it moves last, allowing it to safely bring in a teammate via Parting Shot or Baton Pass. Shed Shell lets Slaking escape from Shadow Tag users such as Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Latios, and Mega Mewtwo Y, whereas Safety Goggles provides an immunity to Spore from Pokemon like Giratina, Primal Groudon, and Mega Gengar.

Like other support Wonder Guard users, Slaking is mainly used on balance and bulky offense teams where a multitude of Pokemon enjoy the utility it provides. Offensive Pokemon such as Mega Rayquaza, Mega Gengar, and Mega Latios benefit from Slaking's pivoting capabilities, which ensure they safely enter the field, as well as its ability to check Fake Out + Extreme Speed users, such as Regigias and Mega Diancie, and faster No Guard Pokemon, like Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Lopunny, and Deoxys-S. Slaking also supports bulkier offensive teammates like Primal Groudon and Dialga, healing them with Wish, which allows them to be threatening throughout the course of a game and reduces their chances of being revenge killed. Slaking is capable of Imposter-proofing Huge Power or Protean Pokemon, such as Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Latios, and Mega Mewtwo Y, lacking Fighting-type coverage. Due to Slaking's ability to compress the roles of a defensive pivot, entry hazard removal, and cleric into one teamslot, it can afford be run alongside offensive Shell Smash Wonder Guard users, such as Xerneas, Deoxys-A, and Mega Mewtwo Y. Alternatively, Slaking can be paired with a more passive second Wonder Guard user, such as Primal Kyogre or Mega Audino, to free up moveslots it would otherwise always dedicate to Defog and Aromatherapy. Slaking also supports Substitute + Baton Pass users lacking recovery like Wonder Guard Xerneas by healing them with Wish. Prankster Giratina can take on strong Fighting-type attacks from Mega Mewtwo X and cripple it with a status condition, aid Slaking in dealing with Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, and absorb attempts to use Trick on Slaking if Giratina is holding a Griseous Orb. Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Primal Groudon could be considered for its ability to trap faster offensive Pokemon that threaten Slaking as well as Taunt Mega Beedrill. Mega Gyarados is a potent potential partner, as it threatens Giratina—one of Slaking's most common switch-ins—with Pursuit, and it also has the potential to revenge kill dangerous Shell Smash Mold Breaker Pokemon such as Primal Groudon. Pixilate Mega Diancie particularly excels in checking Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza for Slaking and can similarly terrorize a multitude of Shell Smash users like opposing Mega Diancie and Mega Gengar.

Shadow Tag.description:
Shadow Tag Slaking performs a similar role to Shadow Tag Regigigas and differentiates itself with its higher physical bulk, which allows it to survive hits like Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Knock Off and boosted Mold Breaker Primal Groudon's Thousand Arrows. Fake Out and Extreme Speed are crucial due to the former chipping foes with no drawback and the latter finishing off weakened foes, especially if their Defense is lowered from using Shell Smash. Slaking values coverage to hit physical threats, in particular Huge Power Mega Gyarados, more than Regigigas does, as it can take a hit more easily. Low Kick has a good chance to 2HKO Wonder Guard Slaking after Stealth Rock and Arceus from full, and it KOes Mega Gyarados after a Silk Scarf-boosted Fake Out. Encore allows Slaking to lock slower Wonder Guard users into a move, in particular Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas, which seldom runs Shed Shell or invests in Speed. Alternatively, Taunt disrupts passive Wonder Guard users that are otherwise safe switch-ins to Slaking, like Mega Audino and Primal Kyogre. Spikes capitalizes on passive foes, especially if Slaking opts for Encore or Taunt, as locking the foe into a useless move and denying hazard removal and utility allows Slaking to set up multiple Spikes layers unobstructed. Silk Scarf boosts Fake Out's and Extreme Speed's damage, allowing Slaking to revenge kill foes like weakened Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, uninvested Mega Latios, and boosted Mold Breaker Xerneas lacking King's Shield, while Leftovers increases Slaking's longevity by allowing it to recover health when using Fake Out and on turns where the foe is locked into a move via Encore. The given EV spread allows Slaking to hit as hard as possible while maximizing its physical bulk, which is crucial for letting it live both Lum Berry and Dread Plate Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch after Stealth Rock.

Slaking functions well on teams that appreciate its ability to both revenge kill frailer foes and set Spikes, that can also compensate for its inability to threaten Mega Gengar. Huge Power Mega Gyarados is a great partner, as it can weaken sweepers running King's Shield for Slaking if needed, has a hard time fitting entry hazards so appreciates Slaking's ability to do so, and can switch into and threaten most special Mold Breaker users, including Mega Gengar and Mega Latios. Mega Gyarados also threatens Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, which is too bulky for most Slaking sets to threaten if healthy. Magic Bounce Giratina can Imposter-proof all sets with ease, though it is hard to fit on teams due to Prankster Giratina being difficult to forgo. A support Wonder Guard user not weak to coverage Slaking is running, such as Mega Audino, Primal Kyogre, or Mega Swampert, is essential, as while it must be wary of Encore and Taunt, it can run Defog to remove Spikes set by opposing Imposter users Transformed into Slaking. Prankster Giratina is good setup deterrence and can annoy Imposter users Transformed into Slaking with Spore, Will-O-Wisp, Glare, and Curse. A robust offensive presence is integral; two Mold Breaker users is ideal, as two Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X are hard to fit, though a single Mold Breaker is also workable if two cannot be fit onto a team.

Sableye-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Mega Sableye can run a Toxic Orb as its item, which forces it to switch more but lets Psycho Shift threaten Primal Groudon. Protection moves like Spiky Shield and King's Shield can be used for scouting and the unique benefit of the specific choice, like Spiky Shield chipping contact attackers. Other pivoting moves can be run over Baton Pass, and other recovery moves can be run instead of Pain Split. Mega Sableye can use other support moves as well, such as entry hazards, Aromatherapy, and Defog. Magic Coat may be used to protect from Taunts and Encores. Whirlwind can be run to phaze threats trying to set up on Mega Sableye.

Checks and Counters

Mold Breaker Users: Mold Breaker users always OHKO Mega Sableye.

Fairy-type Attacks: Fairy-type attacks always OHKO Mega Sableye.

Taunt: Once hit by Taunt, Mega Sableye cannot use any of its moves.

Ability Suppression + Pursuit: Ability suppression from Gastro Acid or Mold Breaker means that Pursuit will always KO Mega Sableye, whether it tries to switch or not. More generally, ability suppression at least forces Mega Sableye to switch out.

Choice Scarf + Trick and Encore: Being forced into one move with Choice Scarf neutralizes Mega Sableye for the rest of the match; it relies on being able to use all of its moves to threaten foes. Similarly, Encore forces it to switch.

Substitute: Even though Curse bypasses opposing Substitutes, Mega Sableye cannot gain recovery from Pain Split if the foe is behind one.

Magic Guard Users: Magic Guard users like Ho-Oh do not fear any of Mega Sableye's moves.

Level 2 Mega Sableye.description:
Not much likes switching into level 2 Mega Sableye, because it can take huge chunks out of foes's health with Curse and Pain Split. Wonder Guard shields it from most attacks: otherwise, basically every attack would OHKO it. It is at level 2 with 76 HP EVs to hit an HP stat of 15, which minimizes burn damage as a percentage of maximum HP. With Wonder Guard and one weakness, its defenses rarely matter anyway, so reducing the effect of burn on its health matters more than reducing attack damage. Its low HP stat also synergizes well with Pain Split, letting it completely heal and effectively halve the foe's remaining HP. Curse + Pain Split means passive Wonder Guard users cannot outstall Mega Sableye, as they will lose more than 50% of their maximum HP every turn, so even if they always recover, they will eventually faint. Psycho Shift is used for its 100% accuracy and ability to bypass Magic Bounce, and with burns from Flame Orb, it cripples some of the most popular Pokemon in the tier like Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Gyarados, and Giratina. Mega Sableye uses Baton Pass over Parting Shot to capitalize on the switches it forces without worrying about Magic Bounce users stealing momentum. It can run Substitute to block a hit from a Mold Breaker user or a Fairy-type attack, and Substitute also synergizes well with Baton Pass.

Level 2 Mega Sableye fits best on bulky offense teams, which cover for its lack of defensive utility outside of Wonder Guard while capitalizing on the pressure it puts on opposing teams. Blissey and Giratina are notable teammates for checking a large swath of Mold Breaker users, and Shadow Tag Primal Groudon can trap and eliminate the most common Taunt user in Mega Beedrill. Mold Breaker Primal Groudon with Pursuit can be used to Imposter-proof Mega Sableye effectively. Substitute Mega Rayquaza works well with Mega Sableye, since Mega Rayquaza's checks are usually passive, which Sableye preys upon. A Substitute-passing teammate can be valuable to protect Mega Sableye from Mold Breaker or Fairy-type attacks once, allowing it more freedom to mess with the opponent's team.

Manectric-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Thanks to its high Speed and notoriety as a Wonder Guard user, Mega Manectric can effectively make use of No Guard alongside Sheer Cold or Fissure, Zap Cannon, and some combination of Inferno, Gastro Acid, Stealth Rock, and Sing. Additionally, although it suffers from four-moveslot syndrome, a support Wonder Guard set with Defog and Aromatherapy is also a viable option for Mega Manectric. Mental Herb and Lum Berry are alternate item options that can allow Manectric to Baton Pass a Substitute versus Encore and sleep-inflicting opponents, respectively. Air Balloon is a fringe option that alleviates Mega Manectric’s weakness to Fissure. Finally, Manectite grants Mega Manectric an immunity to Trick. However, all of these item options are almost never worth giving up the utility Leftovers or Shed Shell provide.

Glare is a useful option to hinder opposing sweepers and, unlike many Glare users, Mega Manectric can use it without fear of a Magic Bounce switch-in thanks to its Electric typing. Dark Void is another disruption option, though unlike Glare, a timely Magic Bounce switch-in can turn Mega Manectric into a sleeping momentum sink. Nuzzle is another alternative to Glare that affects Magic Bounce users, but has a worse matchup versus most Wonder Guard users. Destiny Bond is an option that takes advantage of Mega Manectric's high Speed stat and frailty to take a surprise KO against attackers like Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and slower Choice item Mold Breaker users. Stealth Rock and other entry hazards are options, though Mega Manectric is a noticeably less effective entry hazard setter as compared to other Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users like Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir due to its inability to force out common Magic Bounce users like Giratina. Magic Coat can be used to reflect entry hazards, sleep moves from Mold Breaker users, and Sing, Gastro Acid, Taunt, and Spider Web from No Guard users. Finally, Sheer Cold can be used to bluff No Guard sets and deter Prankster Giratina from switching in.

Checks and Counters

Ground-type Coverage: Mega Manectric's frailty means its vulnerable to being OHKOed by Ground-type coverage from foes such as Thousand Arrows Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Earth Power Protean Mega Latios, and Earth Power Wonder Guard Mega Gardevoir. Additionally, Mega Manectric is vulnerable to the somewhat uncommon, but very dangerous, Fissure. However, niche Destiny Bond Mega Manectric variants are often able to force a trade in a bad matchup.

Primal Groudon: Despite usually carrying Water coverage, Mega Manectric is extremely vulnerable to Primal Groudon's powerful Ground attacks. In particular, Choice Scarf + Shadow Tag Primal Groudon sets can trap, outpace, and OHKO Mega Manectric with Thousand Arrows if it isn't already behind a Substitute. Additionally, Choice Scarf + Mold Breaker Primal Groudon can also surprise KO Mega Manectric in a one-on-one scenario.

Prankster Giratina: Prankster Giratina is entirely unthreatened by any Mega Manectric not carrying Taunt and can force it out with Encore or Curse. Furthermore, Giratina's Will-O-Wisp can limit Mega Manectric's ability to create Substitutes over the course of a game.

Trick: Trick users can hinder Mega Manectric for the entirety of the game, either with Black Sludge limiting its ability to create Substitutes or Choice items forcing it to relinquish momentum.

Taunt: Despite usually carrying Scald, Taunt still leaves Mega Manectric unable to support or maintain momentum for its team.

Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard.description:
High Speed, an immunity to paralysis, and a good typing make Wonder Guard Mega Manectric a highly effective Substitute + Baton Pass user. The combination of Substitute and Baton Pass allows Mega Manectric to support its teammates by giving them a safe turn to set up, use a utility move, or fire off a powerful attack. Scald has a high chance to OHKO standard Primal Groudon, guaranteed after Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Steam Eruption always OHKOes Primal Groudon and also OHKOes standard Mold Breaker Mega Diancie after Stealth Rock, but has much lower PP and imperfect accuracy. Gastro Acid is extremely useful thanks to Mega Manectric's high Speed tier, neutralizing slower Mold Breaker users that don't carry a Ground move, such as Mega Rayquaza without Precipice Blades, Mega Latios, and Arceus. Taunt is an alternative that allows Mega Manectric to force out Prankster Giratina and support Wonder Guard users trying to phaze Manectric with Whirlwind. Leftovers keeps Mega Manectric healthy and allows it to make more Substitutes over the course of a game. If greater resilience against Shadow Tag users like Choice Scarf Primal Groudon and Choice Specs Mega Mewtwo Y is desired, Shed Shell can be used alongside Recover in the final moveslot. However, Substitute + Baton Pass Mega Manectric appreciates the passive recovery Leftovers provides and dislikes the loss of momentum from taking a turn to use Recover.

Wonder Guard Mega Manectric's Ground weakness—and thus, Fissure weakness—means it should nearly always be paired with both a Wonder Guard teammate that isn't weak to Ground—such as Mega Audino or Primal Kyogre—as well as a Flying-type teammate—such as Mega Rayquaza or Yveltal. Choice Band and Choice Specs variants of Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza are particularly notable teammates, as they appreciate Mega Manectric's Substitutes in addition to being useful teammates versus Fissure users. Mega Manectric also appreciates teammates like Prankster Giratina and—though they're difficult to accommodate on most team structures—physically defensive Poison Heal users like Mega Slowbro and Mega Gyarados for their ability to defensively check Mold Breaker Primal Groudon. Similarly, Mega Manectric appreciates teammates like Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Refrigerate Mega Abomasnow, and Imposter Chansey for their ability to revenge kill Primal Groudon. Pursuit trappers like Mega Gyarados and Yveltal also double as checks to Prankster Giratina. Mold Breaker Primal Groudon itself also makes an excellent teammate, as it appreciates the opportunities Mega Manectric's Substitutes give it to either setup a Shell Smash or fire off a Choice Band boosted V-Create. Most Shell Smash Mold Breaker sweepers—especially frail ones like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie— similarly appreciate Manectric's Substitutes to ease their setup and defend them against revenge killers like -ate Speed users and Choice Scarf Imposter users. No Guard users such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Lopunny synergize with Mega Manectric, as they give it abundant opportunities to use Substitute thanks to the pressure their OHKO moves exert. Symbiotically, No Guard users appreciate Mega Manectric's Substitutes themselves, as they grant No Guard users a free turn to disrupt the opposing team with Gastro Acid or Sing and ease their matchup against -ate Speed users and Pursuit trappers.

Metagross-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Mega Metagross can opt to run a physically defensive spread to more easily rack up boosts against Fake Out + Extreme Speed users, like Mega Diancie, Slaking, Regigigas, and Mega Abomasnow, as well as take Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Water Shuriken more easily. Mega Metagross can also run a moveset of Spore / Taunt / Substitute / Baton Pass to more easily pass Substitute against the majority of teams, though running this instead of the standard moveset means Metagross can't pass boosts, and it leaves it vulnerable to Beat Up Mega Gyarados and Mega Mewtwo X, both of which commonly run Lum Berry. Alternative boosting moves, like Shell Smash and Cotton Guard, are usable, but they don't synergize as well with Dark Void or Taunt, and non-Coil and Minimize Mega Metagross is largely outclassed by Baton Pass Wonder Guard users.

Checks and Counters

Magic Bounce or Magic Coat Users: Magic Bounce users can come in on Mega Metagross and bounce Dark Void or Taunt back if either move was used that turn. Magic Bounce Ghost-types like Giratina can use Curse to passively chip Mega Metagross and any Baton Pass recipient as well; however, they are easily pressured by offensive teammates. Similarly, Wonder Guard users like Mega Audino, Slaking, and Mega Scizor can sometimes carry Magic Coat, which reflects Mega Metagross's Dark Void and Taunt. However, Magic Coat on Wonder Guard users is rather hard to fit, and they can only handle Mega Metagross in the long-term with Magic Coat in addition to Chatter or Whirlwind.

Imposter: Imposter Chansey can transform into Mega Metagross and potentially pass a Substitute and boosts of its own. Additionally, teammates that Imposter-proof Mega Metagross are typically forgone due to being very hard to fit, allowing Chansey to usually Baton Pass to a teammate with impunity.

Lum Berry Users: Lum Berry users, such as Mega Mewtwo X, Huge Power Mega Gyarados, and Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, can take a Dark Void and heavily damage or OHKO Mega Metagross. Mega Mewtwo X and Knock Off or Beat Up Gyarados in particular can threaten Taunt Mega Metagross effectively in a one-on-one scenario, as they are able to OHKO it. However, these are only short-term checks to Dark Void Mega Metagross due to Lum Berry being one-time use.

Multi-hit Moves: Multi-hit move users, in particular Beat Up Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Gyarados, are able to break Mega Metagross's Substitute and threaten an OHKO on it. However, Dark Void Mega Metagross can put them to sleep if they lack a way to circumvent it, and multi-hit moves may miss against boosted Minimize sets.

Faster Prankster Users: Faster Prankster users, like Arceus and opposing speed-crept Mega Metagross, can disrupt Mega Metagross with Taunt, Encore, or Spore. However, these are very hard to fit and are difficult to justify using outside of being a Mega Metagross check.

Status Orb Users: Toxic Orb and Flame Orb users, such as Magic Guard Ho-Oh and Poison Heal Mega Gyarados, can check Dark Void Mega Metagross due to not being affected by sleep. Ho-Oh and Yveltal can offensively threaten it with Flare Blitz and Knock Off, respectively. However, these are hard to fit due to being vulnerable to Shadow Tag users, and they are largely ineffective against Minimize sets.

Prankster Substitute + Baton Pass.description:
Prankster Mega Metagross is an effective Substitute + Baton Pass user due to its good defensive typing into most Wonder Guard and -ate users, decent overall bulk, and Prankster + Dark Void effortlessly giving it free turns for setup. Dark Void and Coil synergize well because Coil boosting accuracy remedies Dark Void's accuracy problems. Dark Void allows Mega Metagross to disrupt non-Magic Bounce switch-ins thanks to priority from Prankster and often lets it Baton Pass both a Substitute and Coil boosts to a teammate. Likewise, Taunt and Minimize work well together because Taunt disables Prankster Giratina’s moves, allowing Mega Metagross to rack up evasion boosts, as most opposing attacks either miss or fail to break Substitute. Substitute is essential to Mega Metagross's purpose, as offensive teammates enjoy being able to take a hit from most revenge killers while attempting to set up and sweep. Leftovers keeps Mega Metagross healthy and allows it to use Substitute more frequently over the course of the game; in the majority of games, it is sufficient recovery for Mega Metagross to function effectively. Prankster Mega Metagross differentiates itself from Wonder Guard Substitute + Baton Pass users by preventing Prankster Giratina from immediately forcing it out with Encore or Spore. A specially defensive EV spread is used so Mega Metagross's Substitute can take a hit from unboosted Xerneas's Moonblast and Sky Plate Mega Rayquaza's Oblivion Wing and so it can more effectively tank Boomburst from users like Pixilate Mega Diancie and Arceus.

Setup Mold Breaker users appreciate Mega Metagross's ability to pass them Substitutes and Coil or evasion boosts immensely. In return, they can threaten Magic Bounce users that can come in on Mega Metagross and bounce back Dark Void or Taunt. Dark Void + Oblivion Wing Mega Rayquaza in particular is a great teammate, as it appreciates both Coil's accuracy increase allowing it to use Dark Void against foes with impunity and Minimize boosts putting Prankster Giratina in a bind due to Oblivion Wing offsetting damage from Curse, therefore forcing it to use Encore—which can miss—instead. Bulkier offensive Pokemon, like Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, work well with both Coil and Minimize Mega Metagross because Defense boosts from Coil make them harder to revenge kill, while Minimize boosts allow them to fish for misses against Prankster Giratina's Encore and attacks from revenge killers. Magic Bounce Giratina excellently Imposter-proofs Mega Metagross, though the need for robust revenge killers due to forgoing Prankster Giratina means it is difficult to fit. Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users that threaten Giratina, namely Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Gengar, are also valuable teammates due to their ability to switch into Huge Power or Protean-boosted coverage moves that Mega Metagross may defensively struggle with. Prankster Giratina, support Wonder Guard users, and revenge killers are essential due to their ability to switch into offensive Mold Breaker users, remove entry hazards and act as clerics, and offensively check most opposing attackers, respectively.

Latios.comments:
Other Options

Mold Breaker Mega Latios is powerful enough with Soul Dew that it can run all-out attacking sets with Volt Switch and other coverage and STAB moves. Draco Meteor and Psycho Boost are alternative options on all-out attacking sets; both moves allow it to OHKO Primal Groudon and the latter OHKOes Wonder Guard Xerneas. Protean Mega Latios can invest more EVs into HP to live more hits against opposing Shadow Tag users. Protean Mega Latios can run a timid nature to outspeed most opposing Mega Latios and Mega Diancie at the cost of worse KO rolls on various Wonder Guard users and Giratina with super effective attacks. Other coverage moves may be used on Protean Mega Latios based on team needs.

Checks and Counters

Priority Attackers: Mega Latios's most significant threats are priority attackers that can revenge kill it like Shadow Tag Regigigas, -ate Speed users, and Huge Power + Extreme Speed attackers like Regigigas, Primal Groudon, Mega Mewtwo X., and Huge Power Dark-type Pokemon can cause mind games with the combination of Sucker Punch + Pursuit

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Shadow Tag users such as Mega Mewtwo X and Choice Scarfed Primal Groudon can outspeed and deal immense damage to Mega Latios or remove its Soul Dew with Trick. However, they cannot come in safely on Mold Breaker Mega Latios.

Pursuit Users: Many Pursuit users, like -Ate Speed users and Huge Power Mega Gyarados, also carry moves to threaten Mega Latios, leading to coinflip scenarios where it can either be OHKOed by the opponent's powerful attacks or a switching-boosted Pursuit

Item Removal: Getting rid of the source of Mega Latios's power via Knock Off or Trick makes it much less effective.

Imposter Users: It is difficult to Imposter-proof Mold Breaker Mega Latios, as very little can survive attacks from it while boosted. Choice Scarf imposter variants are still able to KO your Mega Latios despite the Special Defense boost from Soul Dew.

Prankster Users: Most Prankster Users cannot safely switch into Mega Latios's attack, but can lock Mold Breaker variants into Shell Smash with Encore or use Destiny Bond, Glare, or Curse as an emergency stop.

Magic Guard Ho-Oh: While rare, Magic Guard Ho-Oh can wall most Protean Mega Latios with its good typing and phenomenal special bulk, annoying it with status spreading in Psycho Shift. However, Ho-Oh is usually easily threatened by a physical Mold Breaker, Huge Power Pursuit user, or physical Shadow Tag user.

Fast Mold Breaker Users: Fast Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Rayquaza can outspeed Mega Latios and either put it to sleep or OHKO it while still threatening damage to the rest of its team.

Mold Breaker Sweeper.description:
Mold Breaker Mega Latios is an incredibly powerful sweeper that threatens the vast majority of the metagame with its Soul Dew-boosted attacks. Spore and Dark Void allow for easier setup with Shell Smash while also heavily disrupting teams. Shell Smash bolsters Mega Latios's offensive prowess, boosting its Special Attack and Speed enough to OHKO bulky Pokemon such as Mega Audino after Stealth Rock, Primal Kyogre, Arceus, and Yveltal. The boost to Speed also lets Mega Latios outspeed every Pokemon in the metagame, bar some Choice Scarf users such as Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y. Psystrike and Spacial Rend complement each other well; Spacial Rend is the primary STAB move, and OHKOes or 2HKOes the majority of foes after Shell Smash, while Psystrike handles special walls like Blissey, Chansey, and Primal Kyogre and Ho-Oh more reliably. King's Shield is an option over Spore and Dark Void to improve Mega Latios's match up against priority revenge killers such as Shadow Tag Regigigas, Aerilate Mega Rayquaza, and Huge Power Mewtwo Mega X running Extreme Speed. King's Shield also has additional utility in letting Mega Latios scout sets from offensive Pokemon in a one-on-one situation. 96 Speed EVs allow Mega Latios to outspeed neutral natured base 90 Speed Pokemon. The rest is put into HP to maximize bulk.

Mega Latios, an offensive powerhouse, is generally run on fast offense and bulky offense teams. Mega Latios operates best on teams utilizing two Mold Breaker users, as Mega Latios lacks recovery and relies too much on its item to be a good standalone Mold Breaker user; in particular, it pairs well with other bulky Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon and Mega Tyranitar. Mega Latio's weakness to Pursuit users such as Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal means it wants to be paired with checks to these such as Xerneas or Shadow Tag Mewtwo Mega X. It also likes Pokemon that can deal with very specially bulky Pokemon such as Blissey, Chansey, Ho-oh, and some Primal Kyogre variants, as these can tank Mega Latio's attacks decently; physical wallbreakers like Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X or Mega Gyarados can be paired with Mega Latios to fix this issue. Running a revenge killer alongside Mega Latios, such as an -ate user or Shadow Tag Regigigas, can be helpful versus Imposter users, as Pokemon that can safely Imposter-proof Mega Latios are very rare, and offensive Imposter-proofing is usually more effective. If running an -ate user, entry hazards like Stealth Rock are useful to keep up the pressure. Substitute + Wonder Guard Pokemon typically also run Defog and Aromatherapy to help keep Mega Latios and other Mold Breaker Pokemon healthy over the course of longer games.

Latios-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Mold Breaker Mega Latios is powerful enough with Soul Dew that it can run all-out attacking sets with Volt Switch and other coverage and STAB moves. Draco Meteor and Psycho Boost are alternative options on all-out attacking sets; both moves allow it to OHKO Primal Groudon and the latter OHKOes Wonder Guard Xerneas. Protean Mega Latios can invest more EVs into HP to live more hits against opposing Shadow Tag users. Protean Mega Latios can run a timid nature to outspeed most opposing Mega Latios and Mega Diancie at the cost of worse KO rolls on various Wonder Guard users and Giratina with super effective attacks. Other coverage moves may be used on Protean Mega Latios based on team needs.

Checks and Counters

Priority Attackers: Mega Latios's most significant threats are priority attackers that can revenge kill it like Shadow Tag Regigigas, -ate Speed users, and Huge Power + Extreme Speed attackers like Regigigas, Primal Groudon, Mega Mewtwo X., and Huge Power Dark-type Pokemon can cause mind games with the combination of Sucker Punch + Pursuit

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Shadow Tag users such as Mega Mewtwo X and Choice Scarfed Primal Groudon can outspeed and deal immense damage to Mega Latios or remove its Soul Dew with Trick. However, they cannot come in safely on Mold Breaker Mega Latios.

Pursuit Users: Many Pursuit users, like -Ate Speed users and Huge Power Mega Gyarados, also carry moves to threaten Mega Latios, leading to coinflip scenarios where it can either be OHKOed by the opponent's powerful attacks or a switching-boosted Pursuit

Item Removal: Getting rid of the source of Mega Latios's power via Knock Off or Trick makes it much less effective.

Imposter Users: It is difficult to Imposter-proof Mold Breaker Mega Latios, as very little can survive attacks from it while boosted. Choice Scarf imposter variants are still able to KO your Mega Latios despite the Special Defense boost from Soul Dew.

Prankster Users: Most Prankster Users cannot safely switch into Mega Latios's attack, but can lock Mold Breaker variants into Shell Smash with Encore or use Destiny Bond, Glare, or Curse as an emergency stop.

Magic Guard Ho-Oh: While rare, Magic Guard Ho-Oh can wall most Protean Mega Latios with its good typing and phenomenal special bulk, annoying it with status spreading in Psycho Shift. However, Ho-Oh is usually easily threatened by a physical Mold Breaker, Huge Power Pursuit user, or physical Shadow Tag user.

Fast Mold Breaker Users: Fast Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Rayquaza can outspeed Mega Latios and either put it to sleep or OHKO it while still threatening damage to the rest of its team.

Protean Wallbreaker.description:
Protean Mega Latios uses its ludicrously high Soul Dew-boosted Special Attack and four coverage moves to dismantle opposing Wonder Guard cores, along with slower non-Wonder Guard Pokemon. Flash Cannon targets and OHKOes both Xerneas and physically defensive Mega Audino, as well as making Mega Latios resistant to all -ate Speed attacks via Protean, making it more difficult to revenge kill. Grass Knot targets Primal Kyogre and Mega Swampert while OHKOing Primal Groudon, but it doesn't always OHKO specially defensive variants of Primal Kyogre. An alternative is Freeze-Dry, as it also hits Giratina and Gyarados for super effective damage at the cost of only 2HKOing Primal Groudon and Primal Kyogre. It also hits the rare Ice-weak Wonder Guards like Zapdos and Landourus, but usually this doesn't matter due to how infrequently they are used. Secret Sword OHKOs Wonder Guard Blissey and Chansey, but only 2HKOes physically defensive Arceus and Slaking. Aura Sphere can be used to OHKO Arceus and Slaking, but it doesn't break through Chansey on only 2HKOes Blissey. Searing Shot threatens Mega Scizor as well as the occasional Registeel and Mega Steelix, and Earth Power threatens all Primal Groudon variants as well as Wonder Guard Mega Manectric, Skuntank, and Drapion. Moonblast OHKOes both Mega Sableye and Giratina. Bug Buzz OHKOes Mega Mewtwo Y, most Cresselia, and Deoxys-S, stopping them from safely passing a Substitute to a teammate using Baton Pass. Lastly, Gastro Acid can negate the opposing Pokemon's Wonder Guard but is often a momentum drain.

Mega Latios fits best on bulky offense and balance teams, where Choice item Mold Breaker userss like Mega Rayquaza, Primal Groudon, and Mega Mewtwo Y help Mega Latios against opposing Wonder Guard cores it can't break through on its own, threatening them for huge damage. Furthermore, Mega Latios can consistently force opposing Wonder Guard users in, gaining momentum for these wallbreakers. Additionally, Huge Power and Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X pair well with Mega Latios as their coverage can break through opposing Wonder Guard users that Mega Latios can't. Mega Gyarados heavily threatens Prankster Giratina and Ho-Oh, Pokemon that can switch in on Mega Latios. Aromatherapy is also appreciated, as paralysis often hampers Mega Latios's offensive presence, and it dislikes taking chip damage from burn and poison. Mega Latios performs particularly well with a slow Substitute + Baton Pass teammate like Wonder Guard Xerneas, Skuntank, Mega Swampert, or Mega Sableye, as it will safely threaten opposing teams while being more difficult to revenge kill.

Kyogre-Primal.comments:
Other Options

An alternate EV spread of 248 HP / 252 Atk / 8 SpD with an Adamant nature and Water Shuriken can be used to revenge kill Shell Smash + Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Mega Diancie at -1 Defense, but this has little other utility. A Chesto Berry alongside Whirlwind, Nuzzle, or Glare can make Primal Kyogre a safer check to Dark Void variants of Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie, albeit only once. Blue Orb makes Primal Kyogre immune to Trick, reduces damage from Mold Breaker Knock Off, and helps it Imposter-proof Trick + Choice Specs Mold Breaker and Trick + Choice Scarf No Guard teammates. Leftovers allows Primal Kyogre to use Recover less frequently, potentially maintaining momentum for its team. However, sacrificing Shed Shell's resistance to Shadow Tag users makes Primal Kyogre more difficult to use.

Though Primal Kyogre already struggles with four-moveslot syndrome, it can nevertheless viably run a myriad of other support options. Nuzzle allows Primal Kyogre to disrupt the opposing team while also making it more resilient versus Taunt users. In addition, the most relevant Pokemon immune to the move—Primal Groudon—doesn't want to switch into Primal Kyogre. However, Nuzzle + Scald Primal Kyogre sets can make Imposter-proofing more difficult, as the two moves combined can disrupt virtually every non-Wonder Guard user. Glare is another paralysis option that does affect Primal Groudon, should that be necessary, but leaves Primal Kyogre more vulnerable to Taunt and is less effective versus Magic Bounce users. Chatter is another Taunt-resistant disruption option for minimum Speed variants of Primal Kyogre to disrupt Pokemon receiving Substitute from faster Baton Pass users. Perish Song is an alternative to Whirlwind that puts Substitute + Baton Pass Magic Bounce users, which are immune to Whirlwind, on a timer. Magic Coat reflects sleep moves from Mold Breaker users, Parting Shot and Stealth Rock from -ate Speed users like Mega Abomasnow, and Sing, Gastro Acid, Taunt, and Spider Web from No Guard users. Parting Shot is an alternative to Baton Pass that fares worse against Magic Bounce users but better against Curse and Gastro Acid users.
