Finally, Primal Kyogre is also a decent user of Stealth Rock and other entry hazards, though its inability to threaten common Magic Bounce users means it requires greater team support.

Thanks to its sky-high Special Attack stat, Primal Kyogre can also run a decent Shell Smash + Wonder Guard set with an EV spread of 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe, a Modest nature, Judgment, and a Meadow Plate. Notably, Primal Kyogre's +2 Meadow Plate Judgment OHKOes standard Primal Groudon, allowing it to forgo its STAB move for additional coverage. A Choice Specs + Mold Breaker set is also a viable option, as its STAB Steam Eruption OHKOes and 2HKOes large swathes of the metagame; Giratina, opposing Primal Kyogre, Blissey, and very bulky RegenVest users are some of the only switch-ins to Steam Eruption. Additionally, Choice Specs Primal Kyogre can make use of coverage moves like Moonblast, Ice Beam, Freeze-Dry, and Secret Sword to break through those aforementioned checks, leaving it with few true switch-ins.

Finally, it's worth noting that on teams with three or more Primal Kyogre—colloquially known as spam teams—fringe Primal Kyogre sets such as Huge Power + Water Shuriken, RegenVest, Parental Bond, and Magic Bounce have significantly increased viability.

Checks and Counters

Grass- and Electric-type Coverage: Despite its impressive bulk, like any Wonder Guard user, Primal Kyogre is vulnerable to OHKOs from powerful foes carrying the right coverage, such as Petal Blizzard Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Grass Knot Protean Mega Latios. Additionally, Primal Kyogre's popularity as a Wonder Guard user means that most teams are prepared to face it, making such coverage moves more common. King's Shield variants of Primal Kyogre, however, can scout the aforementioned foes and somewhat mitigate the unfavorable matchup.

Trick: Unless it's holding Blue Orb, Trick users can saddle Primal Kyogre with a Choice item for the entirety of the match, forcing it to either use Baton Pass or relinquish momentum. Additionally, Poison-type Trick users like Mega Beedrill can Trick Primal Kyogre their Black Sludge, forcing Primal Kyogre to use Recover more often and making it easier to KO.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: Despite Primal Kyogre's incredible bulk, Shell Smash + Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Arceus can still break through it with decent sleep turn luck. Mold Breaker Mega Latios doesn't even need sleep or luck, as it can just power through Primal Kyogre's weaker Defense with Psystrike. In addition, if Primal Kyogre forgoes King's Shield, it's also forced out easily by Choice Band Mold Breaker users like Mega Rayquaza, and even by Shell Smash Primal Groudon if Primal Kyogre isn't fully healthy.

Prankster Giratina: Like is the case with most defensive Wonder Guard users, Prankster Giratina can come in on virtually every Primal Kyogre set and force it out with Encore or chip it with Will-O-Wisp. Giratina dislikes getting burned by Scald, however. Further, teammates running Huge Power + Pursuit, in particular Mega Gyarados and Mega Tyranitar, can discourage Giratina from switching in on Primal Kyogre.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: If Primal Kyogre forgoes or loses its Shed Shell, it's very vulnerable to offensive Shadow Tag users. Baton Pass can mitigate this weakness to some extent, though never completely.

Taunt: Taunt forces out almost all variants of Primal Kyogre that forgo Scald. Even Scald variants find themselves unable to support their team versus Taunt users.

Wonder Guard Support.description:
Massive special bulk, pure Water typing, a flexible Speed tier, and forcing out metagame titan Primal Groudon make Primal Kyogre one of the format's best support Wonder Guard users. Scald is an extremely useful STAB move that OHKOes all variants of Primal Groudon and Mold Breaker Mega Diancie. Additionally, Scald's burn chance makes switching in risky for threats like physical Mega Rayquaza. Alternatively, since even the threat of Scald is good at forcing out Primal Groudon, Primal Kyogre can forgo its STAB attack to provide pivoting support with Baton Pass. Defog and Aromatherapy are extremely valuable support options on the majority of team structures. However, if a teammate is carrying either one, Primal Kyogre can opt to use King's Shield or Whirlwind. The former gives Primal Kyogre a scouting tool and improves its matchup against physical Mold Breaker users such as Mega Rayquaza. Whirlwind, on the other hand, exploits Primal Kyogre being notoriously difficult for many special Mold Breaker users and powerful special coverage moves, excluding Protean Mega Latios's Grass Knot, to OHKO. Primal Kyogre can also use both Baton Pass and Scald by forgoing one of its standard utility moveslots, though this type of set is usually restricted to teams with room for multiple defensive Wonder Guard users. Finally, recovery is essential for Primal Kyogre to fill its role as a support Wonder Guard user effectively. Wish synergizes well with King's Shield and can support Primal Kyogre's teammates, but Recover is usually preferred for its immediacy and greater ease of use. A Calm nature and a specially defensive EV spread allow Primal Kyogre to tank hits from specially offensive Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie, as well as scouting powerful special coverage moves from attackers such as Wonder Guard + Shell Smash Mega Gardevoir and Protean Mega Mewtwo Y. A physically defensive EV spread with a Bold nature is an equally viable option, however, as this set checks Primal Groudon with greater ease and offers better mixed bulk for scouting Pokemon, such as Mega Rayquaza, that can run both physical and special sets. A Sassy or Relaxed nature alongside 0 Speed IVs can be run on Baton Pass variants of Primal Kyogre to better bring teammates in safely. A Shed Shell is the preferred item to make Primal Kyogre more resilient versus Shadow Tag users. However, Safety Goggles can be used to make Primal Kyogre a harder check to Spore + Mold Breaker users; special ones such as Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie for specially defensive Primal Kyogre, or Primal Groudon and Mega Tyranitar for physically defensive sets.

The vast majority of team structures appreciate the utility that Primal Kyogre can provide. Notably, Primal Kyogre works very well alongside the popular Mold Breaker Primal Groudon + Wonder Guard Xerneas + Prankster Giratina core, defensively covering most offensive threats alongside Xerneas and Giratina. Giratina is a notable partner outside of this core as well, though, as it can easily switch into Huge Power- and Protean-boosted Grass- and Electric-type attacks aimed at Primal Kyogre. In return, specially defensive Primal Kyogre can soft check powerful Ghost- and Fairy-type attackers like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie for Giratina, particularly if running Safety Goggles and Whirlwind. Primal Kyogre's vulnerability to Protean Mega Latios and Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X means it appreciates teammates that can force them out, such Pixilate Mega Diancie, Aerilate Mega Rayquaza, offensive Shadow Tag users such as Mega Mewtwo Y, and faster No Guard users like Mega Aerodactyl. In addition, those same teammates make excellent entry hazard setters, thus synergizing especially well with Whirlwind variants of Primal Kyogre. Many Choice Specs + Mold Breaker users—such as Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo Y—appreciate specially defensive Primal Kyogre efficiently Imposter-proofing them. On bulkier balance teams, Primal Kyogre can be run alongside another defensive Wonder Guard user—such as Cresselia, Mega Scizor, or Mega Audino—for more flexibility with both their movesets. Finally, Pursuit users such as Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Yveltal, and Mega Tyranitar are excellent teammates to pressure Giratina, Primal Kyogre's most common non-Wonder Guard switch-in.

Groudon-Primal.comments:
Other Options

Primal Groudon can run a variety of moves that help it support its team and match up better against Giratina, such as Glare, Sacred Fire, Sheer Cold, U-Turn, and Knock Off. Earth Plate and Life Orb can improve damage rolls on Shell Smash sets. Choice Band Sets can run various priority moves to revenge kill some offensive threats after chip damage. It can also run entry hazards to set up for better rolls later. More Speed EVs can be given to both Mold Breaker Primal Groudon sets if they wish to outspeed a specific threat. Mold Breaker Primal Groudon can run a special set with Earth Plate + Judgment. Shadow Tag Primal Groudon can use various coverage moves to target specific Wonder Guard users. Recovery moves may also be used on Shadow Tag Primal Groudon for longevity. Surf may also be used to OHKO opposing Primal Groudon without needing to worry about damage rolls with Thousand Arrows.

Checks and Counters

Prankster Giratina: Prankster Giratina uses its immense bulk to severely diminish Primal Groudon's offensive presence with Glare and force Shell Smash sweeper variants out with Encore. However, it can be hindered through with Dark Void from Shell Smash variants, Beat Up from Choice Band variants, and Trick from Shadow Tag + Choice Scarf variants.

Imposter users: The strong neutral coverage of Thousand Arrows makes Imposter users able to easily countersweep if they copy a boosted Primal Groudon. Choice Band and Shadow Tag variants are both forced out by Imposter as well. Primal Groudon sets with Dark Void are more susceptible to countersweeps because they can then deal with a healthy Giratina. Choice Scarf Imposter users are more manageable, as they are forced to choose only one move.

Huge Power Mega Gyarados: Huge Power Mega Gyarados can OHKO Primal Groudon not running bulk with Water Shuriken and deal immense damage to it with Pursuit if it switches. It needs to be wary of using Pursuit as Primal Groudon uses King's Shield, however.

Other Revenge Killers: Many -ate Speed users and Huge Power revenge killers can force unboosted Primal Groudon out with their priority attacks. However, many of these fail to revenge kill Primal Groudon if it runs King's Shield. Some Choice Scarf + No Guard users, like Mega Mewtwo Y and Deoxys-S, outspeed any Primal Groudon even after a Shell Smash and can OHKO it. Additionally, Choice Scarf + Shadow Tag users, like Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo Y, can outspeed many Mold Breaker Primal Groudon sets and OHKO it with a special Water-type move.

Faster Hard Hitters: In a one-on-one scenario, faster Pokemon that are sufficiently strong, such as Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Protean Mega Latios, and Choice Specs Mega Mewtwo Y or Mega Rayquaza, can force Primal Groudon out. Some Shell Smash + Wonder Guard users, such as Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Lucario can OHKO Primal Groudon if boosted.

Water-type Coverage: Pokemon that Primal Groudon often switches in on, like Xerneas, Wonder Guard Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Manectric, can run Water-type moves to catch it off guard and OHKO it.

Physical Shell Smash Sweeper.description:
With its amazing physical bulk, incredible offensive typing, ridiculous Attack stat, nifty immunity to the otherwise problematic Will-O-Wisp, and great synergy with other metagame titans, Primal Groudon is the single most threatening offensive Pokemon in the metagame. Every team must prepare for Primal Groudon heavily in the teambuilder, and most teams use one defensive check and one offensive check. Spore or Dark Void allows Primal Groudon to set up against its most common switch-in, Giratina; Spore has 100% accuracy and allows for Imposter-proofing with Safety Goggles Prankster Giratina, while Dark Void affects opposing Safety Goggles users. Stealth Rock is another option, as Primal Groudon forces numerous switches and can use the free turn to set entry hazards. Taunt lets Primal Groudon consistently beat Giratina, which almost always runs four status moves, but is far less useful against its other checks like Primal Kyogre. Shell Smash allows Primal Groudon to boost both its Attack and Speed in a single turn, synergizing well with disruption in Spore, Dark Void, or Taunt. Thousand Arrows is virtually unresisted in the metagame, meaning Primal Groudon can often run a single attack and have tremendous flexibility with its moveset. King's Shield creates mind games with opposing revenge killers, often rendering them null as a threat; V-create is another good choice that allows Primal Groudon to immediately threaten bulky unresisted foes, such as Wonder Guard Slaking, Mega Audino, and Cresselia, much more effectively, forcing them out more often. Primal Groudon has several options for its item; Leftovers synergizes particularly well with King's Shield and increases Primal Groudon's longevity, Lum Berry potentially gifts Primal Groudon a free turn to set up, and Mental Herb allows Primal Groudon to set up against Prankster Giratina lacking Glare or Spore much more easily, nearly always forcing a sack. Mold Breaker allows Primal Groudon to ignore Wonder Guard, allowing it to take full advantage of Thousand Arrows's amazing neutral coverage. The given spread maximizes physical bulk while allowing Primal Groudon to outspeed Pokemon with 150 base Speed, such as Deoxys-Attack and Mega Aerodactyl, after a Shell Smash; an Adamant nature further increases Primal Groudon's offensive prowess, allowing it to 2HKO Giratina after Shell Smash.

Primal Groudon fits on nearly every team structure, as its combination of base stats, great STAB moves, and ability to threaten other top metagame threats' checks make it too good to forgo. Prankster Giratina is Primal Groudon's best partner, as it can Imposter-proof Primal Groudon and use Will-O-Wisp or Glare to grant Primal Groudon more opportunities to set up. Giratina also has the option of running Destiny Bond, which is especially useful against Huge Power Mega Gyarados, a common switch-in to Primal Groudon. Despite its impressive bulk, Primal Groudon appreciates being brought in safely by Substitute + Baton Pass users like Wonder Guard Xerneas and Magic Bounce Giratina. Specially offensive Mold Breaker users like Mega Diancie, Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, and Dialga are great partners to threaten Giratina. In particular, Dialga is an excellent partner, as it can check Gale Wings users and Mega Gyarados lacking Sucker Punch, two common revenge killers to Primal Groudon. Offensive Wonder Guard users, like Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Lucario, are also quite good at forcing out most revenge killers that otherwise take full advantage of unboosted Primal Groudon. As Giratina is Primal Groudon's greatest obstacle, Huge Power Mega Gyarados is a great partner; it can also potentially force out a chipped Imposter user. Physically defensive Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, as well as Wonder Guard Mega Swampert, are good partners as well due to their ability to check unboosted Imposter users; the latter can also run a Substitute + Baton Pass set to allow offensive teammates to set up more easily. Lastly, Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X is a good partner, as with bulk investment it can survive Lum Berry Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch and OHKO back with a Fighting-type attack.

Choice Band + Mold Breaker.description:
Choice Band + Mold Breaker Primal Groudon is one of the most powerful Choice item attackers in the metagame due to its incredible STAB moves, great defensive typing, immunity to burns, and amazing bulk. V-create is a ludicrously powerful STAB move that threatens the entirety of the unresisted metagame, notably OHKOing physically defensive Wonder Guard Slaking, Arceus, Mega Audino, and Cresselia after Stealth Rock. In contrast, Thousand Arrows is a virtually unresisted STAB move that is more spammable than V-create thanks to having no drawbacks, freely threatening slower Pokemon, such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas and Wonder Guard Mega Scizor, alongside paralyzed offensive Pokemon, like opposing Primal Groudon, chipped Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, slightly damaged Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Gengar. Beat Up is a great coverage option to heavily damage Prankster Giratina and the rare Mega Slowbro, which would ordinarily switch in on Choice Band Primal Groudon. Alternatively, Precipice Blades still 2HKOes Giratina while also threatening non-Flying-types much more effectively than Beat Up; however, opposing Prankster Giratina has a good chance to successfully fish for a miss by repeatedly using Recover. Knock Off item removal can be useful when forcing mind games, especially against defensive Wonder Guard users running Shed Shell when running a Shadow Tag teammate, and it still threatens Magic Bounce Giratina if Giratina has an intact item and even slight chip damage. Trick is a great option to incapacitate Prankster Giratina, supporting offensive and Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard teammates by shutting down their largest counter. U-turn allows Primal Groudon to retain momentum for its team, as well as continually forcing chip damage against its main check in Giratina. Primal Groudon outspeeds most relevant threats without Speed investment at +2, and the extra HP investment helps it survive -ate Speed from users like Abomasnow.

Primal Groudon works best on bulky offense teams, which appreciate its ability to force coinflip scenarios against slower teams and create momentum for offensive teammates. Prankster Giratina benefits Primal Groudon greatly by Imposter-proofing it thanks to its massive physical bulk and V-create resistance. Since opposing Prankster Giratina is Primal Groudon's most common switch-in, Huge Power Dark-types that can remove it with Pursuit, such as Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal, are valuable partners for it; they can also heavily damage most Choice item + Shadow Tag users, which pick a weakened Primal Groudon off. In particular, Mega Gyarados is great, as it can also switch into an opposing Shell Smash Primal Groudon if healthy and force it out with Water Shuriken. Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users allow Primal Groudon to come in safely with a Substitute, helping it beat offensive Pokemon like opposing Primal Groudon and Protean Mega Latios one-on-one. In particular, Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas has great utility in forcing Prankster Giratina and most Magic Bounce users out with Moonblast, and it can run a diverse array of support options in its filler moveslot, such as Stealth Rock, Defog, Aromatherapy, paralysis support in Glare, Dark Void, Taunt, and even Wish or Shell Smash support for Primal Groudon. Special Mold Breaker users, especially more powerful ones like Mega Latios, Mega Diancie, Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, and Dialga, can force Giratina out after Primal Groudon uses U-turn. Paralysis support from the likes of Prankster Giratina, as well as select support Wonder Guard users, can make Primal Groudon even more threatening by providing free turns. Also, Primal Groudon can force out paralyzed offensive threats like Mega Gengar, Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y lacking a Choice Scarf, Mega Latios, and special Mega Rayquaza. Shadow Tag users can work well with Knock Off Primal Groudon, as the likes of Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre and bulky Gastro Acid + Wonder Guard users like Arceus are secondary switch-ins to it. Entry hazard setters, such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users, defensive Wonder Guard users, and bulky Mold Breaker teammates, can bolster Primal Groudon's offensive prowess, as the additional chip damage from Stealth Rock affects Primal Groudon's KO rolls in a wide variety of instances. Defensive Wonder Guard users can provide Defog and Aromatherapy support, keeping Primal Groudon healthy over the course of a game.

Shadow Tag.description:
Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Primal Groudon uses its high Speed to revenge kill opposing threats, Trick to incapacitate opposing Pokemon, and STAB V-create to eliminate offensive threats. With a Jolly nature, Choice Scarf Primal Groudon can trap, outspeed, and OHKO Mega Beedrill, Pixilate Mega Diancie, Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, Mold Breaker Dialga, and some variants of bulky Primal Groudon after a Shell Smash. Shadow Tag Primal Groudon uses Trick to lock opponents such as Wonder Guard Xerneas and Giratina into one move, removing much of their effectiveness. After trapping the opponent and using Trick, Primal Groudon can take the opportunity to set up entry hazards or use Perish Song to eliminate them.

Shadow Tag Primal Groudon fits best on offense teams due to its ability to eliminate key threats and incapacitate others with Choice Scarf + Trick. It appreciates teammates that match up well against Mega Gyarados such as Mega Mewtwo X and Pixilate Mega Diancie so that it does not have to fear its powerful Water Shuriken + Pursuit combo. Shadow Tag Primal Groudon also synergizes well with Pokemon that are revenge killed by Pixilate Mega Diancie, such as Mega Rayquaza, Mega Mewtwo X, and Mega Gyarados, since it can switch in on Diancie's attacks and can OHKO it. Primal Groudon also works well on any team that wants to get rid of Wonder Guard Mega Beedrill, as it easily does so while providing great utility for the team it's on.

Rayquaza.comments:
Other Options

Choice Band, Choice Specs Mold Breaker, and Aerilate Mega Rayquaza can run other coverage moves to more effectively threaten a variety of Pokemon such as Giratina, Xerneas, and Arceus. Spore and Taunt may be run for disruption on Aerilate sets, but entry hazards, Boomburst, and Pursuit are usually too valuable to replace. A Jolly or Timid nature can be run on Choice item Mold Breaker sets to outspeed most opposing Mega Rayquaza, but they sacrifice damage against Giratina and important damage rolls with Aeroblast, like not always 2HKOing specially defensive Primal Kyogre after Stealth Rock. Choice Band Mega Rayquaza can use entry hazards to capitalize on the switches it forces. Extreme Speed on Choice Band sets can pick off weakened foes; it does fail to threaten bulkier sweepers like Primal Groudon and Dialga, though Water Shuriken can be run for the former. U-turn over Volt Switch on Choice Specs sets can threaten Blissey significantly more and pivot against Primal Groudon, but the better damage from Volt Switch is usually preferred. Both Choice Band and Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza can run slower EV spreads and invest in Defense, which helps them tank hits from Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Slaking, and Regigigas at the cost of being outsped by opposing Mega Rayquaza. Substitute sets can run Taunt over Dark Void to shut down Blissey and Giratina. Oblivion Wing Mega Rayquaza can also run Cotton Guard + Quiver Dance, which allows it to resist many revenge killing attempts that would otherwise threaten a standard set, but the longer setup time and susceptibility to countersweeps from Imposter Chansey make it a niche pick. Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza run either physical or special Shell Smash sets with Dragon Ascent and Aeroblast, respectively, but doing so can be difficult to Imposter-proof. Sky Plate, Shed Shell, or Life Orb can be run on Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza while forgoing Trick, allowing it to run a higher variety of support moves. However, even with favorable rolls from Life Orb, the extra damage from Choice Specs is usually required in order to consistently KO certain threats like Primal Groudon with Oblivion Wing.

Checks and Counters

Prankster Giratina: A healthy Prankster Giratina can reliably switch into both Choice Band and Substitute Mega Rayquaza to check it with Destiny Bond, Glare, or a well-timed Encore; it must be wary of Dark Void and Taunt from Substitute Mega Rayquaza, however.

Imposter Chansey: Imposter Chansey forces out all common variants of Mega Rayquaza. Even though Substitute blocks Imposter, Whirlwind lets Chansey tank and force out Substitute + Oblivion Wing variants. It can also be very threatening if it copies Aerilate or Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza with Taunt or Spore.

Shadow Tag: Offensive Shadow Tag users, like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, can consistently trap and KO Mega Rayquaza with their powerful attacks. Shadow Tag Regigigas is particularly dangerous for its reliability in removing most Mega Rayquaza with Fake Out + Extreme Speed. Perish Song + Shadow Tag users such as Lugia and Arceus can eliminate Mega Rayquaza as well, but not as reliably.

Priority Users: -Ate users and Mega Gyarados can OHKO Mega Rayquaza with Extreme Speed and Sucker Punch; the latter can also punish a switch with Pursuit. Mega Diancie is of note for surviving a boosted Oblivion Wing and always OHKOing Substitute variants with Boomburst. However, the increased priority given to Flying-type moves by Gale Wings means variants of Mega Rayquaza with this ability do not have to worry about being knocked out by Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch.

Blissey: Specially defensive Blissey walls both Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza and Substitute Mega Rayquaza, though the latter can break through with good sleep turn luck.

Wonder Guard Users: Most Wonder Guard users can switch into Gale Wings and Aerilate Mega Rayquaza. While some need to be wary of Taunt, Trick, and Spore, their immunity to Mega Rayquaza's attacks makes them reliable and consistent checks.

Stealth Rock: Stealth Rock punishes Mega Rayquaza for its frequent switching, making it fail to survive most revenge killing attempts. Oblivion Wing sets can heal back the damage, however.

King's Shield Users: Activating King's Shield negates any threat that Choice Band Mega Rayquaza may pose, and it can be used to scout against Choice Specs variants.

Choice Band + Mold Breaker.description:
Moves

Mega Rayquaza uses its sky-high Attack stat primarily to obliterate foes with its STAB Dragon Ascent, which deals huge damage to everything that doesn't resist it. Sacred Fire is used to hit Steel-type Pokemon, such as Wonder Guard Mega Scizor, Registeel, and Mega Steelix; it also finds great utility in its 50% burn chance, which constantly chips at bulky switch-ins like Prankster Giratina while weakening opposing Imposter users. Precipice Blades is another good option, OHKOing Mold Breaker Mega Tyranitar from full health and Primal Groudon after Stealth Rock. Crabhammer can be used to OHKO Primal Groudon and KO Mega Tyranitar after Stealth Rock, while Trick invalidates would-be checks like King's Shield users and Giratina by forcing them to stick to one status move. Extreme Speed is a great option for picking off weakened foes, especially with Mega Rayquaza's high Attack stat and Choice Band. U-turn takes advantage of Mega Rayquaza demanding switch-ins, as it allows you to conserve momentum. Mega Rayquaza's Mold Breaker allows it threaten opposing Wonder Guard users, letting it keep momentum even more effectively.

Rayquaza's most common check is Prankster Giratina, so naturally anything that can beat it pairs well with Mega Rayquaza. Mega Gyarados is an amazing option, as it can force coinflip scenarios against Giratina with its Huge Power-boosted Pursuit and Knock Off. Special Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie can continuously pressure Giratina. Mega Gengar in particular is amazing for its Speed, which lets it take care of fast threats that Mega Rayquaza can't; notably it Speed ties with Mega Mewtwo X and outspeeds opposing Mega Rayquaza, Timid Mega Latios, and Timid Mega Diancie. Slow pivots like Mega Audino, Mega Scizor, and Cresselia, allow Mega Rayquza to get into the field safely, capitalizing on its potential to pressure many Pokemon with its devastating attacks once in. Mega Rayquaza also appreciates the help from Aromatherapy and Defog users like Primal Kyogre and Mega Audino to remove status and Stealth Rock. This set can also be paired with a Choice Specs Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza as not only do they defeat each other's checks, but the opponent lack reliable counterplay due to not knowing which set is in. Mega Rayquaza pairs well with -ate Speed Pokemon because it takes advantage of their ability to force opposing Wonder Guards users in.

Aerilate Revenge Killer.description:
Mega Rayquaza's incredibly high mixed attacking stats and offensive typing make it a powerful revenge killer. Aerilate-boosted Fake Out and Extreme Speed allow Mega Rayquaza to reliably revenge kill most No Guard users and Mold Breaker + Shell Smash sweepers, with exceptions being Flying-resistant Pokemon like Dialga, Zekrom, and Mega Tyranitar as well as King's Shield users like Primal Groudon. Boomburst is a dizzyingly powerful move that is used to deal massive damage to Giratina, who otherwise soaks up Extreme Speed. Gastro Acid punishes Wonder Guard switch-ins by allowing Mega Rayquaza to use its powerful STABs against them. Stealth Rock and Spikes can also be used instead to capitalize on the switches Aerilate Mega Rayquaza forces. Pursuit is used to punish Wonder Guard switch-ins and take advantage of the pressure Mega Rayquaza puts on opposing Pokemon with its STAB attacks. Sacred Fire is used to spread burns across the opponent's team while hitting the likes of Mega Scizor, Genesect, and Escavalier. Sky Plate is used to allow Mega Rayquaza's Boomburst to 2HKO Giratina while also boosting Extreme Speed. Lum Berry is an option that allows Mega Rayquaza to switch into Spore, Glare, Will-O-Wisp, and other status moves from Pokemon such as Prankster Giratina.

Aerilate Mega Rayquaza fits best on balance teams that appreciate its ability to revenge kill common Pokemon such as Mega Gengar, Mega Mewtwo X and Y, most No Guard users, and Primal Groudon after chip, provided they aren't running King's Shield. Since Aerilate Mega Rayquaza lacks both a defensive profile and ways to consistently damage opposing Wonder Guard users, it appreciates both defensive and other offensive Pokemon such as Wonder Guard Xerneas or Wonder Guard Mega Audino, as well as common Mold Breaker users such as Primal Groudon, Mega Gengar, and Mega Diancie. Aerilate Mega Rayquaza also loves teammates such as Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre and Prankster Giratina, as it lacks recovery and can be worn down quickly by Stealth Rock and offensive Pokemon such as Pixilate Mega Diancie. Primal Kyogre provides entry hazard control through Defog and Giratina can threaten and force out opposing set-up sweepers and Wonder Guard users with Encore and Curse. Shadow Tag Pokemon such as Mega Mewtwo X and Y are also great teammates, as they are able to trap and remove common Wonder Guard Pokemon that lack Shed Shell such as Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas.

Rayquaza-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Choice Band, Choice Specs Mold Breaker, and Aerilate Mega Rayquaza can run other coverage moves to more effectively threaten a variety of Pokemon such as Giratina, Xerneas, and Arceus. Spore and Taunt may be run for disruption on Aerilate sets, but entry hazards, Boomburst, and Pursuit are usually too valuable to replace. A Jolly or Timid nature can be run on Choice item Mold Breaker sets to outspeed most opposing Mega Rayquaza, but they sacrifice damage against Giratina and important damage rolls with Aeroblast, like not always 2HKOing specially defensive Primal Kyogre after Stealth Rock. Choice Band Mega Rayquaza can use entry hazards to capitalize on the switches it forces. Extreme Speed on Choice Band sets can pick off weakened foes; it does fail to threaten bulkier sweepers like Primal Groudon and Dialga, though Water Shuriken can be run for the former. U-turn over Volt Switch on Choice Specs sets can threaten Blissey significantly more and pivot against Primal Groudon, but the better damage from Volt Switch is usually preferred. Both Choice Band and Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza can run slower EV spreads and invest in Defense, which helps them tank hits from Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Slaking, and Regigigas at the cost of being outsped by opposing Mega Rayquaza. Substitute sets can run Taunt over Dark Void to shut down Blissey and Giratina. Oblivion Wing Mega Rayquaza can also run Cotton Guard + Quiver Dance, which allows it to resist many revenge killing attempts that would otherwise threaten a standard set, but the longer setup time and susceptibility to countersweeps from Imposter Chansey make it a niche pick. Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza run either physical or special Shell Smash sets with Dragon Ascent and Aeroblast, respectively, but doing so can be difficult to Imposter-proof. Sky Plate, Shed Shell, or Life Orb can be run on Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza while forgoing Trick, allowing it to run a higher variety of support moves. However, even with favorable rolls from Life Orb, the extra damage from Choice Specs is usually required in order to consistently KO certain threats like Primal Groudon with Oblivion Wing.

Checks and Counters

Prankster Giratina: A healthy Prankster Giratina can reliably switch into both Choice Band and Substitute Mega Rayquaza to check it with Destiny Bond, Glare, or a well-timed Encore; it must be wary of Dark Void and Taunt from Substitute Mega Rayquaza, however.

Imposter Chansey: Imposter Chansey forces out all common variants of Mega Rayquaza. Even though Substitute blocks Imposter, Whirlwind lets Chansey tank and force out Substitute + Oblivion Wing variants. It can also be very threatening if it copies Aerilate or Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza with Taunt or Spore.

Shadow Tag: Offensive Shadow Tag users, like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, can consistently trap and KO Mega Rayquaza with their powerful attacks. Shadow Tag Regigigas is particularly dangerous for its reliability in removing most Mega Rayquaza with Fake Out + Extreme Speed. Perish Song + Shadow Tag users such as Lugia and Arceus can eliminate Mega Rayquaza as well, but not as reliably.

Priority Users: -Ate users and Mega Gyarados can OHKO Mega Rayquaza with Extreme Speed and Sucker Punch; the latter can also punish a switch with Pursuit. Mega Diancie is of note for surviving a boosted Oblivion Wing and always OHKOing Substitute variants with Boomburst. However, the increased priority given to Flying-type moves by Gale Wings means variants of Mega Rayquaza with this ability do not have to worry about being knocked out by Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch.

Blissey: Specially defensive Blissey walls both Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza and Substitute Mega Rayquaza, though the latter can break through with good sleep turn luck.

Wonder Guard Users: Most Wonder Guard users can switch into Gale Wings and Aerilate Mega Rayquaza. While some need to be wary of Taunt, Trick, and Spore, their immunity to Mega Rayquaza's attacks makes them reliable and consistent checks.

Stealth Rock: Stealth Rock punishes Mega Rayquaza for its frequent switching, making it fail to survive most revenge killing attempts. Oblivion Wing sets can heal back the damage, however.

King's Shield Users: Activating King's Shield negates any threat that Choice Band Mega Rayquaza may pose, and it can be used to scout against Choice Specs variants.

Choice Specs + Mold Breaker.description:
Mega Rayquaza's amazing offensive stats, good Speed tier, and great STAB moves make it a powerful wallbreaker with Choice Specs. Draco Meteor is extremely powerful and heavily damages most potential switch-ins, like specially defensive Primal Kyogre and Ho-Oh. Notably, Draco Meteor also OHKOes Huge Power Mega Gyarados after Stealth Rock and Imposter Chansey lacking Eviolite. Special Rend is a weaker option that still reaches important benchmarks, like OHKOing Giratina and 2HKOing specially defensive Primal Kyogre after Stealth Rock, while not pressuring Mega Rayquaza to switch out. Aeroblast is a secondary STAB move that threatens Fairy-types like Xerneas and Mega Audino; Oblivion Wing is an alternative that greatly increases Mega Rayquaza's longevity. Additionally, Mega Rayquaza can also run Oblivion Wing in the third moveslot, which increases its longevity while giving it three powerful STAB moves, though it will fail to break through the occasional Registeel. Searing Shot targets Steel-types like Registeel and the rare specially defensive Mega Steelix; Secret Sword 2HKOes standard Registeel while also threatening Wonder Guard Blissey. Trick dismantles what defensive counterplay the opposing team has for Mega Rayquaza. Volt Switch allows Mega Rayquaza to retain momentum, taking advantage of its uncanny ability to force switches and force the most prominent Ground-type in Primal Groudon out. A Modest nature allows Mega Rayquaza to OHKO Primal Groudon forgoing bulk EVs, offensive Arceus, and Mold Breaker Mega Tyranitar from full health, as well as OHKOing bulky Primal Groudon variants after Stealth Rock.

Choice Specs + Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza works well on balance and bulky offense teams that can capitalize on its ability to force switches, as well as providing it support. In particular, it works well with the ubiquitous core of Mold Breaker + Shell Smash Primal Groudon, Prankster Giratina, Baton Pass + Wonder Guard Xerneas, and Huge Power Mega Gyarados. Primal Groudon appreciates Mega Rayquaza bringing in checks like specially defensive Primal Kyogre, Blissey, and the occasional Registeel and Ho-Oh; in return, Primal Groudon forces Giratina in. Prankster Giratina can deter most opposing setup attempts and use Will-O-Wisp or Glare to potentially dismantle Shadow Tag users, which often can revenge kill Mega Rayquaza. Wonder Guard Xerneas can pass Substitutes or Shell Smash boosts to Mega Rayquaza with Baton Pass, the latter potentially enabling a sweep; additionally, it can lure Primal Groudon in. Huge Power Mega Gyarados can heavily damage offensive Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Choice Scarf Mega Rayquaza with Pursuit and Sucker Punch, as well as revenge killing Choice item Shadow Tag users that remove Mega Rayquaza—bar the occasional Play Rough Mega Mewtwo X. Specially defensive Pokemon, like Primal Kyogre, Blissey, Registeel, and Ho-Oh, are able to Imposter-proof Mega Rayquaza, though the latter two are difficult to fit. Offensive Wonder Guard users, like Mega Lucario, Xerneas, and Mega Gardevoir, are good to threaten Wonder Guard Xerneas while also luring Prankster Giratina in (if the latter two are not running Moonblast). Revenge killers, like Refrigerate Kyurem-B, Pixilate Mega Diancie, Imposter Chansey, and Shadow Tag Regigigas, threaten opposing sweepers that can otherwise wreak havoc if coming in after Mega Rayquaza KOes a foe. In particular, Refrigerate Kyurem-B and Imposter Chansey work well, as the former can OHKO both Choice Scarf and Eviolite Imposter Chansey with Icicle Plate-boosted Extreme Speed, and the latter also Imposter-proofs Mega Rayquaza. Defensive Wonder Guard users can provide Defog, cleric, and Wish support for Mega Rayquaza; many of them, in particular slow ones like Blissey, Mega Audino, and Escavalier, are also excellent at safely pivoting Mega Rayquaza in. Finally, Mega Rayquaza can be run with Choice Band + Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza to keep the opponent guessing when one Mega Rayquaza is sent out, provided both Pokemon have the same HP percentage.

Gale Wings Revenge Killer.description:
Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza uses its phenomenal Special Attack and priority Flying-type STAB move to revenge kill most offensive threats. Chatter often OHKOes opposing Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon behind a Substitute after a Shell Smash defense drop and is mainly used for this ability. Additionally, the confusion inflicted by Chatter also bolsters the chances of KOing opposing Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon. Oblivion Wing and Aeroblast with Choice Specs are the primary moves to revenge kill opposing threats. Oblivion Wing has immense recovery and more PP at the cost of worse damage rolls on Mold Breaker Xerneas and unboosted threats like Primal Groudon. Aeroblast can be instead used for its increased power, but it comes at the cost of low PP, a chance to miss, and not providing any longevity. Trick is used to greatly hinder Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza's most common answers in Wonder Guard users. Taunt shuts down many Wonder Guard users that would usually be able to safely switch into Mega Rayquaza, like Mega Audino and Blissey. Stealth Rock and Spore capitalize on the switches it often forces, the former by setting up entry hazards for its teammates for free and the the latter by being an incredible tool for disruption and letting its teammates find free turns. Stealth Rock often pairs well with Trick, since support Wonder Guard users will always have to choose between pivoting and getting rid of hazards once they are given Choice Specs, losing their momentum if they choose the latter and keeping hazards up if they choose the former.

Because of Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza's ability to consistently revenge kill Primal Groudon, opposing Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Gengar, it often finds itself on Mold Breaker-oriented offense teams with teammates that can take advantage of its revenge killing consistency. Mold Breaker sweepers like Primal Groudon, Mega Gengar, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Latios appreciate it for this reason. Another Choice item + Trick user like Choice Scarf Mega Mewtwo Y can work wonders in dismantling the opponent's team by neutering two of its members for the rest of the match. Offensive Wonder Guard users like Xerneas and Gyarados can Imposter-proof Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza, as they don't have to worry about Taunt. Wonder Guard Gyarados holds its Mega Stone, making it immune to Trick and therefore a notably good partner. Huge Power Mega Gyarados further bolsters a team's revenge killing power when paired with Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza while providing strong offensive support, such as with Gastro Acid + Pursuit.

Oblivion Wing.description:
Mega Rayquaza uses Substitute and Oblivion Wing to resist the vast majority of revenge killing attempts, including priority moves like Fake Out + Extreme Speed and Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch. This allows it to sweep easily thanks to Mold Breaker, which allows it to hit opponents through Wonder Guard. Dark Void provides the free turns necessary to set up Substitute and Shell Smash; unlike Spore, it is not blocked by Safety Goggles. The recovery from Oblivion Wing not only offsets the initial Substitute damage, but also can offset damage from Curse and Will-O-Wisp. Sky Plate or Life Orb is crucial to break past specially defensive Blissey, and they help against Primal Kyogre. Sky Plate is typically the preferred option since it does not have the recoil of Life Orb, even though Life Orb sets break through Blissey more easily. If teammates can break through Blissey, Shed Shell can be run to escape various Shadow Tag users such as Regigigas, Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Mewtwo X, and Primal Groudon. The EV spread allows it to outspeed Choice Scarf Mega Mewtwo Y after a Shell Smash boost while maximizing bulk.

Oblivion Wing Mega Rayquaza fits on a plethora of teams, from hyper offense to bulky teams, thanks to its reliable sweeping and wallbreaking prowess. It is usually run with another wallbreaker, such as Mega Gyarados, Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, Mold Breaker Mega Gengar, or Mega Mewtwo X or Y, as these options threaten special walls like Wonder Guard Blissey and Primal Kyogre. Mold Breaker Primal Groudon with Shell Smash is especially notable, as it can set up and become notoriously difficult to revenge kill. Therefore, it and Substitute Mega Rayquaza make a fantastic dual Mold Breaker core. Mega Rayquaza also pairs well with users of Spikes and Stealth Rock, such as Shadow Tag Primal Groudon and Wonder Guard Xerneas, since they further restrict its already limited pool of switch-ins. Substitute + Baton Pass teammates, like the aforementioned Wonder Guard Xerneas, make sure it doesn't have to spend a turn setting up Substitute.

Deoxys-Attack.comments:
Other Options

Substitute + Baton Pass Deoxys-A can run alternative options in its first moveslot: Spore is more accurate than Dark Void but misses out on Safety Goggles users and Grass-types, Destiny Bond allows Deoxys-A to trade against slower attackers but is largely redundant with Gastro Acid and Psystrike, and Stealth Rock and Spikes can be set as the opponent switches to an answer, but Magic Bounce users, like Giratina and Aegislash, can switch too easily into Deoxys-A for them to be consistent options. Deoxys-A can opt for Shell Smash over Substitute; it can run a Wonder Guard Shell Smash set with Spooky or Insect Plate Judgment and two other non-Ghost-, Dark-, or Bug-type coverage options, though it is inconsistent due to its vulnerability to Pursuit and Sucker Punch. Deoxys-A can opt for Huge Power and Protean coverage sets, though the increased Speed compared to Mega Mewtwo X is usually not worth it because of its substantially lower bulk and Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X's ability to run priority moves if desired. No Guard and Mold Breaker Deoxys-A are other options, as it is faster than Mega Mewtwo X and Y and is not meaningfully less powerful, though the vulnerability to priority due to its frailty makes these sets not worth running in most situations.

Checks and Counters

Priority Users: Shadow Sneak users, like Mega Mewtwo X, Slaking, and Regigigas, OHKO Deoxys-A when it isn't behind a Substitute. Additionally, Shadow Sneak Slaking and Regigigas often run Pursuit, meaning Deoxys-A cannot safely switch out much of the time. Huge Power Dark-types like Mega Gyarados threaten niche offensive sets with Sucker Punch, Water Shuriken, and Pursuit, though Substitute + Baton Pass sets can easily escape Pursuit. Mold Breaker Extreme Speed users, like Slaking and Primal Groudon, also threaten Deoxys-A.

Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Users: Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X with Beat Up can safely remove Substitute + Baton Pass Deoxys-A, as it outspeeds and OHKOes it. Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Primal Groudon can also opt for a super effective move, such as Knock Off or Beat Up. Additionally, Choice Scarf Shadow Tag users running Trick can hinder Substitute + Baton Pass Deoxys-A by Choice-locking it. Niche Choice Scarf + No Guard Deoxys-A sets are not threatened by Choice Scarf + Shadow Tag users, but are trapped by Shadow Tag Slaking and Regigigas.

Magic Bounce Users: Magic Bounce users, like Giratina and Aegislash, are able to comfortably switch into Deoxys-A's Psystrike and bounce back Taunt and Dark Void. However, some Magic Bounce users, like Mega Venusaur, are unable to come in on Psystrike, and Magic Bounce users may be forced out by niche offensive Deoxys-A sets.

Prankster Giratina: Prankster Giratina can use Encore on Deoxys-A's Substitute to force it out or use Glare on Deoxys-A not behind Substitute to severely hinder it. However, it becomes setup fodder if it switches into Taunt or Dark Void. Prankster Giratina can also get surprised by niche offensive sets, like No Guard.

Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard.description:
Wonder Guard Deoxys-A is an effective Substitute + Baton Pass user due to its nearly uncontested Speed, STAB Psystrike, and low defenses allowing for offensive counterplay to opposing Imposter users. Gastro Acid removes opposing Mold Breaker and Wonder Guard, allowing Deoxys-A to set up Substitute more easily and threaten some Wonder Guard users with Psystrike. Alternatively, Taunt annoys most non-Magic Bounce and Mold Breaker foes, disabling Prankster Giratina's moves if used on the switch, as well as passive Wonder Guard users lacking a way to hit Deoxys-A. Dark Void works much like Taunt while acting as more effective team support if a foe is kept asleep for multiple turns, though the consequence of using it against a Magic Bounce user is greater if Deoxys-A isn't behind a Substitute, and it can miss. Psystrike is its preferred attack due to 2HKOing most offensive foes and threatening Wonder Guard Mega Beedrill. Substitute + Baton Pass is a potent combination, especially with Wonder Guard, because it allows a teammate a turn to safely set up in most scenarios. Leftovers is used so Deoxys-A can more easily set up Substitute multiple times over the course of a match. A Hasty nature with 0 Defense IVs makes Imposter users transformed into Deoxys-A as physically frail as possible, allowing for offensive counterplay, such as Shadow Sneak and Choice Scarf Beat Up users, against them. A Timid nature with 31 Defense IVs is also usable, though the ability to offensively threaten Imposter users is a core advantage Deoxys-A has over other Substitute + Baton Pass users.

Substitute + Baton Pass Deoxys-A appreciates teammates that are able to capitalize on a passed Substitute and patch up its weaknesses. Mold Breaker Shell Smash users, in particular Oblivion Wing Mega Rayquaza, Primal Groudon, and Xerneas, are good teammates because, behind a Substitute, they have an opportunity to use Shell Smash or a disruption move like Dark Void and Taunt and are resistant to the majority of revenge killers. Mold Breaker Xerneas in particular does not fear Huge Power Mega Gyarados if healthy even if it runs Beat Up, making it a synergistic partner. Deoxys-A is also good on Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X archetypes, since with good prediction a Mega Mewtwo X behind a Substitute with the right coverage moves is difficult to stop, though such teams have a difficult time fitting in either proper revenge killing or a support Wonder Guard user. Similarly, Protean users, like Mega Latios and Mega Mewtwo Y, appreciate passed Substitutes, though both Pokemon initially share the same weaknesses as Deoxys-A and therefore can't hard switch in as easily if necessary. Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers, like Mega Gardevoir, appreciate Deoxys-A's ability to pass Substitutes, though potentially not hitting many Wonder Guard users and giving up a moveslot for Shell Smash make passed Substitutes not as useful as with Mold Breaker and Huge Power teammates. Prankster Giratina, support Wonder Guard users that don't share Deoxys-A's weaknesses, and robust revenge killers, in particular Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Shadow Tag Slaking and Regigigas, and Pixilate Mega Diancie, are great teammates due to offering a switch-in to Mold Breaker, Huge Power, and Protean users on prediction, Defog and Aromatherapy support, and priority for offensive foes, respectively.

Deoxys-Speed.comments:
Other Options

Fissure is an option to hit Wonder Guard users weak to Ground, such as Primal Groudon and Mega Lucario; however, these Wonder Guard users are rare, and the possibility of hitting Flying-types like Mega Rayquaza is often too great to give up. Any other entry hazard over Stealth Rock can similarly take advantage of the switches Deoxys-S forces. Recover can offset the chip damage Deoxys-S often takes throughout a game, reenabling Focus Sash if it is able to heal up to full. Taunt is another option that prevents recovery from Wonder Guard switch-ins, in addition to Baton Pass pivoting and entry hazards. Spider Web Deoxys-S can trap and remove Wonder Guard users that don't have a pivoting move or Shed Shell, but these are extremely rare and often not worth the moveslot. Other coverage options such as Moonblast, Gunk Shot, and Petal Blizzard are available to hit specific Wonder Guard users such as Mega Sableye, Xerneas, and Mega Swampert, respectively. Lum Berry allows Deoxys-S to avoid debilitating status one time and lets it beat Prankster Giratina one-on-one, but the overall utility of Focus Sash leaves it outclassed. Leftovers lets Deoxys-S be worn down less.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard Cores: While Deoxys-S can handle a single Wonder Guard user due to Gastro Acid, two or more Wonder Guard users often pose a problem, as they can freely switch between each other and stall the PP of Gastro Acid. However, Stealth Rock from Deoxys-S can wear them down over time.

Opposing No Guard Users: Deoxys-S will always Speed tie itself, forcing mind games between Sheer Cold, Sing, and Taunt if applicable. No Guard users with a Choice Scarf can also outspeed and revenge kill Deoxys-S if its Focus Sash has been broken.

Priority Moves: Deoxys-S is quite frail, so priority moves are a big threat, especially if its Focus Sash has been broken. Huge Power users like Mega Gyarados and Mega Mewtwo X can use Water Shuriken and Extreme Speed, respectively, to pick off Deoxys-S. Pixilate and Refrigerate users like Mega Diance and Kyruem-B can use Fake Out + Extreme Speed to dispose of Deoxys-S before it can move. Gale Wings users like Mega Rayquaza can revenge kill Deoxys-S, but these are rare and only work if its Focus Sash has broken. Shadow Tag Slaking and Regigigas immediately remove Deoxys-S with Extreme Speed if they can get in safely and Deoxys-S has taken any prior damage.

ResidualDamage: Without Recover, all residual damage will stack up, and even a tiny bit such as Stealth Rock damage can break Focus Sash, making Deoxys-S much less effective. However, Deoxys-S with Leftovers have an easier time working around this issue.

No Guard.description:
No Guard users, Deoxys-S the fastest one among them, are some of the most centralizing and threatening Pokemon in Pure Hackmons due to their perfectly accurate Sheer Cold. Sing allows Deoxys-S to hinder checks with sleep while ignoring Substitutes and Safety Googles. Gastro Acid removes Wonder Guard and Sturdy from Pokemon like Mega Scizor and Giratina, which makes them susceptible to Sheer Cold. Stealth Rock takes advantage of Deoxys-S's ability to force switches and racks up chip damage on Wonder Guard users, its usual checks. Zap Cannon and Inferno benefit from No Guard and allow Dexoys-S to hit specific Wonder Guard users such as Gyarados and Mega Scizor; if these moves are run, an EV spread of 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe is recommended. However, sets running Zap Cannon or Inferno face stiff competition from No Guard users that can make use of these moves more effectively, in particular Mega Mewtwo Y. Focus Sash alleviates Deoxys-S's bulk issues.

Deoxys-S's main roadblock is a combination of two Wonder Guard users, which can continually swap into its Gastro Acid and waste its PP; therefore, anti-Wonder Guard measures are heavily recommended. Shadow Tag users such as Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, Primal Groudon, and Mega Latios can trap and remove Wonder Guard users lacking a Shed Shell, in particular Leftovers Wonder Guard Xerneas and Safety Goggles Arceus; in return, Deoxys-S can pressure Pokemon like Giratina and offensive Mold Breaker users for them. Mold Breaker users with Knock Off like Mega Gyarados can remove Shed Shells from Wonder Guard users, allowing Shadow Tag users to remove them more efficiently; this lets Deoxys-S clean up teams more efficiently. Powerful Mold Breaker users such as Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios can brute force their way past many a Wonder Guard user. Finally, Huge Power + Pursuit users like Mega Gyarados and Yveltal can fish for matchups against Wonder Guard users weak to Pursuit, such as Cresselia, Meloetta, and Dusclops.

Lopunny-Mega.comments:
Focus Sash compensates for Mega Lopunny's poor bulk and allows it to freely switch moves. Sheer Cold is Mega Lopunny's primary weapon, OHKOing everything without Wonder Guard or fringe Sturdy. Sing takes advantage of Mega Lopunny's ability to force switches, putting opposing Wonder Guard switch-ins to sleep, and has additional utility through bypassing Substitute. Gastro Acid is used to force switches from Wonder Guard users that switch into Sheer Cold with impunity, allowing the user to use Sing on switches or make easier double switches into other teammates. Stealth Rock is used to sustain chip damage against opposing Wonder Guard users, while Dynamic Punch takes advantage of Mega Lopunny's Attack stat to threaten opposing Wonder Guard users weak to the move, such as Slaking, Arceus, and Mega Lucario. Maximum HP and Speed investment allows Mega Lopunny to outspeed as much as possible while also maximizing its overall bulk; If running attacking moves such as Dynamic Punch, HP investment should be forgone for Attack to maximize damage.

Mega Lopunny usually benefits best from being placed on fast-paced Offensive teams that like to quickly gain momentum and force switches. Some notable teammates include Mold breaker users such as Primal Groudon and Mega Latios that take advantage of foes that are put to sleep by Mega Lopunny and also benefit from the chip damage Mega Lopunny gives with Stealth Rock. Shadow Tag Pokemon such as Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Lugia are appreciated for their ability to remove Wonder Guard users and enable Mega Lopunny to sweep teams. However, Mega Lopunny will need sufficient hazard control if it hopes to keep it's Focus Sash intact. It benefits from Defog Users such as Wonder Guards and Magic Bounce users. These Pokemon also can slowly pivot so Mega Lopunny has a safer time getting on the field.

Other Options

Spikes and Toxic Spikes are alternatives to Stealth Rock to better damage Rock-resistant foes and pressure Wonder Guard users lacking reliable recovery respectively. Sticky Web can help teams that want more speed control and enables slower partners such as Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, Mega Diancie, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga. Mega Lopunny can use some attacks such as Sacred Fire, Gunk Shot, and Dynamic Punch. However, these are fishing for specific weaknesses of certain Wonder Guard users and are much more situational, so they generally aren't the best options. Lastly, substituting Sheer Cold for Fissure can work to target ground weak Wonder Guard Users Ground-weak Wonder Guard users, but this also falls under situational matchup fishing.

Checks and Counters

Priority Revenge Killers Mega Lopunny can be revenge killed in many ways, ranging from Extreme Speed users such as Regigigas, Slaking, and -ate speed users to Water Shuriken Mega Gyarados, Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza, and even Prankster Giratina running Spore, Dark Void, or Destiny Bond.

Wonder Guard Users: While Mega Lopunny is meant to dismantle and force switches between Wonder Guard users, they can still block Trick with items like Mail, Mega Stones, and Primal Orbs. Magic Coat or Magic Bounce users can bounce back Sing and Hazards. Some Wonder Guard users also run attacks such as Xerneas with Moonblast or Kyogre-Primal with Scald and can force Lopunny-Mega out.

Faster Pokemon: Faster Pokemon, like Mega Mewtwo Y, Deoxys-S, and Choice Scarf users, can threaten Focus Sash Mega Lopunny out. Additionally, some Choice Scarf users, like Mega Mewtwo Y and No Guard Deoxys-S, can also outspeed Choice Scarf Mega Lopunny and threaten it. Choice Scarf Shadow Tag users, like Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon, can outspeed and KO chipped Focus Sash Mega Lopunny. However, most of these options require pivoting support from Wonder Guard teammates to come in on Mega Lopunny safely, and Choice Scarf users naturally slower than Mega Lopunny, like Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo X, are at risk of getting outsped and OHKOed by Choice Scarf Mega Lopunny.

Choice Scarf.description:
Mega Lopunny's high-Speed stat makes it a good No Guard user, as Speed is integral to this utility-centered role. Sheer Cold, which always hits due to No Guard, can OHKO any foe without Wonder Guard or the fringe Sturdy. This allows Mega Lopunny to force opposing Wonder Guard users in with ease. Trick allows Mega Lopunny to disrupt opposing Wonder Guard users; it's best to use Trick early, as getting rid of Choice Scarf gives Mega Lopunny more opportunities to force switches due to Gastro Acid. Mega Lopunny capitalizes on the switches it forces with either Stealth Rock, for entry hazard control and chip damage, or a sleep move like Sing to put opposing Wonder Guard users to sleep. Sing is significantly better than most sleep moves for bypassing Substitute. Mega Lopunny shouldn't afraid to make double switches, as it all but ensures an opposing Wonder Guard user comes in; making double switches is even easier if opposing Wonder Guard users are asleep, or if one is Tricked.

Mega Lopunny benefits from slow pivot teammates such as Magic Bounce Giratina and Wonder Guard Pokemon with Parting Shot or Baton Pass. This is because Mega Lopunny is rather frail and needs to get on the field in a safe way. Mega Lopunny is generally used on teams that lack utility or ways to forcibly gain momentum. Mega Lopunny nearly always needs an offensive Pokemon, such as Primal Groudon, Mega Latios, Mega Mewtwo X, or Mega Mewtwo Y, to help back it up and capitalize on the switches and momentum Mega Lopunny gives.

Skuntank.comments:
Other Options

Sucker Punch can be used to surprise KO an attacking Mold Breaker user like Mega Gengar or heavily chipped Mold Breaker Mega Latios after Shell Smash. Spikes and Sticky Web are alternatives to Stealth Rock and Toxic Spikes if their specific utility is desired. Parting Shot can be used over Baton Pass to weaken the foe as it pivots out; however, Parting Shot cedes momentum to teams with a Magic Bounce user, making it more matchup-dependent. Haze can be used to clear boosts from Shell Smash users like Wonder Guard Xerneas, preventing them from setting up on Skuntank. Toxic can be used to status and make progress against Wonder Guards like Xerneas and Arceus, forcing a switch into an Aromatherapy user. Additionally, because of Skuntank's Poison typing, it can freely use Toxic against Pokemon that may run Magic Bounce like Giratina. Poison Fang is an alternative to Toxic that gives Skuntank the ability to damage Fairy-type Woner Guard users and status foes without being susceptible to Taunt. Whirlwind gives Skuntank the ability to phase out setup sweepers like offensive Wonder Guard Xerneas and Mold Breaker Mega Gengar. Mail can give Skuntank an immunity to Trick, though this item provides no other utility and is greatly outclassed by Shed Shell. Black Sludge can be used to give Skuntank some passive healingand punish Trick users like Choice Scarf Prankster Giratina. Alternatively, Trick can be used by Skuntank itself to passively chip a foe. Finally, 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD EVs with a Sassy Nature can be used to Imposter-proof Choice Specs Mold Breaker Mega Mewtwo Y more effectively, thanks to Skuntank's immunity to Psystrike and Psycho Boost.

Drapion can be used instead of Skuntank if its slightly higher physical Defense and faster Speed tier are desired.

Checks and Counters

Fissure: Skuntank is vulnerable to being OHKOed by No Guard users carrying the somewhat rare, but very dangerous, Fissure. This weakness can be mitigated by pairing Skuntank with another Wonder Guard user that is not weak to Ground or a Flying-type teammate like Mega Rayquaza or Ho-Oh.

Ground-type Coverage: Ground-type coverage on offensive Wonder Guard users like Xerneas and -ate Speed users like Kyurem-B can catch Skuntank off guard on a switch, potentially scoring an early KO and rendering your team weak to No Guard Users like Mega Mewtwo Y and Huge Power Sweepers like Mega Gyarados.

Trick Users: Trick Users like Choice Scarf Prankster Giratina can hinder Skuntank by removing its Shed Shell and reduce its support potential by locking it into one move. Skuntank can opt to mitigate this by either crippling the Trick user with Black Sludge or using Mail for an effective immunity to the move; Black Sludge carries the potential risk of being swapped to a teammate.

Taunt Users: Skuntank's lackluster offensive stats relegate it to a support position, which can be shut down by Taunt users like Prankster Giratina. Moves like Knock Off and Poison Fang ensure that Skuntank will not be forced to use Struggle, while also having the chance to remove items or poison the foe, respectively.

Offensive Mold Breaker Users: Skuntank is forced out by offensive Mold Breakers due to its low defenses. Specifically, Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza can both OHKO physically defensive Skuntank after Stealth Rock.

Support Wonder Guard.description:
Set Description

Skuntank's main niche as a Wonder Guard user is its rare singular weakness to Ground and ability to clear Toxic Spikes upon switching in. Baton Pass allows Skuntank to provide pivoting support and maintain momentum, notably underspeeding common slow pivots like Cresselia, Magic Bounce Giratina, and Primal Kyogre. Toxic Spikes allows Skuntank to make progress in most games; Skuntank can also reliably clear any Toxic Spikes reflected by Magic Bounce or copied by Imposter. Knock Off and Pursuit threaten Pokemon like Mold Breaker Mega Gengar and coverage-reliant offensive Pokemon that have no way to hit Skuntank, such as No Guard Mega Mewtwo Y lacking Fissure and Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X lacking Thousand Arrows. Defog and Aromatherapy are staples on any support Wonder Guard user; however, if a teammate is already providing either, then Skuntank can opt for alternate utility options such as Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, and Knock Off. Recover gives Skuntank longevity, allowing it to heal off damage from hazards, status, or attacks that slip through Wonder Guard. Shed Shell allows Skuntank to escape Shadow Tag users like Choice Band Mewtwo Mega X and Perish Song Lugia, while Safety Goggles gives it immunity to Spore from Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar. Maximum HP and Defense investment maximizes Skuntank's physical bulk, allowing Skuntank to scout Mold Breaker Pokemon that could potentially run physical and special sets, such as Mega Rayquaza, and fare better against Mega Gengar. 0 Speed IVs give Skuntank the slowest possible Baton Pass to pivot into its team's attackers.

Revenge killers such as Refrigerate Kyurem-B, Huge Power Slaking, and Regigigas make excellent teammates for Skuntank, as they appreciate Skuntank’s slow Baton Pass and pressure some of Skuntank’s most dangerous checks, namely Fissure + No Guard users like Mewtwo Mega Y and Mega Aerodactyl. Furthermore, because of its weakness to Fissure, Skuntank should almost always have both a Flying-type teammate—such as Mega Rayquaza or Ho-oh— and a Wonder Guard teammate that isn’t weak to Ground—such as Arceus or Xerneas. Additionally, offensive Wonder Guard teammates such as Mega Gardevoir, Xerneas, and Mega Lucario appreciate Skuntank’s ability to both soft-check Mold Breaker Mega Gengar and efficiently compress the roles of cleric and defogger. Finally, since Skuntank is quite passive, it benefits from strong Mold Breaker attackers like Choice Band Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon that can pressure Pokemon attempting to setup against Skuntank. In return, Skuntank can get them onto the battlefield safely with its slow Baton Pass. Dark-type Huge Power teammates like Mega Gyarados and Yveltal can effectively dispatch of Giratina with Pursuit and Knock Off, as Skuntank alone fails to threaten Giratina. Finally, offensive Shadow Tag Users like Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X appreciate Skuntank's ability to use Knock Off to remove Shed Shells from Psychic-type Wonder Guard users like Cresselia and Meloetta and non-Wonder Guard Support Pokemon like Registeel.

Lucario-Mega.comments:
Other Options

An alternate EV spread of 68 Atk / 252 SpA / 188 Spe alongside Bolt Strike is an option to OHKO physically defensive Primal Kyogre at +2 while still outpacing Jolly Primal Groudon. Similarly, a spread of 176 Atk / 252 SpA / 80 Spe with a Rash nature is an option alongside either Bolt Strike or Power Whip to OHKO Primal Kyogre while outpacing maximum speed Adamant Primal Groudon. A Timid or Naive nature is another option to outpace the somewhat rare Timid Mega Latios and Timid Mega Diancie.

Flame Plate is an option over Fist Plate to hit Bug- and Steel-type Wonder Guard users. However, using Flame Plate means that Mega Lucario sacrifices the ability to hit Normal-type Wonder Guard users and OHKO Primal Groudon at +2 unless it also sacrifices its ability to beat Imposter users. Earth Plate is also an option over Fist Plate that trades hitting Normal-type Wonder Guard users for Electric-type Wonder Guard users while retaining the ability to KO Primal Groudon at +2. However, this version of the set faces fierce competition from Dialga, which has superior bulk, higher Special Attack, and lacks a Fire weakness.

Mega Lucario also has a handful of other coverage options it can utilize. Bug Buzz does better against Cresselia than Knock Off, allowing Lucario to avoid mind games against King's Shield variants. Play Rough and Moonblast are both alternatives to hit Wonder Guard Mega Sableye; however, the former is an alternative to Knock Off that also OHKOes Mega Latios, while the latter offers similar coverage and hits harder overall. Scald can be used to OHKO Primal Groudon. Gastro Acid is an option to allow Mega Lucario to break through Wonder Guard users of any type at the somewhat steep cost of an additional turn to do so.

Checks and Counters

Fissure: Like all Ground-weak Wonder Guard users, Mega Lucario is vulnerable to the somewhat uncommon but still very dangerous Fissure.

Strong Attackers: Mega Lucario is very frail both specially and physically. If a powerful unresisted attack pierces its Wonder Guard, Mega Lucario will almost certainly be KOed. In addition, all three of Mega Lucario’s weaknesses are to very common attacking types, which means that most teams have multiple attackers that can bypass Mega Lucario's Wonder Guard. In particular, Mega Lucario is weak to both of Primal Groudon's STAB attacks. Faster Mold Breaker attackers, such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Gengar, as well as those that can tank a hit, such as Protean Mega Latios, are all highly threatening to Mega Lucario.

Opposing Wonder Guard: Because Wonder Guard sweepers are inherently matchup dependent, Wonder Guard users that Mega Lucario is not packing the correct coverage moves for will force it out.

Item Removal: Trick, Switcheroo, and Mold Breaker Knock Off can severely impede Mega Lucario's ability to do its job, removing one-third of its coverage as well as its ability to beat Imposter users.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Offensive Shadow Tag users such as Primal Groudon or Mega Mewtwo X can pivot in on unboosted Mega Lucario and OHKO it. Very few offensive Shadow Tag users do not carry an attacking move that can KO Mega Lucario.

Prankster Giratina: Unless Mega Lucario is already boosted and just used a move that Giratina does not resist while it switches in, Prankster Giratina can come in freely on Mega Lucario and annoy it with Will-O-Wisp or Glare.

Wonder Guard Shell Smash.description:
Mega Lucario's decent typing for an offensive Wonder Guard user, quadruple resistance to Stealth Rock, strong attacking stats, and good base 112 Speed make it a powerful option for a Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweeper. The combination of Judgment and Fist Plate is a huge boon to Mega Lucario, allowing it to defeat Imposter users, Normal-type Wonder Guard users, and allowing it OHKO Primal Groudon after one Shell Smash. Flash Cannon and Gear Grind are both powerful STAB moves that hit Fairy-type Wonder Guard users. Flash Cannon's superior accuracy makes it the more consistent option and is slightly stronger against standard Wonder Guard Mega Audino. Gear Grind, on the other hand, is noticeably better against Wonder Guard Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir, breaking the former's Substitutes and outright OHKOing the latter without a boost. The final moveslot is flexible, as it is both metagame- and team-dependent, but notable options include: Freeze-Dry, Grass Knot, and Knock Off. Freeze-Dry and Grass Knot both do well against Water-type Wonder Guard users like Primal Kyogre. The former's greater coverage usually make it the preferred option, but Grass Knot's increased Base Power versus certain targets such as Whirlwind Primal Kyogre is valuable as well. Knock Off is a useful option, as it OHKOes Mega Latios at +2. Without Knock Off, Mega Latios can take any other hit from Lucario—even at +2—and OHKO back. Knock Off also gives Mega Lucario a way of damaging Psychic- and Ghost-type Wonder Guard users and has the additional utility of removing items, making switch-ins without Wonder Guard less safe. A Rash nature is preferred if physical attacks are used; otherwise, a Modest nature is preferred.

Mega Lucario fits best on balance and offense teams in need of a wincon and late-game cleaner. However, Mega Lucario differs from similar Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Xerneas, most notably because of its Fissure weakness, meaning that it appreciates teammates that can scout potential opposing No Guard users, such as Imposter users and slow pivots with Wonder Guard that don't share weaknesses with Mega Lucario, such as Cresselia, Slaking, and Primal Kyogre. In addition, a Flying-type teammate, such as Mega Rayquaza, can also help alleviate Mega Lucario’s Fissure weakness, as Sheer Cold + Fissure No Guard users are uncommon. Mega Lucario is also limited in its ability to beat certain Wonder Guard users, namely those weak to Fire- and Ground-type moves, without compromising its ability to beat Imposter users. As a result, Mega Lucario benefits from Choice Band Mold Breaker teammates that can break opposing Wonder Guard cores such as Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza. Offensive Shadow Tag teammates—Primal Groudon in particular—are also worth a mention, as they can trap and KO the Wonder Guard users Mega Lucario can't touch. Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users are also useful teammates, as they can give Mega Lucario additional opportunities to use Shell Smash and provide it some breathing room versus opposing Shadow Tag Primal Groudon, which would otherwise trap and KO Lucario. Finally, Mega Lucario also appreciates Aromatherapy, Defog, and Wish support from teammates such as the aforementioned slow pivoting Wonder Guard users to make its job as a wincon and late-game cleaner easier.

Drapion.overview: Drapion is slightly outclassed by Skuntank as a Poison / Dark Wonder Guard user. While Drapion has higher physical bulk, allowing it to survive hits like Primal Groudon's Thousand Arrows and Choice Band Mega Rayquaza's Dragon Ascent, Skuntank has slightly better special bulk and can pivot after Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, Primal Groudon, and minimum Speed Cresselia and Meloetta. As Drapion and Skuntank are functionally the same, Skuntank's analysis can be found here.

Abomasnow-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Mega Abomasnow can opt for V-Create instead of Boomburst to threaten Magic Bounce Steel-types like Registeel, as well as OHKO Wonder Guard Mega Scizor and Escavalier. However, forgoing Boomburst means Mega Abomasnow has a much more difficult time checking Shell Smash Mold Breaker Primal Groudon running King's Shield, and V-Create's main targets in Magic Bounce Steel-types are relatively uncommon. Sacred Fire is an alternative option which can provide utility with burns, but is usually not worth it as it fails to OHKO Mega Scizor or 2HKO Mega Steelix. Pursuit can also be used over Boomburst to trap opposing Mega Gengar, weakened Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios after a Shell Smash; however, it has the high opportunity cost of not being able to be run with Boomburst and a support move. Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web are options over Stealth Rock, as Mega Abomasnow adequately threatens Flying-types, and its teammates appreciate the chip offered by poison from Toxic Spikes and the Speed drop from Sticky Web. The consistent damage of Stealth Rock is generally more useful, however. Baton Pass can work over Parting Shot, as it allows Mega Abomasnow to pass Substitutes it received from a teammate to another offensive teammate while still offering universal pivoting. Taunt can be used on the switch to disable Wonder Guard switch-ins running four status moves. Spore is another option that also disables them by putting them to sleep, and the opponent cannot put Mega Abomasnow to sleep with a well-timed Magic Bounce switch-in. Recover is a fringe option to keep Mega Abomasnow healthy, though the opportunity cost of not running a support move is high. Running coverage in the last one or two moveslots is an option, with possible options being Petal Blizzard, Freeze-Dry, Gunk Shot, Knock Off, Thousand Arrows, Close Combat, Low Kick, and Play Rough. If running Freeze-Dry, an alternative spread of 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 SpA with a Brave nature could be used to force recovery from physically defensive Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, but the added bulk from investing in HP is generally more worthwhile. Leftovers is a niche option over Icicle Plate, as it increases Mega Abomasnow's longevity throughout the game; however, forgoing Icicle Plate means Mega Abomasnow misses out on the OHKO against Giratina with Boomburst.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard Users: The vast majority of Wonder Guard users can switch in on Mega Abomasnow and render its Refrigerate-boosted attacks null. In particular, offensive Wonder Guard users are problematic, as they can't be revenge killed by Mega Abomasnow and, in a good matchup, can snowball through teams which have Mega Abomasnow as the sole setup check.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Offensive Shadow Tag users, especially bulky Mega Mewtwo X, can come in on Mega Abomasnow on a resisted move or Fake Out and OHKO it. In particular, Mega Mewtwo X with significant bulk investment and Primal Groudon are bulky enough to usually survive Fake Out into Extreme Speed and can OHKO Mega Abomasnow with Drain Punch or V-Create, respectively. However, most pivoting support is useless for offensive Shadow Tag users aiming to remove Mega Abomasnow due to its abysmal speed, and nearly all Shadow Tag users are vulnerable to getting KOed by Boomburst into Extreme Speed.

Huge Power Mega Gyarados: Despite Mega Abomasnow investing in HP to increase its bulk, Huge Power-boosted Pursuits are problematic for it. In particular, Mega Gyarados is an issue, as it can come in on Fake Out, Extreme Speed, or Boomburst safely if healthy.

Magic Bounce Steel-types: Magic Bounce Steel-types, such as Registeel and Mega Steelix, can prevent specific Mega Abomasnow sets from being able to support its team. However, Registeel can be threatened with V-Create or Sacred Fire, and Mega Steelix is blown past by Boomburst sets.

Refrigerate.description:
Refrigerate Mega Abomasnow is an excellent revenge killer that differentiates itself from other -ate Speed users with its resistance to Thousand Arrows, immunity to Spore, and low Speed stat that allows it to underspeed many of the format's slow pivots. Fake Out and Extreme Speed form a potent combination that allows Mega Abomasnow to threaten chip against sweepers lacking King's Shield and revenge weakened foes with its strong priority STAB attacks. Fake Out on its own is also able to chip opposing sweepers lacking King's Shield, letting Mega Abomasnow hard switch into unboosted sweepers on a prediction and either chip them or force them out. Boomburst is an incredibly powerful STAB move that with an Icicle Plate OHKOes opposing Giratina and allows Mega Abomasnow to force non-Wonder Guard users out the majority of the time if healthy. Stealth Rock allows Mega Abomasnow to support its team through entry hazard setting, capitalizing on Mega Abomasnow's ability to force out offensive threats; Parting Shot and Gastro Acid are good alternative options, as the former helps to retain momentum against even slow pivot Wonder Guard users like Mega Audino and Primal Kyogre, while the latter forces most opposing Wonder Guard users to switch due to the threat of Boomburst and Extreme Speed. Since Boomburst already OHKOes Giratina without any investment, Abomasnow can throw its EVs into HP and Attack. A Brave nature and 0 Speed IVs minimizes Mega Abomasnow's Speed, giving it the ability to underspeed slow pivots like Wonder Guard Mega Audino and Chansey.
