Mega Abomasnow works best on teams that appreciate its ability to revenge kill non-Wonder Guard sweepers, such as offense, bulky offense, balance, and dual Mega Mewtwo X teams. In particular, it works well with the ubiquitous Shell Smash Primal Groudon + Prankster Giratina + Wonder Guard Xerneas core, as even Prankster Giratina proves to be insufficient counterplay to opposing Mold Breaker Primal Groudon on its own. Offensive pressure from Primal Groudon helps retain momentum against teams that rely on Wonder Guard Xerneas to come in on Mega Abomasnow, especially if Mega Abomasnow runs Parting Shot; Prankster Giratina, especially variants running Will-O-Wisp, can switch in on healthy Huge Power users using a Fighting-, Fire-, Poison-, or Steel-type attack and force them out with either Encore or the threat of a burn. Wonder Guard Xerneas can pass Substitutes to Mega Abomasnow, which allows Mega Abomasnow to set Stealth Rock or threaten opposing switch-ins with Gastro Acid. Mold Breaker users, in particular slower ones like Mega Tyranitar, Choice item Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Latios, also appreciate Mega Abomasnow's ability to revenge kill faster threats. On faster offensive teams, Imposter Chansey is a good partner, as Mega Abomasnow struggles to deal with King's Shield sweepers; in return, Mega Abomasnow can threaten Mega Gengar and Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, two Pokemon Imposter Chansey can't prevent from setting up easily. Offensive Shadow Tag users, in particular Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios, are good partners for Parting Shot Mega Abomasnow due to being able to remove Wonder Guard users not running Shed Shell, such as Xerneas and Safety Goggles Primal Kyogre. Mega Abomasnow can work well on dual Mega Mewtwo X teams due to being a fairly reliable lone revenge killer, though it faces stiff competition from other -ate users such as Kyurem-B and Mega Rayquaza. Lastly, defensive Wonder Guard users are extremely valuable for Mega Abomasnow, as they can provide Defog, Aromatherapy, and Wish support, helping for removing entry hazards, protecting against Dark Void Mold Breaker sweepers, and providing for Mega Abomasnow's longevity respectively, while also disrupting Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users coming in and trying to set up with Whirlwind.

Dialga.comments:
Other Options

Dark Void is an alternative over Spore that ignores opposing Safety Goggles but is usually not worth it, as switch-ins to Spore Dialga, such as Safety Goggles Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre and Blissey, are relatively rare. Glare and Taunt give more opportunities to set up with Shell Smash; Taunt more effectively deals with passive switch-ins, such as Primal Kyogre and Blissey variants forgoing Knock Off. Alternatively, Stealth Rock and other entry hazards can support Dialga's team, capitalizing on its good bulk and ability to force out much of the metagame when healthy, though Dialga often struggles to sweep without running a disruption move. Secret Sword could be used over Searing Shot to still threaten most Steel-types while also threatening Wonder Guard Blissey, but running the move means Dialga will not be able to OHKO Registeel, Mega Steelix, and Wonder Guard Mega Scizor. Recover is an option to greatly increase Dialga's longevity but sacrifices momentum and other generally more useful options. Dialga can opt to run Flame Plate + Judgment or Burn Drive + Techno Blast instead of Searing Shot, but its bulky Steel-type Imposter-proof will need to be replaced. On the other hand, the easy Imposter-proofing provided by Judgment and a Draco Plate or Iron Plate is usually more worthwhile. Leftovers gives Dialga more longevity, and Lum Berry allows Dialga to sweep more easily by curing status once; Leftovers also synergizes well with King's Shield. However, both items mean Dialga cannot make use of Plate + Judgment, making Imposter-proofing more difficult. If Leftovers is used, a spread of 240 HP / 252 SpA / 16 Spe with a Modest nature is preferred due to reaching a jump point in Leftovers recovery. Alternative spreads of 200 HP / 252 SpA / 56 Spe, 104 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 148 Spe, and 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe, all with Modest natures, can be run on Dialga to outspeed Choice Scarf Shadow Tag Primal Groudon after a Shell Smash, Deoxys-S lacking a Choice Scarf after a Shell Smash, and Mega Mewtwo Y after Sticky Web when unboosted, respectively. However, these spreads sacrifice bulk and power, so they're almost never worth it.

A Choice Specs set with Draco Meteor or Spacial Rend, Flash Cannon, Searing Shot, and Volt Switch is a viable option, as Dialga’s superior defensive typing gives it a niche over Mega Latios. Both Draco Meteor and Spacial Rend OHKO opposing Giratina, but the former is usually preferred, as it also OHKOes all Primal Groudon variants. Secret Sword could be run over Searing Shot, as it nails a would-be check in Wonder Guard Blissey, but running it gives Dialga a harder time breaking through opposing Mega Steelix and Mega Scizor. Alternatively, Trick hinders common switch-ins, like Wonder Guard Blissey and Registeel. Choice Specs Mold Breaker Dialga is often too slow to pose an effective threat against offensive teams and is much more vulnerable to offensive Shadow Tag users, namely Shadow Tag + Perish Song users like Lugia. Additionally, Dialga can run a fringe offensive Wonder Guard set with Shell Smash, Judgment with Earth Plate or Fist Plate, and two coverage moves to hit opposing Wonder Guard users and Prankster Giratina. Viable coverage options include Freeze-Dry, Grass Knot, Searing Shot, Moonblast, Bug Buzz, Night Daze, and Knock Off; coverage moves that can damage Dialga super effectively, such as Secret Sword, Aura Sphere, Thousand Arrows, and Earth Power, are to be avoided, as they prevent Dialga from Imposter-proofing itself. Gastro Acid could also be used over one of the coverage moveslots to threaten opposing Wonder Guard users in a wider range of matchups. Wonder Guard Shell Smash Dialga is an option, but it is mostly outclassed by Mega Lucario as a Steel-type Shell Smash Wonder Guard sweeper due to the latter's ability to OHKO Primal Groudon after Shell Smash with a STAB move.

Checks and Counters

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Offensive Shadow Tag users like Earth Power Mega Latios can threaten the vast majority of unboosted Dialga; certain Choice Scarf Shadow Tag users, such as Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Mewtwo X and Y, can threaten Dialga even after it boosts its stats. However, offensive Shadow Tag users usually cannot switch in to Dialga safely and require pivoting support to reliably switch in.

Faster Offensive Pokemon: Most faster offensive Pokemon can threaten Dialga in a one-on-one situation, even if Dialga is healthy. In particular, Mold Breaker users that outspeed Dialga, such as Primal Groudon running more Speed investment, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Latios, are threatening due to having relatively few switch-ins, so momentum is often lost to the opposing team. However, Dialga sets running King's Shield can mostly circumvent this issue against Choice item Mold Breaker users, as the opposing Pokemon's move is scouted. Huge Power, Protean, and rare Parental Bond users are also issues for Dialga, as they often force it out by threatening an OHKO; however, these Pokemon don't pose an immediate threat if Dialga is paired with Wonder Guard users. Choice Scarf No Guard users, such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Aerodactyl, can outspeed Dialga even after a Shell Smash and force it out; however, being Choice-locked is easily exploitable, and these Pokemon cannot outspeed boosted Dialga if they use Trick.

Specially Defensive Pokemon: Specially defensive Pokemon, like Wonder Guard Blissey and Primal Kyogre, can switch into unboosted Dialga. In particular, Wonder Guard Blissey is difficult for Dialga to break through, especially if it is running Whirlwind or Knock Off. However, most specially defensive Pokemon can be broken through if Dialga gets enough free turns from disruption to accumulate sufficient boosts from Shell Smash. Magic Guard Ho-Oh can somewhat circumvent this by running Toxic Orb, though it is prone to getting removed by Shadow Tag users and cannot meaningfully pressure a healthy Dialga.

Revenge Killers: Power users like Slaking and Regigigas and -ate Speed users like Kyurem-B, Mega Diancie, and Mega Abomasnowcan pick off weakened Dialga lacking King's Shield, especially after a Shell Smash. Huge Power Dark-types with Knock Off also annoy healthy Dialga, forcing it to play mindgames between Knock Off and Pursuit. Additionally, Huge Power Dark-types with Sucker Punch can force coinflip scenarios against boosted Dialga, with Mega Gyarados and Mega Tyranitar always OHKOing Dialga if a successful prediction is made. Imposter users can also usually dissuade Dialga sets not running Draco Plate from setting up by threatening a countersweep. However, no revenge killers bar Imposter Chansey can safely switch in on boosted Dialga without first sacking a teammate or being pivoted in.

Prankster Users: Prankster users besides Giratina, such as Yveltal and the occasional Registeel or Chansey, can switch into most Dialga sets and force it out with Encore or Haze, especially if they are running Safety Goggles. While it is generally discouraged from doing so, Prankster Giratina can also switch into Dialga after a prediction if need be and force it out with Encore. However, Prankster users aside from Giratina are relatively rare, and Prankster Giratina is threatened by Dragon-type STAB from Dialga.

Item Removal: Removing Dialga's Plate can severely hinder its sweeping ability, particularly if Dialga is running Draco Plate. Knock Off users, like Wonder Guard Blissey, can remove Dialga's item with relative ease; Prankster Trick users, while niche, can also annoy Dialga, especially when Dialga's Plate is removed by a Pokemon it ordinarily forces out, like Giratina. However, the opportunity cost of running item removal often dissuades switch-ins to Dialga from running Knock Off or Trick, and Prankster Trick users are quite rare.

Shell Smash Sweeper.description:
Mold Breaker Dialga is a powerful sweeper due to its great STAB moves, great defensive typing, and good bulk. Spore creates setup opportunities for Dialga and allows for convenient Imposter-proofing with a Safety Goggles teammate. Alternatively, King's Shield takes advantage of Dialga's good bulk to more easily sweep teams reliant on Huge Power Slaking and Regigigas and -ate Speed users like Kyurem-B, Mega Abomasnow, and Mega Rayquaza to revenge kill boosted threats. King's Shield also grants healthy Dialga a slightly favorable chance to win the one-on-one against Choice Band Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X. Alternatively, Dialga can forgo Spore or King’s Shield for a set with Iron Plate, Judgment, Spacial Rend, and Searing Shot. Such a set hits much of the metagame super effectively and can be Imposter-proofed by Whirlwind Wonder Guard Blissey or fringe sets like specially defensive Mega Audino. Additionally, forgoing Draco Plate means Dialga can't lose access to its Dragon-type STAB move; thus, its offensive prowess is less easily hampered by Knock Off and Trick. Recover is an option to greatly increase Dialga's longevity, allowing it to set up on passive foes that can still chip it, like Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre running Scald, much more easily; however, forgoing King's Shield leaves boosted Dialga more vulnerable to Refrigerate and Pixilate users as well as Huge Power Slaking and Regigigas. Shell Smash bolsters Dialga's offensive prowess, allowing it to sweep a large portion of weakened teams after a boost. Dragon-type Judgment allows for easy Imposter-proofing with Giratina if forgoing Flash Cannon and hits slightly harder than Spacial Rend, notably OHKOing Aerilate Mega Rayquaza when unboosted and OHKOing offensive Arceus and Mega Mewtwo Y after Shell Smash. Spacial Rend is usable alongside Iron Plate Judgment, but this comes at the cost of Dialga becoming more difficult to Imposter-proof; it is worth noting, however, that Spacial Rend makes Dialga less vulnerable to Knock Off and Trick. Searing Shot complements Dialga's Dragon-type STAB moves well and threatens Steel-types like Registeel and Wonder Guard Mega Scizor and Escavalier. Alternatively, Flash Cannon threatens Fairy-type foes like Wonder Guard Xerneas, Mega Audino, and Mega Gardevoir much more effectively than Searing Shot. The given EV spread maximizes Dialga's overall bulk and damage output while outspeeding base 150 Speed Pokemon, like Mega Aerodactyl and Deoxys-A, after Shell Smash.

Dialga works well alongside the metagame's most dominant core of Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, Prankster Giratina, and Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas. Dialga complements Primal Groudon by beating the revenge killers that it struggles with, such as Aerilate Mega Rayquaza and Huge Power Mega Gyarados if lacking Sucker Punch. Additionally, Dialga can threaten the most common switch-in to Primal Groudon in Prankster Giratina. In return, Primal Groudon can switch into most Wonder Guard Xerneas sets as well as checks to Dialga, such as Wonder Guard Blissey and Ho-Oh. Prankster Giratina can switch into opposing Primal Groudon for Dialga. Wonder Guard Xerneas can provide Substitute + Baton Pass support for Dialga and potentially set entry hazards, paralyze or Dark Void switch-ins, and function with high efficacy due to forcing opposing Giratina and Yveltal out. Other physical Mold Breaker users, such as Choice Band Mega Rayquaza and Mega Tyranitar, are also good teammates thanks to their ability to pressure Dialga's checks. Bulky variants of Choice Band + Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X can OHKO Wonder Guard Xerneas while having the bulk to revenge kill bulky Lum Berry Huge Power Mega Gyarados if healthy, making it a great partner. Additionally, Choice Band + Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo can switch into, trap, and remove Wonder Guard users like Arceus, Mega Beedrill, and Mega Manetric if they lack Shed Shell or don't use Gastro Acid. Huge Power Dark-types like Mega Gyarados can ease Dialga's setup by Pursuit trapping Prankster Giratina. Substitute and Shell Smash + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users aside from Xerneas, like Mega Swampert and Primal Groudon, can lure in Prankster Giratina and take advantage of mindgame scenarios to retain momentum by passing either a Substitute or Shell Smash boost to Dialga. Finally, defensive Wonder Guard users are great partners, as they can remove and set entry hazards, act as clerics, use Whirlwind to prevent Substitutes and boosts from being passed, and provide slow pivoting support for Dialga.

Regigigas.comments:
Other Options

Regigigas can use other priority moves, such as Shadow Sneak for Mega Gengar, Water Shuriken for Primal Groudon, and Bullet Punch for Mega Diancie. However, without Huge Power, Water Shuriken needs to hit all 5 times to OHKO Primal Groudon with a Defense drop, and Shadow Sheak requires Life Orb to always OHKO opposing Mega Gengar after a Shell Smash, making these moves generally not worth running on a Regigigas with Shadow Tag. A set with Encore and Perish Song can be used on Shadow Tag Regigigas over Bullet Punch and Spikes in order to trap passive Wonder Guard users without Shed Shell as well as opposing sweepers running King's Shield that are locked into the move, but the utility of Spikes and Bullet Punch are usually not worth forgoing. Other entry hazards such as Stealth Rock and Sticky Web can also be used in the place of Spikes, but Regigigas's ability to set multiple layers means Spikes is usually preferred. Other coverage options like Sacred Fire, Gear Grind, Low Kick, and Petal Blizzard can be used on both Huge Power and Shadow Tag Regigigas to hit Mega Beedrill, Mega Scizor, Xerneas, Mega Audino, Arceus, Slaking, Primal Kyogre, and Mega Swampert, but they generally aren't worth sacrificing a listed move for due to their matchup reliance. Fusion Bolt can be used over Petal Blizzard on Huge Power sets to always OHKO physically defensive Primal Kyogre at the cost of not affecting Primal Groudon and Mega Swampert. Recover is another option for the fourth moveslot, allowing Regigigas to heal off chip from entry hazards. Spore can disrupt the opponent's team. Mach Punch can be used to OHKO Mega Tyranitar after a Shell Smash if Regigigas runs Huge Power, and Bullet Punch does the same for Mega Diancie. Shed Shell is an option to escape opposing Shadow Tag users if Regigigas uses Huge Power. Lum Berry cures status once, most notably burn and sleep.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard: Normal is not super effective against any type, so all Wonder Guard users can come in freely on Regigigas's Fake Out or Extreme Speed and can usually heal or set entry hazards in front of it. However, they need to be wary of Gastro Acid + Pursuit on Huge Power Regigigas, and those lacking Shed Shell that underspeed Shadow Tag Regigigas, like Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas and Safety Goggles Primal Kyogre, fear the uncommon Encore and Perish Song set.

Giratina: Giratina is not threatened by any of Regigigas's moves and is unable to be trapped due to its Ghost typing, allowing it to threaten Regigigas with crippling status moves or force it to switch. Magic Bounce sets can also prevent Regigigas from setting entry hazards, completely shutting it down. Giratina is weak to Pursuit from Huge Power Regigigas, but without switching Giratina is not threatened by it.

Normal-immune or Resistant Pokemon: Pokemon are immune or resistant to Normal such as Mega Gengar, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga can't be effectively revenge killed by Regigigas and can set up on it.

King's Shield Users: By using King's Shield against moves like Fake Out or Extreme Speed, Pokemon like Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, Mold Breaker Xerneas, and Shadow Tag Lugia can easily withstand Regigigas's next attack and make it much less effective.

Imposter Users: Users of Imposter such as Blissey and Chansey can turn the tables on Regigigas, inflicting its own Extreme Speed + Pursuit coinflip scenario on it.

Shed Shell Users: Pokemon holding Shed Shell avoid being trapped by Shadow Tag Regigigas, removing its main niche and allowing them to freely switch to a Pokemon that can beat it. However, these Pokemon must be wary of getting their item removed by one of Regigigas's teammates.

Huge Power Revenge Killer.description:
Huge Power and STAB on both Fake Out and Extreme Speed make Regigigas an effective priority revenge killer. With its immense Attack, Pursuit and Extreme Speed combine to put foes in uncomfortable coinflip scenarios. Water Shuriken works in tandem with the Expert Belt to OHKO Primal Groudon after a Shell Smash, as Primal Groudon deters Extreme Speed with its use of King's Shield. Silk Scarf may be used to OHKO bulky Mega Mewtwo X, all Mega Rayquaza variants, and Mega Gyarados with Extreme Speed. Gastro Acid allows Regigigas to pressure opposing Wonder Guard Pokemon and force switches. Spikes takes advantage of said switches, which often lets Regigigas set multiple layers over the course of the game. Taunt is an option to deny support options that Wonder Guard Pokemon may have, as they are common switch-ins to Regigigas. Safety Goggles blocks Spore, allowing Regigigas to come in safely and subject the opponent to more coinflip scenarios.

Huge Power Regigigas can work on a variety of teams due to its universal utility as a revenge killer, but it fits particularly well on offensive teams, since it can keep up pressure on the opponent. Regigigas appreciates Shadow Tag teammates such as Mega Mewtwo X, Primal Groudon, Lugia, and Arceus that can get rid of opposing Wonder Guard Pokemon, as once they are gone, there is little stopping it from steamrolling the opposing team. Mega Gyarados is also a huge help for Regigigas, as it can trap the Normal-immune Giratina with its devastatingly powerful Pursuit and threaten Primal Groudon with its own Water Shuriken. Aromatherapy users like Primal Kyogre and Blissey are also greatly appreciated, removing potential burns that would greatly hinder Regigigas's effectiveness. Blissey in particular can work well, as Regigigas also enjoys its Wish. Choice-locked Mold Breaker users like Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon can threaten opposing Wonder Guard Pokemon, such as Primal Kyogre and Mega Audino, for immense damage or an OHKO after Regigigas's Spikes.

Shadow Tag Revenge Killer.description:
Shadow Tag Regigigas is one of the best revenge killers in the metagame, as it can trap and eliminate frail offensive Pokemon including Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, No Guard Deoxys-S, and many variants of Mega Mewtwo Y. Its main source of damage is the combination of Fake Out and Extreme Speed, allowing Regigigas to often deal large amounts of damage without taking any in return. This combination of moves notably KOes Deoxys-S, offensive Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios with slight chip. Bullet Punch is used to OHKO Mega Diancie after a Shell Smash, as well as chip Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas. Spikes capitalizes on the free turns Regigigas gets against passive Wonder Guard users such as Mega Audino and Mega Scizor, as well as Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas lacking Glare, Dark Void, or Taunt. Regigigas is also often able to set 3 layers of Spikes vs passive Pokemon without Shed Shell, as they can not threaten it. Silk Scarf provides a boost to Regigigas's Normal-type STAB moves, allowing it to KO Deoxys-S, uninvested Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios with the combination of Fake Out and Extreme Speed. Additionally, Leftovers provides recovery that Regigigas can capitalize on by trapping passive Pokemon with Shadow Tag. Maximum Attack EVs with an Adamant nature allow Regigigas to hit as hard as possible, while an investment in HP increases Regigigas's longevity.

Regigigas fits mostly on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to trap and remove powerful offensive threats. Frail Mold Breaker sweepers such as Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie pair well with Regigigas, as removing offensive Pokemon allows them to set up more easily. Additionally, these Mold Breaker users can force out the metagame's most common Magic Bounce user in Giratina, which would otherwise prevent Regigigas from setting entry hazards. Mold Breaker Tyranitar is able to force Regigigas out, so Fairy- and Dark-type teammates such as Mega Diancie are good to have. Common Wonder Guard Pokemon such as Mega Scizor and Primal Kyogre are able to wall Regigigas, so the same Mold Breaker Pokemon also pair well with Regigigas, as they can eliminate these Pokemon. Imposter Chansey is another great partner, as the two of them can revenge almost all Pokemon except Mega Gengar and Dialga. Wonder Guard users also make good teammates, Regigigas is often able to remove the Mold Breaker Pokemon that threaten them. Pokemon with Trick, Mold Breaker Knock Off, or other forms of item removal are other helpful teammates, as Regigigas greatly appreciates Shed Shells being removed from opposing Wonder Guard users.

Giratina.comments:
Other Options

Baton Pass can be run on the first moveslot, as Giratina often incentivizes switching by threatening to use Encore; additionally, Baton Pass allows Giratina to switch out of Huge Power Pursuit users safely. Substitute is another option which allows Giratina to force attacks in tandem with Encore and scout against opposing Choice item Mold Breaker users in a 1v1 situation, but is generally not worth it as the opportunity cost of not running an additional utility move is very high. Toxic can be run to chip Mega Mewtwo X, Primal Groudon, and Wonder Guard Xerneas, but doesn't have Will-O-Wisp's ability to cripple most physical attackers or Glare's ability to hamper most Mold Breaker users' sweeping ability. Trick, especially with a detrimental item like Lagging Tail, allows Giratina to remove Plates from the many special Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Gengar, Mega Diancie, Dialga, and Mega Sceptile. As an alternative to Will-O-Wisp, Flame Orb + Psycho Shift prevents Dark Void from affecting Giratina and, in effect, spreads 100% accurate burns, but its downside includes Giratina needing to recover more frequently due to passive self-damage, forcing Giratina to cede momentum to the opponent. Dark Void is an option for the first moveslot which ignores Safety Goggles, at the cost of putting Giratina to sleep when used against a Magic Bounce user. Swagger can also be run in the first moveslot when paired with Imposter Chansey, as when Giratina is overwhelmed by a physical Mold Breaker user, it can use the move and either secure chip and heal itself or sack itself to bring Chansey in. Colbur Berry is an option that allows it to switch out of Huge Power Pursuit users one time without being as heavily damaged, though it is rather difficult to run due to the opportunity cost of not being able to block Spore, having passive recovery, or blocking Trick. Haze is an option over Encore that allows Giratina to check opposing Shell Smash sweepers in long games, as Encore is prone to getting PP stalled; however, this is only useful against physical Mold Breakers that Giratina naturally checks, like Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X.

Aside from Prankster and Magic Bounce, Giratina can run niche abilities in Poison Heal and Fur Coat; Poison Heal Giratina can defensively check Primal Groudon and Choice Band Mega Rayquaza more effectively, while Fur Coat Giratina has much less difficulty switching into Huge Power users. Poison Heal sets run Will-O-Wisp, Psycho Shift, Scald, or Steam Eruption in the first moveslot, King's Shield or Spiky Shield in the second moveslot, Curse, and Recover, with Toxic Orb as the item. Fur Coat Giratina enjoys running a similar moveset, but it favors running the same items that Prankster Giratina runs; however, Fur Coat Giratina does not rely on King's Shield as much, and it cannot run Psycho Shift viably. However, these abilities are not without their weaknesses: Poison Heal Giratina cannot disrupt Shell Smash sweepers that it is weak to, such as Mega Gengar, Mega Diancie, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga, the way Prankster Giratina would be able to, and Fur Coat Giratina is extremely passive and is generally outclassed by Prankster except against Huge Power users. No Guard Giratina is an extremely fringe option that exclusively relies on surprise, but a faster No Guard user, such as Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Mewtwo X, or Mega Aerodactyl, is virtually always superior.

Checks and Counters

Huge Power Dark-Types: Dark-type Huge Power users, like Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal, can force mindgames against Giratina through threatening both Pursuit and a conventional attack, usually Knock Off. However, Giratina can use Destiny Bond to force a trade between it and the Huge Power Dark-type, or run the niche Baton Pass to circumvent Pursuit.

Specially Offensive Pokemon: The vast majority of special Mold Breaker users can threaten Giratina, as Giratina is virtually always physically defensive and has a poor typing to deal with opposing special attackers. However, many special Mold Breakers rely on Plates to have a powerful STAB move or coverage, and Giratina running Trick can render said Plate users null as a threat once their Plate is removed. Even when not taking Mold Breaker users into account, specially offensive Pokemon, such as Protean Mega Latios and Choice Specs Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza, force Giratina out.

Wonder Guard Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir: Fairy-type Wonder Guard users with a respectable Special Attack stat, namely Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir, can force Giratina out with Moonblast; however, they must watch out for Glare, Will-O-Wisp, and Destiny Bond, as a loss of momentum, effectively being on a timer, or just being removed hampers the support they are able to give to the rest of the team.

Lum Berry Mega Mewtwo X: If Giratina is not healthy, Mega Mewtwo X with a Lum Berry can overwhelm Giratina, though Destiny Bond Giratina can force a trade between itself and Mega Mewtwo X.

-ate Users: Refrigerate, Pixilate, and Aerilate (collectively called -ate) users can force Giratina out by threatening either Fake Out + Extreme Speed or an extremely powerful Boomburst. Mega Diancie and Kyurem-B can threaten a KO against Giratina with Fake Out into Extreme Speed; Mega Abomasnow and Mega Rayquaza can potentially play around Giratina variants with Destiny Bond.

No Guard Users: By virtue of OHKOing every Pokemon that don't have Wonder Guard or Sturdy, No Guard users are adept at forcing Giratina out. However, Giratina can force a trade by using Destiny Bond on an OHKO move.

Prankster.description:
Prankster Giratina is the best blanket check to physical attackers in the metagame, as it is an untrappable check to Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X with amazing bulk and potentially an immunity to Trick. In addition, it has numerous possible options to try and circumvent its checks. Will-O-Wisp allows Giratina to cripple opposing Huge Power users without a Lum Berry and chips foes lacking recovery without resorting to Curse. Destiny Bond is also a great option, as it allows for a near-guaranteed trade, usually against a runaway sweeper. Spore annoys the likes of Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X lacking Safety Goggles, as well as Pokemon that would normally threaten Giratina like Mega Gengar, Mega Latios, and Mold Breaker Mega Diancie. Glare is another option that makes Primal Groudon and Huge Power users easier to deal with, but leaves Giratina vulnerable to Huge Power Pursuit users like Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal. Encore is integral to Giratina's ability to check sweepers, as locking opposing sweepers into setup moves like Shell Smash all but forces them out. Curse is extremely valuable, as many switch-ins to Giratina lack reliable recovery, and it is fairly easy for Giratina to find opportunities to heal itself. Recover is essential to Giratina's longevity. Safety Goggles is preferred, as it allows Giratina to be a sturdy check to Primal Groudon using Spore as disruption; Leftovers can be used to passively heal Giratina reduce chip damage from U-turn and entry hazards. Griseous Orb prevents Trick users, like Choice Band Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza, from locking Giratina into either a support move, preventing recovery until Giratina switches back in later in the game, or recovery, leaving Giratina a momentum sink.

Giratina can fit on virtually any team, as the widespread utility it provides on top of checking offensive Pokemon is unmatched. It effectively acts as a switch-in for Primal Groudon, Mega Mewtwo X, and offensive Choice Band Mold Breaker users. Giratina forms a crucial part of the metagame's most dominant core in Giratina, Primal Groudon, and Wonder Guard Xerneas. Giratina can come in on Huge Power-boosted Poison- and Steel-type attacks, while Xerneas can support the rest of the team with utility, such as Stealth Rock, Defog, Aromatherapy, and Glare; Giratina can also Imposter-proof Primal Groudon sets not running Dark Void. Additionally, Giratina can potentially use Glare and allow for Primal Groudon to pose a greater threat, or Destiny Bond to remove checks to this core like Mega Gengar and Protean Mega Latios. Both of these threats dislike having to win 50-50s against Pursuit and Sucker Punch users; thus Huge Power Dark-types, in particular Mega Gyarados, are good partners to Giratina. Aside from Mega Gyarados, -ate users that can threaten opposing Primal Groudon, such as Mega Abomasnow and Mega Rayquaza, are also good partners, as Giratina has trouble reliably checking Dark Void variants. On more defensive teams, Magic Bounce users that complement Giratina well typing-wise, such as Yveltal, Registeel, and occasionally Mega Venusaur and Ferrothorn, work well. Because of Wonder Guard Xerneas's prevalence and it being a common switch-in to Giratina, Shadow Tag users, in particular Mega Mewtwo X, are great partners to Giratina.

Audino-Mega.comments:
Other Options

Mega Audino can run Knock Off to fully dismantle Mega Gengar, weaken opposing Mega Latios, and remove Prankster Giratina's Safety Goggles for offensive teammates running Spore. Whirlwind and Perish Song are options that can be used when threatening Mold Breaker sweepers like Primal Groudon try to switch into Mega Audino or when Wonder Guard users like Xerneas try to pass a Substitute to a teammate. This isn't as common because Mega Audino can either just predict a switch and pivot to Pokemon more suited to deal with sweepers, or it can be pressured by the Mold Breaker sweeper through continuous status infliction. U-turn is an alternative pivot move that can maintain momentum against Taunt users such as Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and slightly chip physically frail Mold Breaker users coming in, such as Mega Mewtwo Y. However, the loss of momentum against opposing Wonder Guard users usually isn't worth it. A Lum Berry can help Mega Audino heal from sleep or bad poison from Toxic Spikes, but its one-time use can prove inefficient. Wonder Guard is best for longevity, but Prankster and Magic Bounce give Mega Audino more flexibility to run support moves. OHKO moves can be useful as a shock factor to offensive threats and can OHKO opposing No Guard users, but they almost always aren't worth running due to being inconsistent. Mega Audino can also use hazards to punish opposing switch-ins. Lastly, Mega Audino can run a variety of other support moves like Glare, Chatter, and Will-O-Wisp to help advance its teammates further.

Checks and Counters

Unfavorable Matchup: Various Pokemon including Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Protean Mega Latios, Protean Mega Mewtwo Y, and Wonder Guard Xerneas often run super effective coverage moves against Mega Audino to force it out.

Giratina: Giratina can be sent out against Mega Audino to run Curse against it, as Curse can be passed by Baton Pass. Additionally, a Giratina with Magic Bounce would not be able to let Mega Audino run Parting Shot in to escape and a Prankster Giratina can force Mega Audino out with Encore. However, Prankster Giratina must be careful when using Curse against Mega Audino with Parting Shot, as Mega Audino using the move the same turn Giratina uses Curse prevents Curse from affecting it, while Giratina is left less healthy.

Mold Breaker Shell Smash Users: Mold Breaker users carrying Shell Smash can use Mega Audino's passivity to set up on it. They can also put Mega Audino to sleep with Spore or Dark Void—the former requires Safety Goggles to block more than once, while the latter cannot be consistently blocked by any item—or inflict chip damage with a powerful attack. However, some Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Gengar lacking a Poison-type STAB move, struggle to get past Mega Audino without getting lucky with sleep.

Shadow Tag Perish Trappers: Mega Audino without Shed Shell is very vulnerable to removal by Shadow Tag users. If swapped in on any move bar Baton Pass or Parting Shot, the Shadow Tag user can Encore Mega Audino, set three layers of Spikes, and remove it with Perish Song.

Taunt Users: Taunt shuts down all Mega Audino sets bar those using U-turn, Magic Coat, or non-status utility moves like Nuzzle and Knock Off.

Wonder Guard Support.description:
Though it has an opportunity cost in not being able to be run with Wonder Guard Xerneas, Mega Audino is a premier Wonder Guard user in the Pure Hackmons metagame due to having an amazing defensive typing, being a very slow pivot, and being able to soft-check the likes of Mega Gengar lacking a Poison-type STAB move and Mega Latios lacking Shell Smash. Mega Audino can make use of either Recover to keep itself healthy or Wish with its high HP stat to keep both its teammates and itself healthy, though relying on Wish to heal makes it significantly more difficult to retain momentum. Aromatherapy and Defog are two of the best forms of support any defensive Wonder Guard user can offer its teammates. The former cures Mega Audino and its teammates of status ailments that they would otherwise be annoyed with, while the latter helps to minimize the amount of chip damage that offensive teammates take over the course of the game. King's Shield gives Mega Audino the chance to scout offensive Pokemon that like to switch into it, such as Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, as well as allowing Mega Audino to force out many variants of said switch-ins after an Attack drop. Magic Coat helps Mega Audino's longevity by reflecting back status-inflicting moves like Spore, Dark Void, Will-O-Wisp, and Glare, as well as moves that would otherwise force Mega Audino out, like Taunt and Encore. A pivoting move is almost always required for Mega Audino to retain momentum for its team; Parting Shot is a solid option that can weaken offensive switch-ins, but it causes Mega Audino to struggle to maintain momentum against teams with a Magic Bounce user; however, Baton Pass is the preferred option due to its high PP and freedom pivoting. Mega Audino wants to be as physically bulky as possible in order to scout and pivot out of powerful physical attackers such as Mega Mewtwo X and Primal Groudon; a Relaxed nature with maximum HP and Defense investment and minimum Speed IVs help Mega Audino perform this function of a defensive cleric, soft-check specific Mold Breaker users, and act as a slow pivot. Shed Shell is the preferred item to prevent Mega Audino from being removed by Shadow Tag users, while Safety Goggles helps Mega Audino against Spore users like Mold Breaker users and Prankster Giratina.

Mega Audino should only be used in rare semi-stall teams, bulky balance teams, and teams with enough offensive pressure to prefer the defensive roles Xerneas cannot perform as well in. Semi-stall is rare due to limits in teambuilding, but these teams can have Ho-Oh and Mega Steelix cover Mega Audino's weaknesses. Glass cannons, such as Mold Breaker Mega Gengar, Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, and Choice Band Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, appreciate Mega Audino's ability to bring them onto the field safely. In addition, these Pokemon also all appreciate Mega Audino's ability to clear entry hazards and cure status. Mega Audino also Imposter-proofs most offensive teammates lacking Poison-type and Steel-type moves, including Mold Breakers like Mega Rayquaza, Mega Latios, Dialga, and Mega Tyranitar. Mega Audino's vulnerability to Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and coverage attackers like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Latios in an unfavorable matchup makes -ate Speed users like Mega Rayquaza, Kyurem-B, and Mega Abomasnow valuable teammates. Notably, Mega Abomasnow is able to revenge kill the majority of Primal Groudon sets thanks to its resistance to Thousand Arrows, a powerful Boomburst, and Primal Groudon not being able to fit in a Fire-type STAB move and King's Shield on the same set. Mega Audino appreciates being part of most Wonder Guard cores. Cresselia, Mega Scizor, and Mega Manectric are all great examples of solid Wonder Guard partners, since Mega Audino compresses a lot of utility into one teamslot and carries distinct weaknesses. SubPass Wonder Guard users like Mega Swampert and Primal Groudon make for strong partners, since they appreciate the support Wish Mega Audino gives while providing the main support Mega Audino cannot offer. Offensive Shell Smash Wonder Guard sweepers like Mega Lucario and Primal Groudon also pair well with it. Finally, King's Shield Mega Audino can form a solid Wonder Guard core with Wonder Guard users weak to contact moves like Blissey and specially defensive Primal Kyogre.

Zekrom.comments:
Other Options

Taunt is also an option for Zekrom's first moveslot. It allows Zekrom to completely shut down most Giratina sets, which run four status moves. This forces Giratina to switch out and lets Zekrom use Shell Smash. However, it is less consistent than Dark Void, which lets Zekrom set up with ease. Shed Shell allows Zekrom to safely switch out against Shadow Tag users like Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X that threaten it with their super effective moves, as it gets trapped by Primal Groudon before Shell Smash and Mega Mewtwo X after a Shell Smash. However, using Shed Shell can reduce Zekrom's longevity or its power output without access to Leftovers or Draco Plate, respectively. Substitute can also be used with Leftovers. This helps matchups like Lum Berry Huge Power Mega Gyarados become more consistent, as Dark Void is not useful there.

Checks and Counters

Prankster Giratina: Although Zekrom has several measures to prevent getting forced out by Giratina, it still poses a threat to Zekrom. It can use Encore on the turn Zekrom uses Shell Smash or King's Shield, forcing Zekrom to switch. Giratina can also use Destiny Bond to ensure a trade and get rid of Zekrom altogether.

Mega Audino: Wonder Guard Mega Audino is immune to any Dragon-type attacks Zekrom uses and can reliably tank Bolt Strike even after a Shell Smash if healthy. This discourages Zekrom from using a Dragon-type attack if the opponent wants to switch to Giratina. Mega Audino can also help pivot into a revenge killer or Encore Giratina to threaten Zekrom.

Ground- and Fairy-type Coverage: Pokemon such as Huge Power Mega Mewtwo-X with Thousand Arrows and Mega Mewtwo-Y and Protean Mega Latios with Moonblast can easily outspeed Zekrom and KO it with their super effective moves.

Faster Offensive Pokemon: Faster Primal Groudon sets, such as sets with Shadow Tag, and Mega Rayquaza also trouble Zekrom. They carry super effective moves such as Thousand Arrows on Primal Groudon and Draco Meteor on Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza that can easily KO it. Bulkier teammates help switch into some of these attacks.

Strong Priority: Strong priority moves from Pokemon like Pixilate Mega Diancie and Huge Power Regigigas, which can switch into any of Zekrom's unboosted moves, can threaten Zekrom, especially without King's Shield. Huge Power Mega Gyarados can also OHKO Zekrom with Sucker Punch after a Shell Smash.

Mold Breaker.description:
Mold Breaker Zekrom is a powerful mixed sweeper with decent bulk and a nearly unresisted STAB combination, capable of OHKOing Giratina, Primal Groudon, and Wonder Guard Xerneas after a Shell Smash. King's Shield allows Zekrom to survive revenge killing attempts from moves like Pixilate Mega Diancie's Extreme Speed and Pure Power Mega Mewtwo X's Mach Punch if healthy. Leftovers increases Zekrom's longevity, taking advantage of the turns gained from forcing switches and sleep, as well as synergizing with King's Shield. Dark Void and Spore are useful to hinder Pokemon that would otherwise prevent Zekrom from using Shell Smash and gain turns to set up. The combination of Draco Plate and Judgment allows Zekrom to Imposter-proof itself with a strong, spammable Dragon-type STAB move that foes cannot take advantage of. Alternatively, Spacial Rend frees up Zekrom's item slot, though it is weaker than Draco Plate Judgment and makes Imposter-proofing Zekrom significantly more difficult. Lum Berry lets Zekrom use Shell Smash on an opposing Spore or Will-O-Wisp user switching in. 144 Atk EVs allow Zekrom to OHKO Xerneas at +2, and 56 Spe EVs let it outspeed Choice Scarf Primal Groudon after a Shell Smash.

Substitute + Baton Pass users, like Wonder Guard Xerneas, Mega Scizor, and Primal Kyogre, work well with Zekrom, as they can safely bring Zekrom in, letting it use Shell Smash and potentially sweep. Slow pivots also help in a similar fashion, particularly Wonder Guard users, which are a valuable defensive backbone on almost any team. Shell Smash + Baton Pass users can also make for great partners in the same way. Safety Goggles Prankster Giratina, a very easy addition on almost any team, can also Imposter-proof Spore sets that run Judgment. Primal Groudon is an extremely good teammate, as it can act as a second Mold Breaker user that addresses revenge killers to Zekrom or as a Shadow Tag user that can trap and remove Pixilate Diancie or the uncommon Refrigerate Abomasnow and revenge kill weakened Imposter users copying Zekrom, unless Zekrom has King's Shield.

Kyurem-Black.comments:
Other Options

Kyurem-B can also opt to run a physical coverage move like Gunk Shot, Freeze-Dry, Close Combat, or Thousand Arrows to hit unsuspecting Wonder Guard users that would switch in to block its Ice-type STAB moves. Spikes, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web can replace Stealth Rock. Will-O-Wisp can also replace it to status and chip Wonder Guard users that switch in. A Brave nature with 0 Speed IVs can be used on Boomburst sets to move slower than some Wonder Guard users' pivots. Kyurem-B can also run King's Shield because all of its main competitors (Regigigas, Slaking, Mega Diancie, and Mega Rayquaza) tend to outspeed it. It can then threaten to beat any of these one-on-one if they lack a King's Shield and Boomburst of their own.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard: Because Kyurem-B usually forgoes running coverage, Wonder Guard Pokemon aren't afraid of it, and some can even set up in front of it. However, Kyurem-B sets running Gastro Acid can circumvent this to an extent, as once Wonder Guard is removed, most Wonder Guard users are forced out, granting the Kyurem-B user momentum.

Other Priority Users: In a one-on-one scenario, faster -ate Speed users, like Mega Diancie and Mega Rayquaza, are able to outspeed Kyurem and hit hard with Fake Out into Extreme Speed.

King's Shield + Mold Breaker Sweepers: Bulky Mold Breaker sweepers that run King's Shield, such as Primal Groudon, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga, force Kyurem-B to play mind games every time they set up and Kyurem-B comes in. Primal Groudon is particularly threatening, as it has exceptional physical bulk for a Shell Smash sweeper and can run a sleep move and King's Shield on the same set viably.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Shadow Tag Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X can punish Kyurem-B heavily by surviving an Extreme Speed and attacking back with their strong attacks, like V-create and Drain Punch.

Bulky Steel-types: Pokemon like Magic Bounce Registeel and Mega Steelix have high Defense to absorb Kyurem-B's attacks with ease, removing any progress it makes with their recovery.

Refrigerate.description:
Through its use of priority Ice-type STAB attacks, Refrigerate Kyurem-B acts as an effective revenge killer, sweep-stopper, and general offensive powerhouse. Fake Out + Extreme Speed can easily dispatch most No Guard users and Shell Smash sweepers lacking King's Shield, as well as chunking bulky Ice-weak support Pokemon like Giratina. Boomburst can be used to damage sweepers behind Substitute, as well as immediately threatening Magic Bounce Giratina and unboosted Primal Groudon. Pursuit gives Kyurem-B the option to punish physically frail foes, like Mega Gengar and Mega Latios, on a switch out. Sacred Fire is an option to threaten bulky Steel-types like Mega Scizor, Registeel, and Mega Steelix, which makes Stealth Rock easier to use in matchups against said foes. Stealth Rock itself is a great way to punish switches. Finally, Gastro Acid instead lets Kyurem-B force most Wonder Guard Pokemon out, escape offensive Shadow Tag users, and remove Mold Breaker from sweepers running King's Shield if it predicts correctly. Lum Berry is used to avoid sleep from Mold Breaker sweepers once and dodge other status if they aren't in play, while Icicle Plate buffs Kyurem-B's Ice-type moves and gives it the power to KO Giratina with Boomburst after Stealth Rock. On sets running Boomburst, a Naughty nature is preferred to avoid lowering Kyurem-B's Special Attack; otherwise, an Adamant nature is preferred. Maximum Defense investment allows it to survive one V-create or Thousand Arrows from boosted Primal Groudon at full.

Kyurem-B fits best on offensive teams that appreciate it revenge killing frailer threats that outspeed its teammates. Kyurem-B's largest weakness is its inability to consistently damage Wonder Guard users because of its narrow coverage. Because of this, it benefits greatly from Mold Breaker teammates like Mega Gengar, Pokemon that use a wide variety of coverage moves like offensive Wonder Guard Xerneas, and Perish Song trappers like Lugia. Choice Scarf + No Guard Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y can help the matchup against Primal Groudon. Additionally, special attackers like the Mega Mewtwo Y or Mega Gengar can stop physical walls from walling Kyurem-B out. Finally, due to its Stealth Rock weakness, Defog support is needed to maximize its longevity when switching in to revenge kill.

Meloetta.comments:
Other Options

An alternate EV Spread of 248 HP / 28 Def / 232 SpD with a Calm nature maximizes Meloetta's special bulk while allowing it to avoid the 2HKO from Mold Breaker Mega Gengar's Secret Sword after Stealth Rock. 76 Speed EVs can be used outpace Huge Power Yveltal and escape its Pursuit, though doing so cuts into Meloetta's chance of surviving attacks from Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and usually isn't worth it due to Huge Power Yveltal's relative rarity. Colbur Berry is an option on physically defensive sets, allowing it to avoid the Pursuit trapper mind game once. Safety Goggles and Chesto Berry are options that can improve Meloetta's matchup against Mold Breaker users using Spore and Dark Void, respectively. Mail is a final option that makes Meloetta immune to Trick. All these options, however, leave Meloetta vulnerable to Shadow Tag users like Perish Song Lugia and Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X.

Psystrike is a decent option that OHKOes Mega Gengar, even without investment, making it a much more reliable check—especially alongside Chesto Berry or Safety Goggles—though it has little utility outside of hitting Mega Gengar. Glare is another option that, like Whirlwind, makes Meloetta a situational check to some special Shell Smash Mold Breaker or Wonder Guard sweepers. Perish Song is an alternative to Whirlwind that fares better versus Magic Bounce Substitute + Baton Pass users like Giratina. Nuzzle and Chatter are niche options that can disrupt opposing sweepers and also make Meloetta less vulnerable to Taunt users. Steam Eruption is an option to OHKO standard Primal Groudon, but has little utility otherwise. Parting Shot and U-Turn are alternate pivoting options over Baton Pass. However, the former cedes momentum Magic Bounce users, the latter cedes momentum to Wonder Guard users, and, unlike Baton Pass, neither move evades a slower Pursuit. Finally, Magic Coat is an option to reflect sleep moves from Mold Breaker users, Stealth Rock from -ate Speed users, and Sing, Gastro Acid, Taunt, and Spider Web from No Guard users.

Checks and Counters

Huge Power Pursuit: Despite King's Shield and Baton Pass mitigating Meloetta's weakness to Pursuit, it still has to be wary of being Pursuit trapped while paralyzed, when facing the uncommon but relevant Sticky Web, and when facing faster Pursuit users—particularly since Meloetta is often its team's cleric or entry hazard remover.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: Shell Smash Mold Breakers like Primal Groudon, Mega Tyranitar, and Arceus set up safely on any Meloetta set not carrying Whirlwind or niche options like Glare or Chatter. In addition, if Meloetta forgoes King's Shield, it's also forced out by powerful physical attackers like Choice Band Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza.

Unfavorable Matchup: Like any Wonder Guard user, Meloetta is vulnerable to powerful Huge Power, Protean, and Parental Bond attackers carrying the right coverage moves—such as Beat Up Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Bug Buzz Protean Mega Latios.

Knock Off: Meloetta is vulnerable to Knock Off, which either removes its Shed Shell, leaving it vulnerable to Shadow Tag users, or KOes it outright.

Trick: Unless it's holding Mail, Trick users can hinder Meloetta for the entirety of the match, forcing it to either use Baton Pass or relinquish momentum.

Prankster Giratina: As is the case with the majority of support Wonder Guard users, Prankster Giratina can force Meloetta out with Encore and chip it with Will-O-Wisp and Curse. Additionally, Giratina's Glare can also leave Meloetta vulnerable to slower Pursuit users it would ordinarily evade.

Taunt: Taunt forces out nearly all Meloetta sets. Even those making use of niche options like Psystrike or Nuzzle become limited in their ability to maintain momentum and support their team.

Wonder Guard Support.description:
Meloetta's unique typing, good bulk, and flexible Speed tier make it a strong option for a support Wonder Guard user. Baton Pass allows Meloetta to provide pivoting support to its teammates while also escaping slower Pursuit users, such as Huge Power Mega Gyarados. King's Shield is an alternative that can similarly ease Meloetta's matchup versus Pursuit users while also letting it scout for its team and improving its one-on-one matchup versus powerful physical threats like Choice Band Mold Breaker Primal Groudon. Defog and Aromatherapy are valuable support options for nearly every team composition. However, if a teammate is carrying either or both, Meloetta can make use of other utility options like Whirlwind and Stealth Rock. Notably, Whirlwind can make Meloetta a situational check to many special Shell Smash Mold Breaker and Wonder Guard sweepers, as well as force out Substitute + Baton Pass users like the ever popular Wonder Guard Xerneas. Finally, recovery is essential for Meloetta to function effectively. Recover's immediacy and reliability is generally preferred, but Wish is an alternative that allows Meloetta to support its teammates and synergizes well with King's Shield and Baton Pass. Shed Shell is the preferred item, as it makes Meloetta much less susceptible to Shadow Tag users. The given EV spread maximizes Meloetta's physical bulk while also giving it the ability to survive Mold Breaker Mega Gengar's +2 Sludge Wave after Stealth Rock. This is notable, as Meloetta's immunity to Ghost and good bulk allow it to soft check Mold Breaker Mega Gengar whether it's carrying Secret Sword or Sludge Wave. Finally, if Pursuit trappers aren't a concern, Meloetta can make use of a Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs to underspeed popular slow pivots like Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas.

Like is the case with all support Wonder Guard users, Meloetta fits on a wide variety of team structures. Its weakness to Pursuit users means that Meloetta appreciates teammates such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas, as well as Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario. Choice Specs Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Rayquaza, appreciate specially defensive Meloetta's ability to Imposter-proof them thanks to its unique typing and good special bulk. Choice Specs Mold Breaker Mega Mewtwo Y is worth noting in particular, as even physically defensive variants of Meloetta can Imposter-proof it with Whirlwind or by using Baton Pass to pivot to a revenge killer like Sucker Punch Mega Gyarados. Additionally, Pursuit trappers like Huge Power Mega Gyarados and Yveltal are excellent teammates for Meloetta, checking Shell Smash Mold Breakers users and Pursuit trapping Prankster Giratina. Furthermore, Pursuit users can trap Imposter users copying variants of Meloetta lacking Baton Pass. -ate Speed users like Mega Rayquaza and Mega Abomasnow are also helpful teammates for Meloetta, as they force out the majority of Mold Breaker sweepers after being brought in safely by Meloetta's Baton Pass. On bulkier teams, Meloetta can be run alongside another defensive Wonder Guard user, allowing for more flexibility with both their movesets. In particular, Wonder Guard users that can switch into physical attackers for Meloetta, but are perhaps more vulnerable to Mold Breaker Mega Gengar—such as Mega Scizor and Mega Swampert—synergize very well with Meloetta. Finally, offensive Shadow Tag users such as Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo X are valuable teammates as they can trap the Pursuit trappers that Meloetta fears.

Genesect.comments:
Other Options

An EV spread of 252 Atk / 4 SpA / 252 Spe alongside a Naughty nature can be used to OHKO physically defensive Primal Kyogre with +2 Bolt Strike and standard Wonder Guard Xerneas with +2 Gear Grind while still OHKOing Bug / Steel type Wonder Guard users with Techno Blast. However, such a set is largely outclassed by Mega Lucario and Mega Scizor, of which the former has higher Speed, better overall damage output, and can OHKO Primal Groudon at +2 with its Fist Plate Judgment. Genesect has a few other viable coverage options available to it; Scald OHKOes most variants of Primal Groudon without needing to boost first, Aura Sphere hits Normal-type Wonder Guard users not named Blissey or Chansey harder than Secret Sword, Night Daze hits Wonder Guard Dusclops, Knock Off removes items and hits Psychic-type Wonder Guard users, and Giga Drain hits Water-type Wonder Guard users like Mega Swampert while also providing recovery. Finally, Flame Plate and Judgment are options over Burn Drive and Techno Blast if Judgment’s greater PP is valued more than the immunity to item removal that Burn Drive grants.

Checks and Counters

Fire-type Coverage: A quadruple weakness to Fire and below average bulk means that Genesect drops to even relatively weak Fire-type attacks. Furthermore, Sacred Fire, V-Create, Searing Shot, and Lava Plume are all very common coverage moves on Huge Power, Protean, Parental Bond, and opposing Shell Smash + Wonder Guard users.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: A weakness to powerful Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza isn't unique to Genesect. However, unlike other Wonder Guard + Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario, Genesect's comparatively low Special Attack means that it cannot OHKO many Mold Breaker users even after a Shell Smash depending on its coverage moves, leaving it vulnerable to being OHKOed in return.

Opposing Wonder Guard: Wonder Guard sweepers are inherently matchup dependent, so Wonder Guard users Genesect's coverage can’t touch will force it out.

Prankster Giratina: Genesect's relatively low Special Attack for a Wonder Guard + Shell Smash sweeper means that Giratina can easily switch in and force an unboosted Genesect out. In particular, Haze variants of Giratina can wall Genesect almost endlessly, barring an unlucky freeze from Freeze-Dry. Once Genesect is neutralized with Encore or Haze, Giratina can also chip it with Will-O-Wisp or remove its sweeping potential with Glare.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Genesect's lack of a Shed Shell leaves it vulnerable to offensive Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Mewtwo X, and Primal Groudon. However, they cannot consistently check a boosted Genesect depending on its coverage moves; +2 Bug Buzz OHKOes Mega Mewtwo Y, +2 Moonblast OHKOes Mega Mewtwo X, and +2 Earth Power OHKOes Primal Groudon.

Shell Smash Wonder Guard.description:
Genesect's good Special Attack, solid Bug / Steel typing, and unique interaction with Burn Drive make it a decent option for a Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweeper. Techno Blast and Burn Drive allow Genesect to both Imposter-proof itself and OHKO opposing Bug / Steel Wonder Guard users. Additionally, Burn Drive grants Genesect an immunity to Trick without sacrificing its ability to beat Imposter users—a property that only Fist Plate Arceus shares among Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers. The remaining two moveslots are devoted to coverage moves to hit as many Wonder Guard users as possible. Flash Cannon is a decently powerful Steel-type STAB that hits Xerneas, Mega Audino, and Mega Gardevoir. Earth Power hits Mega Manectric and Mega Lucario, in addition to OHKOing Primal Groudon at +2. Secret Sword hits Normal-type Wonder Guard users like Slaking and Blissey. Freeze-Dry hits Water-type Wonder Guard users like Primal Kyogre and Gyarados, as well as 2HKOes standard Giratina at +2. Grass Knot similarly hits Water-type Wonder Guard users, excluding Gyarados, but its situationally higher Base Power improves its matchup versus foes like Whirlwind Kyogre. Moonblast has good neutral coverage and at +2 OHKOes Wonder Guard Mega Sableye and Mega Mewtwo X and 2HKOes Giratina. Bug Buzz is another STAB option that allows Genesect to break through Psychic-type Wonder Guard users like Mega Mewtwo Y, Cresselia, Meloetta, and Deoxys-S—notably bypassing Substitute + Baton Pass Mega Mewtwo Y and Deoxys-S's Substitutes. Alternatively, Genesect can make use of Gastro Acid to break through any Wonder Guard user that can't immediately KO it or force it out with Whirlwind. However, Gastro Acid essentially restricts Genesect's final coverage option to either Freeze-Dry or Moonblast, else it is unable to break through Prankster Giratina.

Genesect fits best on balance and offense teams as a late-game wincon. Offensive Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y make excellent teammates for their ability to trap and KO opposing Wonder Guard users that frequently forgo Shed Shell, such as Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Manectric. Choice item Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza also make excellent teammates for their ability to blow holes in opposing Wonder Guard cores. In particular, Choice Band Primal Groudon is notable for its ability to essentially delete the majority of opposing Wonder Guard users with its STAB V-create. No Guard users such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Aerodactyl are helpful teammates, (comma) as they provide Genesect with an abundance of free turns to use Shell Smash, in addition to forcing out Prankster Giratina. Similarly, Huge Power Pursuit users are valuable teammates for their ability to Pursuit trap Prankster Giratina, as well as the Choice item Shadow Tag users that like to switch into Genesect. Refrigerate and Pixilate users like Mega Abomasnow and Mega Diancie are likewise noteworthy teammates for their ability to force out Giratina with their powerful Boomburst. In particular, Mega Abomasnow is notable for its ability to revenge kill many variants of Primal Groudon, which most Genesect sets struggle against even while boosted. Furthermore, -ate Speed users make excellent entry hazard setters, and Genesect appreciates entry hazard support to turn some of its favorable rolls, such as +2 Grass Knot versus physically defensive Kyogre, into guaranteed KOs, improving its overall effectiveness as a wincon. Finally, Aromatherapy, Defog, and Wish support from defensive Wonder Guard teammates is greatly appreciated to offset any chip damage or status conditions Genesect might acquire during a game, easing its job as a late-game cleaner.

Xerneas.comments:
Other Options

Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas has many options for its first moveslot. Shell Smash lets it pass boosts to a threatening teammate and can be run with a spread of 248 HP / 184 SpA / 76 Spe and a Modest nature to let it outspeed non-Choice Scarf Deoxys-S at +2. Defog and Aromatherapy are also decent support options, and Spikes can be used over Stealth Rock, as two of the most prominent Spikes-immune Pokemon, Mega Rayquaza and Yveltal, lose to Xerneas. Toxic Spikes and Sticky Web provide great support for a team as well, although Poison-types like Mega Gengar, Skuntank, and Drapion can absorb Toxic Spikes. Steam Eruption OHKOes Primal Groudon, though it doesn't threaten much else; if Xerneas runs Steam Eruption, an alternative spread of 72 HP / 252 SpA / 184 Spe with a Modest nature lets it outspeed Adamant Primal Groudon. Wish is an option over Recover, but it makes Xerneas healing itself safely more difficult. King's Shield forces out Choice Band Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza. Spore is usable over Dark Void because it has higher accuracy and gives Xerneas an easier time against Magic Bounce and Imposter users if it opts to run Safety Goggles, but Spore similarly doesn't affect foes with Safety Goggles. Knock Off is a fringe option that potentially removes Leftovers or Lum Berry from Primal Groudon and threatens Plate users like Mold Breaker Mega Gengar, Mega Diancie, and Dialga if Xerneas has a Substitute up. Magic Coat burns Prankster Giratina's Encore PP and bounces back Whirlwind but faces stiff competition from Taunt. Gastro Acid can be used to suppress Mold Breaker users' abilities on the switch, giving Xerneas a free turn to set up Substitute in most instances. Mail can prevent Trick users from crippling Xerneas, but Mail sets are generally forced into running Recover in the first moveslot.

Mold Breaker Xerneas can effectively make use of Dark Void or Taunt over Spore on sets with Pixie Plate Judgment as its only attack. However, these moves invalidate Safety Goggles users and slow, passive Pokemon as methods of Imposter-proofing Xerneas. Xerneas can run Earth Power over Steam Eruption for the occasional Mega Metagross, Registeel, and Mega Steelix, though it doesn't OHKO Primal Groudon when unboosted. Secret Sword OHKOes Blissey when unboosted and 2HKOes Eviolite Chansey and Registeel at +2—all of which can switch into Mold Breaker Xerneas and phaze it or deprive it of its Pixie Plate with Knock Off. Recover and Substitute are alternatives to King's Shield that similarly augment Xerneas's survivability; the former allows Mold Breaker Xerneas to potentially set up multiple times during a game, while the latter protects Xerneas from revenge killers. Entry hazards are decent options on single-attack sets. Utilizing Moonblast over Pixie Plate Judgment allows Xerneas to make use of items like Leftovers, Lum Berry, Mental Herb, Shed Shell, and Safety Goggles; however, the loss in power is noticeable and forgoing Judgment makes Xerneas more difficult to Imposter-proof.

Wonder Guard sweeper Xerneas can run Thousand Arrows to hit Air Balloon Wonder Guard users; Searing Shot to guarantee an OHKO on Aegislash at +2, which Lava Plume fails to do; Steam Eruption to deal more damage than Scald to Steel-resistant, non-Wonder Guard targets, such as Mega Metagross and Aegislash; Quiver Dance to improve the matchup against Mold Breaker users such as Mega Rayquaza; and Spore or Dark Void to safely set up on a sleeping foe. Xerneas can run other coverage moves depending on the team's needs.

On teams running several Xerneas, Xerneas can run more unconventional and generally outclassed sets like Huge Power, Prankster, No Guard, Magic Bounce, and Imposter to take advantage of the surprise factor these teams provide.

Checks and Counters

Primal Groudon: Mold Breaker Primal Groudon, especially if it is holding Leftovers, can force Xerneas out with relative ease because of its resistance to Moonblast and offensive presence. However, Xerneas running Glare or Dark Void can debilitate non-Lum Berry Primal Groudon, the rare Scald and Steam Eruption OHKO it unboosted, Earth Power OHKOes it at +2, and Gastro Acid nullifies its ability to bypass Wonder Guard.

Choice Item Mold Breaker Users: Choice item Mold Breaker Pokemon, especially ones with powerful STAB moves, like Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Mewtwo Y, can force Xerneas out. However, they can usually only come in when safely pivoted in, as most must be wary of Xerneas's attacks.

Shadow Tag Users: Shadow Tag users can trap non-Shed Shell Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas and eliminate it. Bulky Perish Song trappers, like Lugia and Arceus, can set up three layers of Spikes and remove Xerneas if pivoted in when it uses any move but Glare, Dark Void, or Baton Pass. Offensive Shadow Tag users—notably Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X—can KO Xerneas with coverage moves like Gunk Shot, Gear Grind, and Sludge Wave. However, they require pivoting support to get in safely against sets running Glare or Dark Void, often only secure a KO against Xerneas users that play carelessly, and require considerable support to threaten Shed Shell Xerneas.

Item Manipulation: Trick users—especially Pokemon Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas ordinarily switches into, like No Guard users, Wonder Guard Mega Beedrill, and rare Choice item Wonder Guard users—can severely hinder its ability to support its team by giving it a detrimental item. Choice items virtually force Xerneas into using Baton Pass, as its team loses momentum if it uses any other move, and Black Sludge effectively puts it on a timer. However, rare Mail variants of Xerneas are immune to Trick. Non-Moonblast Mold Breaker Xerneas relies on its Pixie Plate to deal decent damage, and Wonder Guard sweeper Xerneas relies on its Iron Plate to Imposter-proof itself and hit Fairy-type Wonder Guard users, so removing either via Trick or Knock Off is also severely debilitating.

Wonder Guard Users: Without super effective coverage, Taunt, or Gastro Acid, Wonder Guard sweeper Xerneas is unable to touch Wonder Guard users. Whirlwind Wonder Guard users, such as Primal Kyogre, Slaking, and Cresselia, can also phaze Xerneas, disrupting its Substitute-passing or setup attempts. Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas can somewhat circumvent this with Glare, however, as it can pass a Substitute if the foe gets fully paralyzed for one turn, and Wonder Guard sweeper Xerneas can prevent Whirlwind with Taunt. Additionally, three of the best Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers, Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Lucario, virtually always run coverage for Fairy-type Wonder Guard users like Xerneas and Mega Audino. However, Xerneas with Glare can survive a hit and debilitate the opposing Wonder Guard Shell Smash user with paralysis.

Magic Bounce Users Not Weak To Moonblast: While fairly rare, Moonblast-resistant Magic Bounce users, such as Registeel, Mega Steelix, and Mega Venusaur, can prevent most Xerneas from supporting its team through any means other than passing a Substitute. However, these Magic Bounce users are generally setup bait for Shell Smash Xerneas unless they run Perish Song.

Coverage Move Users: If Huge Power, Protean, or rare Parental Bond users are carrying coverage to hit Xerneas, careful play must be accomplished to bring either Prankster Giratina or a powerful revenge killer, such as Sucker Punch Mega Gyarados, in and force the offensive Pokemon out. While rare, No Guard foes running Steel- or Poison-type coverage moves necessitate extremely offensive play by revenge killers and Mold Breaker users to have a chance at winning before the opponent does.

Special Walls: Extremely specially bulky Pokemon like Blissey, Eviolite Chansey, Registeel, and the rare RegenVest Primal Kyogre can stomach boosted Judgment from Mold Breaker Xerneas and phaze it or remove its Pixie Plate. Niche Toxic Orb Poison Heal variants of such Pokemon cause even more problems for Mold Breaker Xerneas, as it can't even break past them with sleep luck. In particular, Toxic Orb Magic Guard Ho-Oh is the most effective check to Mold Breaker Xerneas that forgo Steam Eruption, having ample time to force Xerneas out with Whirlwind or Perish Song. Although extremely niche, Mega Venusaur can similarly put a stop to all but rare Fire-type coverage sets thanks to its good bulk, resistances to both Fairy and Water, and immunity to Spore.

Plate Imposter Users: Though extremely niche, Iron Plate, Spooky Plate, and Pixie Plate Imposter users directly counter the most common methods of Imposter-proofing Judgment Xerneas.

Prankster Giratina: Although Giratina must be wary of Moonblast and Taunt, Wonder Guard sweeper Xerneas's other attacks at most 3HKO it, and it can use Encore to punish Xerneas for setting up. While much risker, it can similarly use Encore to lock Mold Breaker Xerneas into a predicted Shell Smash or halt its sweep with Spore, Glare, or Destiny Bond.

Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard.description:
Wonder Guard Xerneas is the most threatening and versatile Wonder Guard user in the metagame thanks to its great defensive and offensive typing, respectable offensive stats, and versatile Speed tier. The first moveslot is extremely customizable, as Xerneas's offensive typing forces out most Magic Bounce users. Stealth Rock provides a way to chip opposing switch-ins, while Glare often nets free turns and can make Shell Smash sweepers more manageable by sharply reducing their Speed. While Recover faces stiff competition from the aforementioned two moves and isn't as easy to justify on Leftovers variants, it is nevertheless an excellent option on Shed Shell sets due to greatly increasing Xerneas's longevity. Taunt prevents Wonder Guard users from phasing Xerneas with Whirlwind and Prankster users from preventing Xerneas from passing Substitutes to teammates; Dark Void generates even more free turns than Glare does, although it's not as accurate and a well-timed Magic Bounce switch in puts Xerneas to sleep instead. Substitute, in tandem with Baton Pass, almost always allows Mold Breaker teammates one extra turn to safely set up, disrupt its check, or heavily damage opposing switch-ins. Baton Pass in itself is also a fantastic option, as Xerneas's offensive presence forces a wide variety of metagame threats out, often generating momentum for its team. Moonblast sets Xerneas apart from most other Wonder Guard users, as it's an amazing STAB option that threatens Giratina, Mega Rayquaza, Mega Mewtwo X lacking coverage for Xerneas, and weakened Mega Latios, allowing Xerneas to force opposing Wonder Guard users in in a wide variety of situations. Leftovers is generally preferred to allow for passive recovery on Xerneas and synergizes well with Substitute; Shed Shell can be run on Recover sets, however, as it prevents Xerneas from being easily removed by offensive Shadow Tag users. The given spread maximizes Xerneas's bulk, as well as Substitute's HP amount, while also forcing Pokemon weak to Fairy-type attacks out, such as Prankster Giratina, Mega Mewtwo X, and Mega Rayquaza; minimum Speed maximizes Baton Pass's effectiveness, as pivoting after the opposing Pokemon moves ensures that the user's switch-in comes in safely.

Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas works best on balance and bulky offense builds with teammates that appreciate being passed a Substitute, as well as defensive teammates that take care of what threatens Xerneas. In particular, the ubiquitous Primal Groudon + Giratina + Wonder Guard Xerneas core works extremely well, as Xerneas can pass Substitutes to Primal Groudon, Primal Groudon forces opposing Giratina in, and Giratina comes in on Huge Power-boosted Poison- and Steel-type attacks while simultaneously Imposter-proofing most Primal Groudon sets. Special Mold Breaker users, especially physically frailer ones like Mega Gengar, Mega Latios, Mega Diancie, and Mega Sceptile, also appreciate Substitute + Baton Pass support from Xerneas. Additionally, Xerneas also fits well on dual Mega Mewtwo X teams, as Mega Mewtwo X dislikes having to risk taking damage from Sucker Punch Mega Gyarados, being chipped by Shadow Tag Slaking and Regigigas, and, on sets lacking Lum Berry, getting burned by Prankster Giratina. Xerneas's most common switch-in in Primal Groudon can be taken advantage of by running defensive checks such as Prankster Giratina or the rare Mega Slowbro, offensive checks like Huge Power Mega Gyarados, or soft-checks that are also good support options like physically defensive Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre. Good revenge-killers to Primal Groudon, such as the aforementioned Mega Gyarados, Imposter Chansey, and Refrigerate Mega Abomasnow, also excel as partners to Xerneas. Mega Gyarados also doubles as a check to the most prevalent Shadow Tag Perish trapper in Lugia. Lastly, No Guard users, which often force opposing Wonder Guard users in, are great partners to Xerneas, as most of the time they provide fodder for Xerneas to use Substitute. Last but not least, Xerneas can be paired with other Xerneas in spam teams if running Recover on the first moveslot, with possible abilities on teammates being Mold Breaker, Huge Power, Pixilate, No Guard, and Prankster.

Mold Breaker Sweeper.description:
Excellent overall stats and a stellar typing both offensively and defensively make Mold Breaker Xerneas a powerful and resilient sweeper. Additionally, Xerneas's good bulk sets it apart from other Fairy-type Mold Breaker users like Mega Diancie and Mega Gardevoir—whose frailty prevents them from effectively making use of defensive options like King's Shield and Recover. Pixie Plate makes Judgment into a powerful STAB attack, OHKOing targets like standard Mega Gyarados after Stealth Rock and all variants of Mega Rayquaza. After Shell Smash, Judgment also OHKOes Mega Gengar after Stealth Rock, always OHKOes bulky Dialga, and has a high chance to OHKO Wonder Guard Xerneas—guaranteed after Stealth Rock. Additionally, +0 Judgment 2HKOes physically defensive Prankster Giratina. King's Shield makes Xerneas much more resilient versus most common revenge killers—namely -ate Speed users like Mega Abomasnow—as well as forcing out offensive Shadow Tag users like Regigigas and Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X. Alternatively, Steam Eruption OHKOes Primal Groudon and Mega Diancie and gives Xerneas very good neutral coverage, with only extremely specially bulky Pokemon like Blissey and Primal Kyogre able to switch in safely after a Shell Smash. Steam Eruption also allows Xerneas to beat Magic Guard + Toxic Orb Ho-Oh, a niche set that is otherwise very difficult for Xerneas to break. Spore gives Xerneas free turns to set up and is preferred over other disruption moves like Dark Void and Taunt, as alongside Pixie Plate Judgment, it makes Xerneas extremely easy to Imposter-proof with a Safety Goggles Ghost-type teammate like Giratina. However, when supported by teammates like No Guard users and Substitute + Baton Pass users, Xerneas has an easier time setting up without Spore. Consequently, a set with both Steam Eruption for coverage and King's Shield for survivability is viable. The given EV Spread outpaces maximum Speed Adamant Primal Groudon. Alternatively, an EV spread of 180 HP / 252 SpA / 76 Spe can be used to maximize overall bulk while still outpacing Deoxys-S after a Shell Smash.

Mold Breaker Xerneas fits best on balance and bulky offense teams as a late-game wincon. Prankster Giratina is perhaps Xerneas's most notable partner; it provides invaluable counterplay versus opposing Shell Smash sweepers like Primal Groudon and is a blanket check to the many powerful physical attackers of the metagame. More importantly, however, is that Prankster Giratina provides a rock-solid answer to Imposter users impersonating Xerneas, thanks to its Ghost-typing blocking Normal-type Judgement and Safety Goggles blocking Spore. Xerneas appreciates a secondary Mold Breaker teammate, as it is unable to adequately pressure most Wonder Guard Pokemon before a boost. Choice Band Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza are particularly notable teammates, as they pressure most of Xerneas's defensive checks, such as Blissey and Ho-Oh. Huge Power Mega Gyarados, Choice Scarf Imposter Chansey, and Refrigerate Mega Abomasnow are also all excellent teammates for their ability to revenge kill a wide variety of threats, but especially Primal Groudon. Xerneas also appreciates teammates that give it opportunities to set up, such as Substitute + Baton Pass users like Mega Manectric, Mega Swampert, and Wonder Guard Xerneas, as well as No Guard teammates like Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Aerodactyl. Shadow Tag users like Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X and Choice Scarf Primal Groudon are also excellent teammates for their ability to trap and KO Xerneas's checks, especially opposing Primal Groudon. Xerneas sets using Pixie Plate Judgment as their sole attack especially appreciate Shadow Tag users's ability to clear the way for its sweep.
